quizzes.question: When you drive in the mountains, you will have to use lower gears to drive safely down grades. Which of these does NOT affect your choice of gears?
quizzes.a: Type of tire tread
quizzes.b: Weight of the load
quizzes.c: Length of the grade
quizzes.explain: Your most important consideration is to select a speed that is not too fast for the: total weight of the vehicle and cargo, length of the grade, steepness of the grade, road conditions, and weather.

quizzes.question: Front end header boards:
quizzes.a: Protect you from your cargo in case of collision
quizzes.b: Block the forward movement of your cargo
quizzes.c: Protect you from your cargo in case of collision and block the forward movement of your cargo
quizzes.explain: Front-end header boards ("headache racks") protect you from your cargo in case of a crash or emergency stop. The front-end structure should block the forward movement of any cargo you carry.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about speed management is true?
quizzes.a: Empty trucks always stop in a shorter distance than fully loaded ones
quizzes.b: As the speed of a vehicle doubles, its stopping distance also doubles
quizzes.c: You should choose a speed that lets you stop within the distance that you can see ahead
quizzes.d: You should always brake during curves
quizzes.explain: You should always be able to stop within the distance you can see ahead.

quizzes.question: There are three types of truck inspections, which one is one of them?
quizzes.a: Pre-trip
quizzes.b: En-route
quizzes.c: Post-trip
quizzes.explain: Pre-trip is an inspection before you leave, en-route occurs during your daily travel, and post-trip happens at the end of your day.

quizzes.question: You are driving on a two-lane road. An oncoming driver drifts into your lane and is headed straight for you. Which of these is generally the best action?
quizzes.a: Hard braking
quizzes.b: Steer into the oncoming lane
quizzes.c: Steer onto the left shoulder
quizzes.explain: If an oncoming driver has drifted into your lane, a move to your right is best. If that driver realizes what has happened, the natural response will be to return to his or her own lane.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements is NOT true about bad weather driving conditions?
quizzes.a: When the temperature drops, bridges will freeze before roadways.
quizzes.b: Driving conditions become more dangerous as the temperature rises to the point where ice begins to melt.
quizzes.c: As rain continues, the road becomes more slippery than it was when the rain began.
quizzes.explain: Right after it starts to rain, the water mixes with oil left on the road by vehicles. This makes the road very slippery. If the rain continues, it will wash the oil away.

quizzes.question: How does the height of the truck's center of gravity affect safe handling?
quizzes.a: Trucks with a high center of gravity can stop faster.
quizzes.b: Trucks with a high center of gravity can roll over at the posted speed limit for a curve.
quizzes.c: Trucks with a high center of gravity can get stuck on railroad tracks.
quizzes.explain: High center of gravity means that much of the load's weight is carried high up off the road. This makes the vehicle top-heavy and easy to roll over.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about cold weather driving is true?
quizzes.a: There is no need to worry about engine overheating when the weather is very cold
quizzes.b: Windshield washer antifreeze should be added to the washer reservoir
quizzes.c: Exhaust system leaks are less dangerous in cold weather
quizzes.d: In snowstorms, wiper blades should be adjusted so that they do not make direct contact with the windshield
quizzes.explain: Use windshield washer antifreeze to prevent freezing of the washer liquid.

quizzes.question: The best drivers are those who watch and prepare for hazards. This is called being
quizzes.a: offensive.
quizzes.b: defensive.
quizzes.c: objective.
quizzes.explain: Always be prepared to act based on your plans. In this way, you will be a prepared, defensive driver who will improve your own safety as well as the safety of all road users.

quizzes.question: Is it safe to add coolant to a coolant recovery tank or coolant overflow tank while the engine is at operating temperature?
quizzes.a: Yes, but only if the coolant recovery container is part of the pressurized system.
quizzes.b: No, never.
quizzes.c: Yes, as long as the engine isn't overheated.
quizzes.explain: Some vehicles have sight glasses, see-through coolant overflow containers, or coolant recovery containers. These permit you to check the coolant level while the engine is hot. If the container is not part of the pressurized system, the cap can be safely removed, and coolant added even when the engine is at operating temperature.

quizzes.question: What are some things to do at an accident scene to prevent another accident?
quizzes.a: Try to get your vehicle to the side of the road.
quizzes.b: If you're stopping to help, park away from the accident.
quizzes.c: Both of the above are correct
quizzes.explain: Protect the accident area: if your vehicle is involved in the accident, try to get it to the side of the road, if you're stopping to help, park away from the accident, put on your flashers, and set out reflective triangles to warn other traffic.

quizzes.question: When driving at night, use your low beams when an oncoming truck is within
quizzes.a: 500 feet.
quizzes.b: 300 feet.
quizzes.c: 400 feet.
quizzes.explain: Dim your lights within 500 feet of an oncoming vehicle and when following another vehicle within 500 feet.

quizzes.question: When driving a commercial truck with a height over 13 feet you should:
quizzes.a: Not worry about the clearance if you stay on the state or federal highways
quizzes.b: Assume all clearances are high enough
quizzes.c: If you aren't sure about the clearance, stop and make sure
quizzes.explain: Hitting overhead objects is a danger. Make sure you always have overhead clearance.

quizzes.question: Do empty trucks have the best braking?
quizzes.a: Yes, but only on wet surfaces.
quizzes.b: No.
quizzes.c: Yes, but only if the trucks are newer than 1998.
quizzes.explain: Empty trucks require greater stopping distances because an empty vehicle has less traction.

quizzes.question: What is black ice?
quizzes.a: A thin layer of ice clear enough that you can see the road underneath it
quizzes.b: Dirty snow
quizzes.c: Rain and snow mixed
quizzes.explain: Black ice is a thin layer that is clear enough that you can see the road underneath it. It makes the road look wet. Any time the temperature is below freezing, and the road looks wet, watch out for black ice.

quizzes.question: You are traveling down a long, steep hill. Your brakes get so hot that they fail. What do you do?
quizzes.a: Downshift
quizzes.b: Pump the brake pedal
quizzes.c: Look for an escape ramp or escape route
quizzes.explain: Know escape ramp locations on your route. Signs show drivers where ramp are located. Escape ramps save lives, equipment and cargo.

quizzes.question: What is the definition of "sleep debt?"
quizzes.a: The cumulative effect of not getting enough sleep
quizzes.b: The money you owe hotels after resting there
quizzes.c: The amount of sleep you get each day
quizzes.explain: If you don't sleep enough, you "owe" more sleep to yourself. This debt can only be paid off by sleeping. You can't overcome it with willpower, and it won't go away by itself. The average person needs seven or eight hours of sleep every 24 hours.

quizzes.question: To prevent shifting, there should be at least one tie down for every _____ feet of cargo.
quizzes.explain: Cargo should have at least one tie-down for each ten feet of cargo. Make sure you have enough tiedowns to meet this need.

quizzes.question: For your safety, when setting out reflective triangles you should:
quizzes.a: Carry the triangles at your side
quizzes.b: Hold the triangles between your body and oncoming traffic
quizzes.c: Keep them out of sight while you walk to the spot where you set them out
quizzes.explain: When putting out the triangles, hold them between yourself and the oncoming traffic for your own safety, so other drivers can see you.

quizzes.question: According to the driver's manual, why should you limit the use of your horn?
quizzes.a: It can startle other drivers
quizzes.b: It wears down the battery
quizzes.c: The horn is not a good way to let others know you are there
quizzes.explain: Your horn can let others know you're there. It can help to avoid a crash. Use your horn when needed. However, it can startle others and could be dangerous when used unnecessarily.

quizzes.question: What might happen if you swing wide to the left before you turn right?
quizzes.a: Someone might try to pass you on your right.
quizzes.b: You might damage your leaf springs.
quizzes.c: Someone might try to pass you on your left.
quizzes.d: All of the above might happen.
quizzes.explain: If you are driving a truck or bus that cannot make the right turn without swinging into another lane, turn wide as you complete the turn. Don't turn wide to the left as you start the turn. A following driver may think you are turning left and try to pass you on the right.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about certain types of cargo is true?
quizzes.a: Unstable loads such as hanging meat or livestock require extra caution on curves
quizzes.b: Oversize loads can be hauled without special permits during times when the roads are not busy
quizzes.c: Loads that consist of liquids in bulk do not present vehicle handling problems because they are usually very heavy
quizzes.explain: Hanging meat can be a very unstable load with a high center of gravity, particular caution is needed on sharp curves such as off ramps and on ramps. Livestock can move around in a trailer, causing unsafe handling, and special care is necessary because livestock can lean on curves.

quizzes.question: If you have a hazardous fire, you should?
quizzes.a: Use dirt to put it out
quizzes.b: Call the proper authorities
quizzes.c: Use the fire extinguisher
quizzes.explain: When you discover a fire, call for help. You may use the fire extinguisher to keep minor truck fires from spreading to cargo before firefighters arrive.

quizzes.question: What are some advantages of going right instead of left around an obstacle?
quizzes.a: You can avoid a head-on collision.
quizzes.b: Someone may be passing to the left.
quizzes.c: Both of these answers are correct.
quizzes.explain: If an oncoming driver has drifted into your lane, a move to your right is best. If that driver realizes what has happened, the natural response will be to return to their own lane. No one is likely to be driving on the shoulder, but someone may be passing you on the left.

quizzes.question: As your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) rises, what happens?
quizzes.a: You can sober up in less time.
quizzes.b: Judgment and self-control are affected.
quizzes.c: You see more clearly how alcohol is affecting you.
quizzes.explain: Alcohol affects more and more of the brain as BAC builds up. The first part of the brain affected controls judgment and self-control.

quizzes.question: How can you determine if your truck is equipped with an antilock braking system (ABS)?
quizzes.a: Check if your vehicle was manufactured after March 1, 1998. (Such vehicles are required to have the panel light.)
quizzes.b: Check for a yellow ABS malfunction lamp on the instrument panel.
quizzes.c: Look for wheel speed sensor wires that are coming from the rear of your brakes.
quizzes.d: All of the above can work.
quizzes.explain: Most vehicles now have an ABS light on the instrument panel that will light up briefly when the vehicle is started to alert you that the vehicle has ABS, you can check to see if the vehicle was built on or after March 1, 1998, or you can check for wires from your brakes.

quizzes.question: Always try to back toward the driver's side because
quizzes.a: you can see better, watching the vehicle's rear from the side window.
quizzes.b: it's more comfortable for turning your neck.
quizzes.c: your truck will probably pull toward the driver's side.
quizzes.d: all of the above are true.
quizzes.explain: Back to the driver's side so that you can see better. Backing toward the right side is very dangerous because you can't see as well. If you back and turn toward the driver's side, you can watch the rear of your vehicle by looking out the side window.

quizzes.question: Where should you place your warning devices if you do you have to stop on a one-way road or divided highway?
quizzes.a: 10 feet, 100 feet, and 200 feet toward approaching traffic
quizzes.b: 50 feet, 100 feet, and 150 feet toward approaching traffic
quizzes.c: 100 feet, 200 feet, and 300 feet toward approaching traffic
quizzes.d: 20 feet, 50 feet, and 100 feet toward approaching traffic
quizzes.explain: If you must stop on or by a one-way or divided highway, place warning devices 10 feet, 100 feet, and 200 feet toward the approaching traffic.

quizzes.question: Whether you load and secure your load yourself, you are responsible for:
quizzes.a: Inspecting your cargo
quizzes.b: Recognizing overloads and poorly balanced weight
quizzes.c: Knowing your cargo is securely tied down and covered
quizzes.explain: As part of your Vehicle inspection, make sure the truck is not overloaded and the cargo is balanced and secured properly.

quizzes.question: You are checking your brakes and suspension system for a pre-trip inspection. What are you looking for?
quizzes.a: Brake shoes must not be worn dangerously thin, missing, or broken.
quizzes.b: Brake pads should not have oil, grease, or brake fluid on them.
quizzes.c: Both of the above are correct.
quizzes.explain: Brake linings must not be loose or soaked with oil or grease, and must not be dangerously thin, broken, or missing.

quizzes.question: Under-loaded front axles can cause the following:
quizzes.a: Poor traction
quizzes.b: Too much play in the steering wheel is not a problem
quizzes.c: Damage to the tires
quizzes.explain: Under-loaded front axles can make the steering axle weight too light to steer safely.

quizzes.question: Name two situations in which the legal maximum weights may not be safe to haul.
quizzes.a: During bad weather; in mountains
quizzes.b: At night; in heavy traffic
quizzes.c: Through tunnels; over bridges
quizzes.explain: During bad weather or in mountains, it may not be safe to operate at legal maximum weights. Take this into account before driving.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about backing a heavy truck is true?
quizzes.a: You should avoid backing whenever you can
quizzes.b: When you use a helper, they should use a clear spoken signal
quizzes.c: It is safer to back toward the right side of the vehicle than toward the driver's side
quizzes.explain: Because you cannot see everything behind your vehicle, backing is always dangerous. Avoid backing whenever you can. When you have to back, here are a few simple safety rules: Start in the proper position, look at your path, use mirrors on both sides, back slowly, back and turn toward the driver's side whenever possible, and use a helper with clear hand signals whenever possible.

quizzes.question: What is the definition of a hazard?
quizzes.a: A road user or road condition that presents a possible danger
quizzes.b: Something you can safely ignore
quizzes.c: Something you can easily avoid
quizzes.explain: A hazard is any road condition or other road user (driver, bicyclist, pedestrian) that is a possible danger.

quizzes.question: You do not have a Hazardous Materials Endorsement on your commercial driver's license. You can drive a truck hauling hazardous materials when
quizzes.a: someone who has the Hazardous Materials Endorsement rides with you.
quizzes.b: the vehicle does not require placards.
quizzes.c: the cargo will be transported less than 100 miles.
quizzes.explain: You can drive a vehicle that carries hazardous materials if it does not require placards. If it requires placards, you cannot drive it unless your driver license has the hazardous materials endorsement

quizzes.question: Which of these can cause a fire?
quizzes.a: Under-inflated tires
quizzes.b: Loose fuel connections
quizzes.c: Electrical short-circuits
quizzes.explain: Under-inflated tires, loose fuel connections, and electrical short-circuits can all lead to fires.

quizzes.question: You are driving a new truck with a manual transmission.  What gear will you probably have to use to take a long downhill grade?
quizzes.a: The same gear you would use to climb the hill
quizzes.b: A lower gear than you would use to climb the hill
quizzes.c: A higher gear than you would use to climb the hill
quizzes.explain: Drivers of modern trucks may have to use lower gears going down a hill than would be required to go up the hill.

quizzes.question: You are driving a 40-foot truck at 35 mph. Driving conditions are ideal. What is the least amount of space that you should keep in front of your truck to be safe?
quizzes.a: 2 seconds
quizzes.b: 3 seconds
quizzes.c: 4 seconds
quizzes.explain: One good rule says you need at least one second for each 10 feet of vehicle length at speeds below 40 mph. At greater speeds, you must add 1 second for safety.

quizzes.question: If you are stopped at a roadside rest and found to have a BAC or blood alcohol concentration of .02 you will:
quizzes.a: Be placed out of service for 72 hours
quizzes.b: Be placed out of service for 24 hours
quizzes.c: Be placed out of service for 48 hours
quizzes.explain: You will be put out-of-service for 24 hours if you have any detectable amount of alcohol under .04%.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about escape ramps is true?
quizzes.a: They are used to stop vehicles that lose their brakes on downhill grades
quizzes.b: They are designed to prevent injury to drivers and passengers
quizzes.c: They protect equipment and cargo from severe damage
quizzes.d: All answers are correct and true
quizzes.explain: Escape ramps are made to stop runaway vehicles safely without injuring drivers and passengers. Escape ramps save lives, equipment and cargo.

quizzes.question: Whenever you stop for a break during your trip, you should
quizzes.a: call in and check with dispatch.
quizzes.b: check critical items such as the tires, brakes, and cargo tie-downs.
quizzes.c: check critical items such as the windshield wipers, heater, and defroster.
quizzes.explain: For an e-route inspection: check the tires, wheels, and truck body for signs of heat whenever you stop during a trip.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about engine overheating is true?
quizzes.a: If your engine overheats within 20 miles of the end of your trip, you should complete the trip and then check the problem
quizzes.b: You should never shut off an overheated engine until it cools
quizzes.c: You should never remove the radiator cap on a pressurized system
quizzes.d: Antifreeze is not needed when the weather is warm
quizzes.explain: Never remove the radiator cap or any part of the pressurized system until the system has cooled. Steam and boiling water can spray under pressure and cause severe burns.

quizzes.question: Which of these is a good rule to follow when using a fire extinguisher?
quizzes.a: Keep it as close to the fire as possible
quizzes.b: Stay downwind of the fire
quizzes.c: Aim at the base of the fire
quizzes.explain: Here are some rules to follow in putting out a fire: When using the extinguisher stay as far away from the fire as possible and aim at the source or base of the fire not up in the flames.

quizzes.question: To avoid a crash, you had to drive onto the right shoulder. You are now driving at 40 mph on the shoulder. How should you move back onto the pavement?
quizzes.a: Come to a complete stop if possible, before steering back onto the pavement
quizzes.b: Brake hard to slow the vehicle then, steer sharply onto the pavement
quizzes.c: Keep moving at the present speed and steer very gently back onto the pavement
quizzes.explain: If the shoulder is clear, stay on it until your vehicle has come to a stop. Signal and check your mirrors before pulling back onto the road.

quizzes.question: Which of the following statements about tank trucks is true?
quizzes.a: The term "tank vehicle" refers only to those vehicles having a permanently attached tank.
quizzes.b: Special skills are required to haul liquid tanks.
quizzes.c: All tank vehicles have some sort of bulkhead or baffle.
quizzes.explain: Hauling liquids in tanks requires special skills because of the high center of gravity and liquid movement.

quizzes.question: During a pre-trip inspection you discover an exhaust leak or power steering leak, you should:
quizzes.a: Note the problem and continue your route
quizzes.b: Go home because shouldn't drive the vehicle this way
quizzes.c: Report the problem and arrange for another vehicle to use
quizzes.explain: If you find anything unsafe during the Vehicle inspection, get it fixed, or use a different vehicle. Federal and state laws forbid operating an unsafe vehicle.

quizzes.question: You should avoid driving through deep puddles or flowing water. But if you do you have to, which of these steps can help keep your brakes working?
quizzes.a: Driving through quickly
quizzes.b: Gently pressing the brake pedal while driving through the water
quizzes.c: Applying hard pressure on both the brake pedal and accelerator after coming out of the water
quizzes.explain: Gently put on the brakes. This presses linings against brake drums or discs and keeps mud, silt, sand, and water from getting in.

quizzes.question: Where should your ignition key be during your pre-trip inspection?
quizzes.a: In your pocket
quizzes.b: On the dashboard
quizzes.c: In the ignition
quizzes.explain: Make sure the parking brake is set, turn off the engine, and take the key with you when you are not in the cab during your vehicle inspection.

quizzes.question: What happens when tar heats up?
quizzes.a: It will give the tires more traction
quizzes.b: It makes the road more slippery
quizzes.c: It will make the tires stick to the road
quizzes.explain: Tar in the road pavement frequently rises to the surface in very hot weather. Spots where tar "bleeds" to the surface are very slippery.

quizzes.question: Which of the following is most likely to cause a truck fire?
quizzes.a: Short circuits and loose connections
quizzes.b: Spilled fuel cleaned up quickly and properly
quizzes.c: Driver smoking in a rest area
quizzes.explain: The following are some causes of vehicle fires: Spilled fuel not properly cleaned up; improper use of flares; under-inflated tires and duals that touch; short circuits due to damaged insulation or loose connections; driver smoking in or around the vehicle; improper fueling and loose fuel connections; flammable cargo, improperly sealed or loaded cargo, with poor ventilation.

quizzes.question: Cargo that can shift should have at least __ tie-down(s).
quizzes.explain: No matter how small the cargo, it should have at least two tie-downs.

quizzes.question: Name two causes of fires.
quizzes.a: Underinflated tires and duals that touch
quizzes.b: Tight turns and gravel roads
quizzes.c: Driver smoking and following too close
quizzes.explain: The following are some causes of vehicle fires: spilled fuel, improper use of flares, under-inflated tires, duals that touch, short circuits, loose connections, improper fueling, loose fuel connections, flammable cargo that is improperly sealed or loaded cargo or has poor ventilation.

quizzes.question: Which of these is NOT part of the basic method for shifting up?
quizzes.a: Releasing the clutch and pressing the accelerator at the same time
quizzes.b: Releasing the clutch
quizzes.c: Pushing in the clutch and shifting into a higher gear at the same time
quizzes.d: Accelerating while pressing the clutch and turning toward the driver's side
quizzes.explain: Basic method for shifting up: release accelerator, push in clutch and shift to neutral at the same time. Release clutch. Let engine and gears slow down to the rpm required for the next gear. Push in clutch and shift to the higher gear at the same time. Release clutch and press accelerator at the same time.

quizzes.question: When you are passing another truck, pedestrian, or bicyclist, you should assume that they
quizzes.a: see you.
quizzes.b: may move into your traffic lane.
quizzes.c: will move out of your lane of traffic.
quizzes.explain: Whenever you are about to pass a vehicle, pedestrian, or bicyclist, assume they don't see you, or that they could suddenly move in front of you. When it is legal, tap the horn lightly or, at night, flash your lights from low to high beam and back. Drive carefully enough to avoid a crash even if they don't see or hear you.

quizzes.question: Which of these pieces of emergency equipment should always be carried in your truck?
quizzes.a: Fire extinguisher
quizzes.b: Spare electrical fuses if the vehicle uses them
quizzes.c: Warning devices for parked vehicles
quizzes.explain: Vehicles should be equipped with emergency equipment: Fire extinguisher, spare electrical fuses unless the vehicle is equipped with circuit breakers, and warning devices for parked vehicles.

quizzes.question: Cargo inspections:
quizzes.a: Not the responsibility of the driver
quizzes.b: Should be performed after every break you take while driving
quizzes.c: Are only needed if hazardous materials are being hauled
quizzes.d: Should be performed every six hours or 300 miles
quizzes.explain: Re-check the cargo and securing devices as often as necessary during a trip to keep the load secure. You need to inspect again: after you have driven for 3 hours or 150 miles, and after every break you take during driving.

quizzes.question: An en-route inspection should include checking:
quizzes.a: Cargo doors and cargo securement
quizzes.b: Tire temperature
quizzes.c: Brake temperature
quizzes.explain: For an en-route Inspection. Check the, tires, wheels, and truck body for signs of heat whenever you stop during a trip. Also check for cargo securement at each stop.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about speed management is true?
quizzes.a: On packed snow, you should reduce your speed by about 1/2.
quizzes.b: On a wet road, you should reduce your speed by about 1/3.
quizzes.c: Both of the above answers are true.
quizzes.explain: Wet roads can double stopping distance. You should drive slower to be able to stop in the same distance as on a dry road. Reduce speed by about one-third on a wet road. On packed snow, reduce speed by a half, or more. If the surface is icy, reduce speed to a crawl and stop driving as soon as you can safely do so.

quizzes.question: What is the first thing you should try to do if your brakes fail while driving downhill?
quizzes.a: Shut off the engine.
quizzes.b: Get off the road as soon as possible.
quizzes.c: Call or radio for help.
quizzes.explain: Escape ramps have been built on many steep mountain downgrades. Escape ramps are made to stop runaway vehicles safely without injuring drivers and passengers. Escape ramps use a long bed of loose, soft material to slow a runaway vehicle, sometimes in combination with an upgrade.

quizzes.question: If you do you have to stop on a road or the shoulder of any road, you do you have to put out your emergency warning devices within
quizzes.a: five minutes.
quizzes.b: fifteen minutes.
quizzes.c: ten minutes.
quizzes.explain: If you must stop on a road or the shoulder of any road, you must put out your emergency warning devices within ten minutes.

quizzes.question: Convex curved mirrors
quizzes.a: show a wider area than flat mirrors.
quizzes.b: make objects appear larger than they really are.
quizzes.c: make objects appear closer than they really are.
quizzes.explain: Many large vehicles have curved mirrors that show a wider area than flat mirrors. This is often helpful, but everything appears smaller in a convex mirror than it would if you were looking at it directly. Things also seem farther away than they really are.

quizzes.question: Brake fade:
quizzes.a: Can be caused by the brakes becoming too hot
quizzes.b: Can be corrected by letting up on the brakes for 1-2 seconds and then reapply them
quizzes.c: Only occurs with drum brakes
quizzes.explain: Brake fade results from excessive heat causing chemical changes in the brake lining, which reduce friction, and also causing expansion of the brake drums

quizzes.question: How long does it take a typical tractor-trailer to clear a single railroad track? A double railroad track?
quizzes.a: It takes 14 seconds to clear a single track and more than 15 seconds to clear a double track.
quizzes.b: It takes 10 seconds to clear a single track and more than 12 seconds to clear a double track.
quizzes.c: It takes 7 seconds to clear a single track and more than 10 seconds to clear a double track.
quizzes.explain: It takes a typical tractor trailer unit at least 14 seconds to clear a single track and more than 15 seconds to clear a double track.

quizzes.question: When do you check your mirrors for a lane change?
quizzes.a: Before and after signaling the change
quizzes.b: After starting and after completing the lane change
quizzes.c: Both of the above
quizzes.explain: You need to check your mirrors to make sure no one is alongside you or about to pass you. Check your mirrors: before you change lanes, after you have signaled, right after you start the lane change, and after you complete the lane change.

quizzes.question: When do you have to you wear a seat belt?
quizzes.a: Whenever you are hauling hazardous materials
quizzes.b: Whenever you're driving a CMV
quizzes.c: Only in states where the law requires it
quizzes.explain: Federal regulations require the driver and all passengers in a moving CMV to wear seat belts unless, the vehicle isn't equipped with them.

quizzes.question: Which of these is NOT something you should do if your headlights are not working properly?
quizzes.a: Adjust the headlights.
quizzes.b: Leave your high beams on.
quizzes.c: Clean the headlights.
quizzes.explain: Use high beams when it is safe and legal to do so. Use them when you are not within 500 feet of another vehicle.

quizzes.question: Stab braking should not be used on trucks with
quizzes.a: air brakes.
quizzes.b: spring brakes.
quizzes.c: anti-lock brakes.
quizzes.explain: In stab braking you deliberately keep locking and unlocking the wheels, and ABS is a computerized system that keeps your wheels from locking up during hard brake applications. Do not use Stab braking with ABS, use controlled braking instead.

quizzes.question: When approaching a curve, you should:
quizzes.a: Downshift while in the curve
quizzes.b: Downshift as you come out of the curve
quizzes.c: Downshift before entering the curve and accelerate slightly as you go through it
quizzes.d: Downshift at any time, it doesn't make a difference
quizzes.explain: Slow down to a safe speed, and downshift to the right gear before entering the curve. This lets you use some power through the curve to help the vehicle be more stable while turning. It also allows you to speed up as soon as you are out of the curve.

quizzes.question: On which fires can you use the ABC fire extinguisher?
quizzes.a: Electrical fires
quizzes.b: Burning tires or cloth
quizzes.c: Both of the above
quizzes.explain: The ABC type is designed to work on electrical fires, burning liquids, wood, paper, and cloth as well.

quizzes.question: The road you are driving on becomes very slippery due to glare ice, which of these is a good thing to do in such a situation?
quizzes.a: Stop driving and park where it is safe to do so
quizzes.b: Downshift to stop
quizzes.c: Apply the brakes often to keep the linings dry
quizzes.explain: If the surface is icy, reduce speed to a crawl and stop driving as soon as you can safely do so.

quizzes.question: If you are confronted by an aggressive driver, what should you do?
quizzes.a: Avoid eye contact.
quizzes.b: Call the police from your cell phone if you can do it safely.
quizzes.c: Ignore rude gestures and refuse to react negatively.
quizzes.explain: First and foremost, make every attempt to get out of their way. Do not challenge them by speeding up, avoid eye contact, ignore gestures and refuse to react to them, and report aggressive drivers to the appropriate authorities.

quizzes.question: Which of these is a good driving rule for work zones?
quizzes.a: Drive slowly
quizzes.b: Turn on you flashers / hazard lights
quizzes.c: Use your brake lights to warn drivers behind you
quizzes.explain: Driving in work zones require extra care, and because of the workers risking their lives to keep the road in good condition you should drive slowly, use your hazards, and use your brake lights as communication devices.

quizzes.question: When the engine is at operating RPM's, the _____ pressure is built up from 80 to 100 PSI within 45 seconds in a dual system?
quizzes.a: Oil
quizzes.b: Air
quizzes.c: Temp
quizzes.explain: When the engine is at operating rpms, the air pressure should build from 85 to 100 psi within 45 seconds in dual air systems.

quizzes.question: How do you test hydraulic brakes for leaks?
quizzes.a: Move the vehicle slowly and see if it stops when the brake is applied
quizzes.b: Measure the free play in the pedal with a ruler
quizzes.c: With the vehicle stopped, pump the pedal three times; apply firm pressure for 5 seconds, then hold and see if the pedal moves
quizzes.explain: If the vehicle has hydraulic brakes, pump the brake pedal three times. Then apply firm pressure to the pedal and hold for five seconds. The pedal should not move. If it does, there may be a leak or other problem.

quizzes.question: Which of the following best describes how sleep debt can be paid off?
quizzes.a: It will go away by itself over a period of time.
quizzes.b: It can only be paid off by sleeping.
quizzes.c: It can be overcome with willpower and non-sleep aids.
quizzes.explain: If you don't sleep enough, you "owe" more sleep to yourself. This debt can only be paid off by sleeping.

quizzes.question: What effects can wet brakes cause?
quizzes.a: Brakes can grab or become weak.
quizzes.b: Brakes can work better.
quizzes.c: Your foot can get tired.
quizzes.explain: Water in the brakes can cause the brakes to be weak, to apply unevenly, or to grab. This can cause lack of braking power, wheel lockups, pulling to one side or the other, and jackknife if you pull a trailer.

quizzes.question: What do you do if you get stuck on the railroad tracks?
quizzes.a: Stay in your vehicle.
quizzes.b: Scream for help.
quizzes.c: Get out of your vehicle and away from the tracks.
quizzes.explain: If for any reason you get stuck on the tracks, get out of the vehicle and away from the tracks. Check signposts or signal housing at the crossing for emergency notification information. Call 911  and give the location of the crossing using all identifiable landmarks, especially the DOT number, if posted.

quizzes.question: Why is it important to use a helper when backing?
quizzes.a: Because people feel more comfortable when you do
quizzes.b: Because you have blind spots
quizzes.c: Because you are providing a job for someone else
quizzes.d: For all of the above reasons
quizzes.explain: There are blind spots you can't see. That's why a helper is important. The helper should stand near the back of your vehicle where you can see the helper.

quizzes.question: Retarders:
quizzes.a: Can cause the vehicle to skid when the road is slippery
quizzes.b: Work better at very low rpm's
quizzes.c: Allow you to disconnect the steering axle brakes
quizzes.d: Cannot be used on interstate highways
quizzes.explain: When your drive wheels have poor traction, the retarder may cause them to skid. Therefore, you should turn the retarder off whenever the road is wet, icy, or snow covered.

quizzes.question: You are checking your brakes and suspension system for a pre-trip inspection. Which of these statements is true?
quizzes.a: Brake shoes should not be worn dangerously thin
quizzes.b: Brake pads should not have brake fluid on them
quizzes.c: One missing leaf in a leaf spring can be dangerous
quizzes.d: All answers are correct and true
quizzes.explain: Brake pads should not be dangerously thin or have fluid on them, and a missing leaf in the leaf spring suspension is very dangerous.

quizzes.question: What does "communicating" mean in safe driving?
quizzes.a: Using hand signals
quizzes.b: Driving brightly colored vehicles
quizzes.c: Letting other drivers know you're there
quizzes.explain: Other drivers can't know what you are going to do until you tell them. Signaling what you intend to do is important for safety. Also, other drivers may not notice your vehicle even when it's in plain sight. To help prevent accidents, let them know you're there.

quizzes.question: Which of the following provide extra gears on some trucks?
quizzes.a: Multi-speed rear axles
quizzes.b: Auxiliary transmissions
quizzes.c: Both of the above
quizzes.explain: Multi-speed rear axles and auxiliary transmissions are used on many vehicles to provide extra gears. You usually control them by a selector knob or switch on the gearshift lever of the main transmission.

quizzes.question: A stale green light means?
quizzes.a: The light ahead just turned green
quizzes.b: The light ahead has been green for quite a while
quizzes.c: The light ahead has just turned red
quizzes.explain: A stale green light is a traffic light that is green when you first see it, thus you do not know how long it has been green - so we have to assume it will change at any moment.

quizzes.question: Which of these is NOT caused by rough acceleration?
quizzes.a: Tire damage
quizzes.b: Mechanical damage
quizzes.c: Damage to the coupling
quizzes.explain: Rough acceleration can cause mechanical damage. When pulling a trailer, rough acceleration can damage the coupling.

quizzes.question: The basic two reasons to cover your cargo are 1. to protect the cargo from the weather and 2.
quizzes.a: Protect people from spilled cargo
quizzes.b: Protect the roadway from spilled cargo
quizzes.c: Protect vehicle following you from spilled cargo
quizzes.explain: There are two basic reasons for covering cargo: to protect people from spilled cargo, and to protect the cargo from weather. Spill protection is a safety requirement in many states. Be familiar with the laws in the states you drive in.

quizzes.question: When driving on grades, which of these is the best choice for a safe speed?
quizzes.a: Based on your vehicle and its cargo, select a speed that is safe within the posted limit.
quizzes.b: Follow the vehicle in front of you.
quizzes.c: If you have a light load, go faster than you would with a heavy load.
quizzes.explain: Your most important consideration is to select a speed that is not too fast for the: total weight of the vehicle and cargo, length of the grade, steepness of the grade, road conditions, and weather.

quizzes.question: Every time you park your truck and shut the engine off, you should
quizzes.a: turn the steering wheel as far to the left as you can.
quizzes.b: leave it in gear (if it has a manual transmission).
quizzes.c: apply the parking brake.
quizzes.explain: Never leave your vehicle unattended without applying the parking brakes or chocking the wheels. Your vehicle might roll away and cause injury and damage.

quizzes.question: Which of these is NOT a good rule to follow when caring for the injured at an accident scene?
quizzes.a: Move severely injured persons if there is a danger due to fire or passing traffic.
quizzes.b: If a qualified person is helping them, stay out of the way unless asked to assist.
quizzes.c: Allow injured persons to become chilled or overheated.
quizzes.explain: If a qualified person is at the accident and helping the injured, stay out of the way unless asked to assist. Otherwise, do the best you can to help any injured parties: don't move a severely injured person unless the danger of fire or passing traffic, stop heavy bleeding by applying, and keep the injured person warm.

quizzes.question: Letting the air out of hot tires
quizzes.a: is a good idea because the extra pressure will be relieved.
quizzes.b: will have no effect at all.
quizzes.c: will cool them down. You will be able to continue your trip sooner.
quizzes.d: is a bad idea because when the tires cool off, the pressure will be too low.
quizzes.explain: Air pressure increases with temperature. Do not let air out or the pressure will be too low when the tires cool off.

quizzes.question: To transport cargo safely, which of the following are you NOT responsible for?
quizzes.a: Recognizing possible overloads
quizzes.b: Ensuring the freshness of sealed cargo
quizzes.c: Making sure that cargo is properly secured
quizzes.explain: You cannot inspect sealed loads, but you should check that you don't exceed gross weight and axle weight limits, and that the cargo is properly secured.

quizzes.question: When approaching a traffic light that has been green for a long time, you should
quizzes.a: start to slow down so you will be ready to stop.
quizzes.b: continue at your current speed.
quizzes.c: accelerate so you get through the light.
quizzes.explain: If a traffic light has been green for a long time it will probably change before you get there. Start slowing down and be ready to stop.

quizzes.question: Your brakes can get wet when you drive through a heavy rain. What can this cause when the brakes are applied?
quizzes.a: Wheel lockup
quizzes.b: Trailer jackknife
quizzes.c: Lack of braking power
quizzes.explain: When driving in heavy rain or deep standing water, your brakes will get wet. Water in the brakes can cause the brakes to be weak, to apply unevenly, or to grab. This can cause lack of braking power, wheel lockups, pulling to one side or the other, and jackknife if you pull a trailer.

quizzes.question: Some traffic emergencies may require you to leave the road. Which of these is a good thing to remember?
quizzes.a: If you must leave the road, try to get all wheels off the pavement or at least one side of vehicle's tires off the road
quizzes.b: Brake gently to avoid skidding
quizzes.c: Use hard braking if you are moving at a speed greater that 20-mph
quizzes.d: Most shoulders will not support a large vehicle
quizzes.explain: In some emergencies, you may have to drive off the road. It may be less risky than facing a collision with another vehicle. Most shoulders are strong enough to support the weight of a large vehicle and, therefore, offer an available escape route.

quizzes.question: As your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) rises, what happens?
quizzes.a: You can sober up in less time.
quizzes.b: Judgment and self-control are affected.
quizzes.c: You see more clearly how alcohol is affecting you.
quizzes.explain: Alcohol affects more and more of the brain as BAC builds up. The first part of the brain affected controls judgment and self-control.

quizzes.question: "Reaction distance" is the distance traveled from the time:
quizzes.a: The eyes see a hazard to the time the brain knows that it is a hazard
quizzes.b: The brain tells the foot to push the brake pedal to the time the foot pushes the pedal
quizzes.c: The eyes see a hazard to the time the foot pushes the brake pedal
quizzes.d: The brake pedal is pressed to the time the brakes begin to slow the vehicle
quizzes.explain: ¾ second to 1 second. At 55 mph this accounts for 61 feet traveled.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about downshifting is true?
quizzes.a: When you downshift for a curve, you should do so before you enter the curve
quizzes.b: When you downshift for a hill, you should do so after you start down the hill
quizzes.c: When double clutching, you should let the RPM's decrease while the clutch is released, and the shift lever is in neutral
quizzes.explain: Slow down to a safe speed, and downshift to the right gear before entering the curve. This lets you use some power through the curve to help the vehicle be more stable while turning. It also allows you to speed up as soon as you are out of the curve.

quizzes.question: When a doctor prescribes medication for you and you know you will be driving, you should
quizzes.a: take the medication as well as other medications to keep you alert.
quizzes.b: ask the doctor if the medication will affect your ability to drive.
quizzes.c: take the medication but stop taking it if you notice it is affecting your driving.
quizzes.explain: Possession and use of any drug given to a driver by a doctor is permitted if the doctor informs the driver that it will not affect safe driving ability.

quizzes.question: What do you do before driving if you are sleepy?
quizzes.a: Take some caffeine pills.
quizzes.b: Drink some coffee.
quizzes.c: Get some sleep.
quizzes.explain: The average person needs seven or eight hours of sleep every 24 hours. Leaving on a long trip when you're already tired is dangerous. If you have a long trip scheduled, make sure that you get enough sleep before you go.

quizzes.question: The purpose of a baffle is to:
quizzes.a: Separate the load
quizzes.b: Control the load surge
quizzes.c: To keep expansion of load down
quizzes.explain: Baffled liquid tanks have bulkheads in them with holes that let the liquid flow through. The baffles help to control the forward and backward liquid surge. Side-to-side surge can still occur.

quizzes.question: Every time you park your truck and shut the engine off you should:
quizzes.a: Turn the steering wheel as far to the left as you can
quizzes.b: Apply the parking brake
quizzes.c: Leave it in gear
quizzes.explain: Never leave your vehicle unattended without applying the parking brakes or chocking the wheels. Your vehicle might roll away and cause injury and damage

quizzes.question: Under federal regulations, if a truck is carrying a load that is more than two feet wide and extends more than four feet beyond the rear of the truck, _________ do you have to be placed at the extreme end of the load.
quizzes.a: two red flags
quizzes.b: two red lights
quizzes.c: one red flag
quizzes.explain: If the load is more than two feet wide and extends more than four feet behind the rear of the vehicle, two square red flags should be placed at the end of the load.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about managing space is true?
quizzes.a: Many accidents are caused by drivers keeping too much space in front of their vehicles
quizzes.b: Smaller vehicles require more space to stop than larger ones
quizzes.c: When the road is slippery you should keep more space in front of your vehicle
quizzes.explain: Remember that when the road is slippery, you need much more space to stop, and should keep more space in front of your vehicle.

quizzes.question: The purpose of retarders is to
quizzes.a: help prevent skids and reduce brake wear.
quizzes.b: apply extra braking power to the non-drive axles.
quizzes.c: help slow the vehicle while driving and reduce brake wear.
quizzes.explain: Retarders help slow a vehicle, reducing the need for using your brakes. They reduce brake wear and give you another way to slow down.

quizzes.question: The new BAC or blood alcohol concentration for commercial drivers to be considered intoxicated when driving a commercial truck is:
quizzes.explain: It is illegal to operate a CMV if your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is .04% or more. If you operate a CMV, you shall be deemed to have given your consent to alcohol testing.

quizzes.question: An antilock braking system (ABS) will
quizzes.a: keep your wheels from locking when you brake hard.
quizzes.b: let you drive faster.
quizzes.c: increase your vehicle's stopping power.
quizzes.explain: ABS is a computerized system that keeps your wheels from locking up during hard brake applications.

quizzes.question: Do empty trucks have the best braking?
quizzes.a: Yes, but only on wet surfaces.
quizzes.b: No.
quizzes.c: Yes, but only if the trucks are newer than 1998.
quizzes.explain: Empty trucks require greater stopping distances because an empty vehicle has less traction.

quizzes.question: You are driving on a straight, level highway at 50 mph.  There are no trucks in front of you. Suddenly a tire blows out on your truck. What do you do first?
quizzes.a: Stay off the brake until the vehicle slows down on its own
quizzes.b: Quickly steer onto the shoulder
quizzes.c: Begin light braking
quizzes.explain: It's natural to want to brake in an emergency, however, braking when a tire has failed could cause loss of control. Once the vehicle has slowed down brake very gently, pull off the road, and stop.

quizzes.question: How far ahead should you be looking while driving in town?
quizzes.a: As far ahead as you can see
quizzes.b: 1 block
quizzes.c: 2 blocks
quizzes.explain: Most good drivers look at least 12 to 15 seconds ahead. That means looking ahead the distance you will travel in 12 to 15 seconds. At lower speeds, that's about one block.

quizzes.question: Converter dollies built on or after March 1, 1998 are required to have anti-lock brakes. These dollies will have
quizzes.a: a yellow malfunction lamp in the center of the dolly.
quizzes.b: a yellow malfunction lamp on the right side of the dolly.
quizzes.c: a yellow malfunction lamp on the left side of the dolly.
quizzes.explain: Converter dollies built on or after March 1, 1998, are required to have antilock brakes. These dollies will have a yellow lamp on the left side of the dolly.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about marking a stopped truck is true?
quizzes.a: If a hill or curve keeps drivers behind you from seeing the vehicle within 500 feet, the rear reflective triangle should be moved back down the road to give adequate warning
quizzes.b: You do not need to put out reflective triangles unless the vehicle will be stopped for 30 minutes or more
quizzes.c: The vehicles taillights should be kept on warning other drivers
quizzes.explain: If line of sight view is obstructed due to hill or curve, move the rear-most triangle to a point back down the road so warning is provided up to 500 feet.

quizzes.question: Bridge formulas permit
quizzes.a: the same maximum axle weight for any axle spacing.
quizzes.b: less maximum axle weight for axles that are close together.
quizzes.c: less maximum axle weight for axles that are far apart.
quizzes.explain: A bridge formula permits less maximum axle weight for axles that are closer together. This is to prevent overloading bridges and roadways

quizzes.question: Stab braking
quizzes.a: involves steady pressure on the brake pedal without locking the wheels.
quizzes.b: involves releasing the brakes only after the wheels lock up.
quizzes.c: should never be used.
quizzes.explain: With the stab braking method, you apply your brakes all the way and release brakes when wheels lock up.

quizzes.question: To maintain alertness on your trips, you should
quizzes.a: avoid medications that cause drowsiness.
quizzes.b: schedule your trips for the daytime hours.
quizzes.c: get 8-9 hours of sleep beforehand.
quizzes.explain: Preventing drowsiness before a trip: Get adequate sleep (8 to 9 hours), prepare route, , schedule trips for the hours you are normally awake, drive with a passenger, avoid medications that cause drowsiness.

quizzes.question: The most important hand signal that you and a helper should agree on is
quizzes.a: "Go."
quizzes.b: "Stop."
quizzes.c: "Faster."
quizzes.explain: Before you begin backing, work out a set of hand signals that you both understand. Agree on a signal for "stop."

quizzes.question: When you check the condition of visible parts during your pre-trip inspection, make sure that the ___________ are secured against snagging, rubbing, or wearing.
quizzes.a: primary and secondary safety cab locks
quizzes.b: frame and cross members
quizzes.c: air lines and electrical wiring
quizzes.explain: Air lines and electrical wiring needs to be secured against snagging, rubbing, wearing.

quizzes.question: It is important to shift gears correctly to keep
quizzes.a: control of the vehicle.
quizzes.b: the engine warm.
quizzes.c: the engine oil flowing.
quizzes.explain: Correct shifting of gears is important. If you can't get your vehicle into the right gear while driving, you will have less control.

quizzes.question: Which of the following violations at railroad crossings can lead to loss of your CDL for at least 60 days?
quizzes.a: Not having sufficient space to drive all the way through without stopping
quizzes.b: Getting stuck on the tracks because of insufficient clearance
quizzes.c: Both of the above
quizzes.explain: You will lose your CDL for at least 60 days for your first violation of the following six offenses: failing to stop if the tracks are not clear, failing to slow down and check that the tracks are clear of an approaching train, failing to stop before driving onto the crossing, failing to have sufficient space to drive completely through the crossing without stopping, failing to obey a traffic control device or the directions of an enforcement official at the crossing, failing to negotiate a crossing because of insufficient undercarriage clearance.

quizzes.question: What is the average reaction distance?
quizzes.a: 32 feet
quizzes.b: 61 feet
quizzes.c: 93 feet
quizzes.explain: ¾ second to 1 second. At 55 mph this accounts for 61 feet traveled.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about brakes is true?
quizzes.a: The heavier a vehicle or the faster it is moving, the more heat the brakes must absorb to stop it
quizzes.b: Brakes have more stopping power when they get very hot
quizzes.c: Brake drums cool very quickly when the vehicle is moving very fast
quizzes.explain: Applying the brakes causes friction to slow the vehicle, the faster it is moving, or the heavier it is the more heat that should be absorbed to stop the vehicle.

quizzes.question: What is the best way to figure out how many seconds of following distance you have?
quizzes.a: Wait until the vehicle ahead of you passes a shadow or landmark. Then count the seconds until you reach it.
quizzes.b: Send a text message to a friend to text you back in ten seconds. See how far you have traveled in that time.
quizzes.c: Use the stopwatch on your cell phone to determine how long it takes you to reach a mile marker after the vehicle in front of you has passed it.
quizzes.d: Get 1/4 closer to the vehicle in front of you, then back off again. Multiply how long this took you by four to give the following distance.
quizzes.explain: To know how much space you have, wait until the vehicle ahead passes a shadow on the road, a pavement marking, or some other clear landmark. Then count off the seconds like this: "one thousand-and-one, one thousand-and-two" and so on, until you reach the same spot.

quizzes.question: What does "axle weight" mean?
quizzes.a: The weight transmitted to the ground by one axle or one set of axles
quizzes.b: The weight transmitted to the tires from the axle
quizzes.c: Both of the above
quizzes.explain: Axle weight is the weight transmitted from one axle or a set of axles to the ground.

quizzes.question: On average, the total stopping distance with air brakes is?
quizzes.a: Approximately 400 feet
quizzes.b: Approximately 420 feet
quizzes.c: Approximately 450 feet
quizzes.explain: The total stopping distance is the total minimum distance your vehicle has traveled, in ideal conditions; with everything considered, including perception distance, reaction distance and braking distance, until you can bring your vehicle to a complete stop. At 55 mph, your vehicle will travel a minimum of 450 feet.

quizzes.question: A moving truck ahead of you has a red triangle with an orange center on the rear. What does this mean?
quizzes.a: It may be a slow-moving vehicle
quizzes.b: The vehicle is hauling hazardous materials
quizzes.c: It is a law enforcement vehicle
quizzes.explain: Some vehicles, by their nature, are slow and some of these will have the "slow moving vehicle" symbol to warn you. This is a red triangle with an orange center.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about crossing or entering traffic with a heavy truck is true?
quizzes.a: Heavy vehicles need larger gaps in traffic than cars
quizzes.b: The best way to cross traffic is to pull the vehicle partway across the road and block one lane while waiting for the other to clear
quizzes.c: The heavier your load, the smaller the gap needed to cross traffic
quizzes.d: Because heavy vehicles are easy to see, you can count on other drivers to move out of your way or slow down for you
quizzes.explain: Because of slow acceleration and the space large vehicles require, you may need a much larger gap to enter traffic than you would in a car. Acceleration varies with the load, allow more room if your vehicle is heavily loaded. Before you start across a road, make sure you can get all the way across before traffic reaches you.

quizzes.question: Which of these items is NOT checked on a pre-trip inspection?
quizzes.a: Cargo securement
quizzes.b: Amount of fuel in the vehicle
quizzes.c: Whether all vehicle lights are working and clean
quizzes.explain: During your pre-trip inspection you will need to check cargo securement, and vehicle lights to make sure the vehicle is safe to go on the road. Fuel is a responsibility of the driver to transport the cargo and is not checked on the pre-trip inspection.

quizzes.question: Blocking your cargo to keep it from sliding do you have to be done:
quizzes.a: Front of cargo
quizzes.b: Back of cargo
quizzes.c: Side of cargo
quizzes.explain: Blocking is used in the front, back, and/or sides of a piece of cargo to keep it from sliding. Blocking is shaped to fit snugly against cargo. It is secured to the cargo deck to prevent cargo movement.

quizzes.question: Controlled braking:
quizzes.a: Can be used while you are turning sharply
quizzes.b: Involves locking the wheels for short periods of time
quizzes.c: Is used to keep a vehicle from skidding
quizzes.explain: Controlled Braking: applying the brakes as hard as you can without locking the wheels. Keep steering wheel movements very small while doing this. If you need to make a larger steering adjustment or if the wheels lock, release the brakes, brakes should only be locked for a short period of time. Re-apply the brakes as soon as you can.

quizzes.question: If you feel drowsy while driving, what should you do?
quizzes.a: Pull off the road and get some sleep.
quizzes.b: Open the windows for some fresh air.
quizzes.c: Drink a cup of coffee.
quizzes.explain: If you are drowsy, the only safe cure is to get off the road and get some sleep. If you don't, you risk your life and the lives of others.

quizzes.question: You do you have to park on the side of a level, straight, two lane road. Where should you place the three reflective triangles?
quizzes.a: One within 10 feet of the rear of the vehicle, one about 100 feet to the rear, and one about 200 feet to the rear
quizzes.b: One within 10 feet of the rear of the vehicle, one about 100 feet to the rear, and one about 100 feet from the front of the vehicle
quizzes.c: One about 50 feet from the rear of the vehicle, one about 100 feet to the rear, and one about 100 feet from the front of the vehicle
quizzes.d: One within 10 feet of the front of the vehicle, one about 200 feet from the front, and one about 100 feet to the rear
quizzes.explain: If you stop on a two-lane road carrying traffic in both directions or on an undivided highway, place warning devices within 10 feet of the front or rear corners to mark the location of the vehicle and 100 feet behind and ahead of the vehicle, on the shoulder or in the lane you stopped in.

quizzes.question: The distance your truck travels from the time your eyes see a hazard to the time your brain recognizes it is called _______ distance.
quizzes.a: perception
quizzes.b: reaction
quizzes.c: braking
quizzes.explain: The distance your vehicle travels, in ideal conditions; from the time your eyes see a hazard until your brain recognizes it is perception distance.

quizzes.question: What is the proper way to hold the steering wheel?
quizzes.a: With your right hand on the wheel
quizzes.b: Firmly, with one hand at the top of the wheel and the other hand at the bottom of the wheel
quizzes.c: Firmly, with both hands-on opposite sides of the wheel
quizzes.explain: Hold the steering wheel firmly with both hands. Your hands should be on opposite sides of the wheel. If you hit a curb or a pothole, the wheel could pull away from your hands unless you have a firm hold.

quizzes.question: With a BAC of _____, most people lose consciousness, and some die.
quizzes.explain: At a BAC of .40 most people will lose consciousness, and some will die.

quizzes.question: If you are being tailgated, you should:
quizzes.a: Increase the space in front of you
quizzes.b: Flash your brake lights
quizzes.c: Speed up
quizzes.d: Signal the tailgater when it is safe to pass
quizzes.explain: If you find yourself being tailgated, here are some things you can do to reduce the chances of a crash: avoid quick changes, increase your following distance opening up room in front of you will make it easier for the tailgater to get around you, don't speed up.

quizzes.question: It takes the body about _____ hours to get rid of the alcohol in four drinks.
quizzes.explain: —the rest builds up in your blood.

quizzes.question: Which of these is NOT a proper use of truck lights?
quizzes.a: Flashing your brake lights to stop someone from tailgating
quizzes.b: Turning on your headlights during times when visibility is reduced
quizzes.c: Flashing your brake lights to warn someone behind you that you are slowing down
quizzes.explain: If you find yourself being tailgated, here are some things you can do to reduce the chances of a crash: avoid quick changes, increase your following distance, don't speed up, and don't turn on your taillights or flash your brake lights.

quizzes.question: When the engine is at operating RPM's, the _____ pressure is built up from 80 to 100 PSI within 45 seconds in a dual system?
quizzes.a: Oil
quizzes.b: Air
quizzes.c: Temp
quizzes.explain: When the engine is at operating rpms, the air pressure should build from 85 to 100 psi within 45 seconds in dual air systems.

quizzes.question: Dry bulk tanks require special care because:
quizzes.a: They have a high center of gravity
quizzes.b: The load can shift
quizzes.c: Both above
quizzes.explain: Dry bulk tanks require special care because they have a high center of gravity, and the load can shift. Be extremely cautious (slow and careful) going around curves and making sharp turns.

quizzes.question: The braking effect of the engine is greatest when the engine is _____ the governed rpm and the transmission is in the ______ gears.
quizzes.a: near; lower
quizzes.b: below; higher
quizzes.c: above; lower
quizzes.explain: The braking effect of the engine is greatest when it is near the governed rpms and the transmission is in the lower gears.

quizzes.question: If you are driving a long distance, you should
quizzes.a: stop often and take short breaks before you feel really drowsy or tired.
quizzes.b: take a short break once or twice during the trip when you are feeling tired or drowsy.
quizzes.c: avoid short breaks but keep the window open.
quizzes.explain: Short breaks can keep you alert. But the time to take them is before you feel really drowsy or tired. Stop often. Walk around and inspect your vehicle. It may help to do some physical exercises.

quizzes.question: How does "bleeding tar" affect the road surface and driving conditions?
quizzes.a: It does not affect the road surface or driving conditions.
quizzes.b: It is very sticky and slows down your vehicle.
quizzes.c: Tar rises to the road surface in very hot weather, causing the roads to become very slippery.
quizzes.explain: Tar in the road pavement frequently rises to the surface in very hot weather. Spots where tar "bleeds" to the surface are very slippery.

quizzes.question: Can federal inspectors inspect your truck or bus?
quizzes.a: No.
quizzes.b: Yes, and they might place it out of service.
quizzes.c: Yes, but they will not place it out of service.
quizzes.explain: Federal and state inspectors also may inspect your vehicles. If they judge the vehicle to be unsafe, they will put it "out of service" until it is fixed.

quizzes.question: Why should you be in the proper gear before starting down a hill?
quizzes.a: You need to be in the same gear at the bottom of the hill.
quizzes.b: You will not be able to shift into a lower gear once you are going down a hill.
quizzes.c: The clutch is made to be used on even surfaces.
quizzes.explain: Do not try to downshift after your speed has already built up. You will not be able to shift into a lower gear. You may not even be able to get back into any gear and all engine braking effect will be lost.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about cargo loading is true?
quizzes.a: The legal maximum weight allowed by a state can be considered safe for all driving conditions
quizzes.b: Slight overloading of a vehicle can make its brakes work better
quizzes.c: State laws dictate legal weight limits
quizzes.d: If the shipper loads cargo, the driver is not responsible for overloading
quizzes.explain: You should keep weights within legal limits. States have maximums for GVWRs, GCWRs, and axle weights.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about overhead clearance is true?
quizzes.a: You should assume the posted clearance signs are correct
quizzes.b: A vehicle's clearance can change with the load carried
quizzes.c: If the road surface causes your vehicle to tilt toward objects at the edge of the road, you should drive close to the shoulder
quizzes.d: Extra speed will cause air to push your vehicle down for extra clearance
quizzes.explain: The weight of a cargo van changes its height. An empty van is higher than a loaded one. That you got under a bridge when you were loaded does not mean that you can do it when you are empty.

quizzes.question: Is it legal to drive with one-fourth of a truck's leaf springs broken or missing?
quizzes.a: Yes
quizzes.b: No
quizzes.c: It doesn't make any difference if you drive slowly
quizzes.explain: Check for missing or broken leaves in any leaf spring. If one-fourth or more are missing, it will put the vehicle "out of service", but any defect could be dangerous.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements is true about warning other drivers of a stopped truck?
quizzes.a: Keep the vehicle's taillights on to warn other drivers.
quizzes.b: Move the rear reflective triangle back if the driver's vision is obscured to within 500 feet.
quizzes.c: Put out your emergency warning devices within five minutes.
quizzes.explain: If line of sight view is obstructed due to hill or curve, move the rear-most triangle to a point back down the road (up to 500 feet) so warning is provided.

quizzes.question: You have left the road in an emergency condition, it is impossible for you to come to a stop prior to returning to the road, which of the following is the best action to take?
quizzes.a: Make sure the road is clear, and continue to return to the road
quizzes.b: Stop and turn your vehicle around before entering the road
quizzes.c: Reduce your speed to 20 mph or less before returning to the road
quizzes.explain: If possible, avoid using the brakes until your speed has dropped to about 20 mph, and gently return to the road.

quizzes.question: What is the minimum tread depth for tires other than front tires?
quizzes.a: 4/32 inch
quizzes.b: 2/32 inch
quizzes.c: 3/32 inch
quizzes.explain: You should have at least 4/32-inch tread depth in every major groove on front tires and at least 2/32-inch on other tires

quizzes.question: You are driving a 40-foot truck at 45 mph. Driving conditions are ideal. What is the least amount of space that you should keep in front of your truck to be safe?
quizzes.a: 2 seconds
quizzes.b: 3 seconds
quizzes.c: 4 seconds
quizzes.explain: One good rule says you need at least one second for each 10 feet of vehicle length at speeds below 40 mph. At greater speeds, you must add 1 second for safety.

quizzes.question: Your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) depends on your
quizzes.a: height.
quizzes.b: body weight.
quizzes.c: age.
quizzes.explain: BAC is determined by the amount of alcohol you drink, how fast you drink, and your weight.

quizzes.question: What are the regulations on the height of splash guards?
quizzes.a: They must be no more than 15 inches above the ground when the vehicle is completely unloaded.
quizzes.b: It depends on the state.
quizzes.c: They must be no more than 8 inches above the ground when the vehicle is fully loaded.
quizzes.explain: Currently, there are no federal regulations governing the height of splash guards. Each state is free to issue its own regulations, and those regulations vary from one state to another.

quizzes.question: A key principle to remember about loading cargo is to keep the load
quizzes.a: to the front.
quizzes.b: to the rear.
quizzes.c: balanced in the cargo area.
quizzes.explain: Poor weight balance can make vehicle handling unsafe. The cargo should be loaded so that it is balanced in the cargo area.

quizzes.question: To give adequate warning when passing someone, you should?
quizzes.a: Use your high beams until you completely pass
quizzes.b: Signal early
quizzes.c: Tap the electrical horn first
quizzes.explain: Whenever you are about to pass a vehicle, pedestrian, or bicyclist, assume they don't see you. They could suddenly move in front of you. When it is legal, tap the horn lightly or, at night, flash your lights from low to high beam and back.

quizzes.question: Your truck has hydraulic brakes. While traveling on a level road, you press the brake pedal and find that it goes to the floor. Which of these statements is true?
quizzes.a: You should not downshift if you have an automatic transmission
quizzes.b: Pumping the brake pedal may bring the pressure up so you can stop the vehicle
quizzes.c: The parking brake will not work either because it is part of the same hydraulic system
quizzes.explain: Sometimes pumping the brake pedal will generate enough hydraulic pressure to stop the vehicle.

quizzes.question: What is a "pull-up?"
quizzes.a: When pulling off the shoulder, pulling up until the trailer is straight
quizzes.b: Pulling forward while backing a trailer to reposition it
quizzes.c: A maneuver performed by a tow truck to pick up an overturned truck
quizzes.explain: When a driver stops and reverses direction to get a better position while backing, it is scored as a "pull-up". Stopping without changing direction does not count as a pull-up.

quizzes.question: The most important reason for being alert to hazards is so:
quizzes.a: Accident reports will be accurate
quizzes.b: Law enforcement personnel can be called
quizzes.c: You will have time to plan your escape if the hazard becomes an emergency
quizzes.explain: You look for the hazards to have time to plan a way out of any emergency. When you see a hazard, think about the emergencies that could develop and figure out what you would do.

quizzes.question: "Reaction distance" is the distance traveled from the time:
quizzes.a: The eyes see a hazard to the time the brain knows that it is a hazard
quizzes.b: The brain tells the foot to push the brake pedal to the time the foot pushes the pedal
quizzes.c: The eyes see a hazard to the time the foot pushes the brake pedal
quizzes.d: The brake pedal is pressed to the time the brakes begin to slow the vehicle
quizzes.explain: ¾ second to 1 second. At 55 mph this accounts for 61 feet traveled.

quizzes.question: The tendency for long commercial trucks to swing wide on turns is called
quizzes.a: off-tracking.
quizzes.b: hydroplaning.
quizzes.c: fishtailing.
quizzes.explain: When a vehicle goes around a corner, the rear wheels follow a different path than the front wheels. This is called off-tracking. Longer vehicles will off-track more, the rear wheels of the powered unit will off-track some, and the rear wheels of the trailer will off-track even more.

quizzes.question: If you have a heavy load that is slowing you down on an upgrade, you should
quizzes.a: shift into a lower gear.
quizzes.b: drive on the shoulder so that others can pass you easily.
quizzes.c: exit the roadway until traffic is lighter.
quizzes.explain: Heavy vehicles are often tailgated when they can't keep up with the speed of traffic. This often happens when you're going uphill. If a heavy load is slowing you down, stay in the right lane if you can. Going uphill, you should not pass another slow vehicle unless you can get around quickly and safely.

quizzes.question: Signs of distracted drivers include
quizzes.a: vehicles constantly traveling above the speed limit.
quizzes.b: drivers having conversations with passengers.
quizzes.c: vehicles exiting the roadway.
quizzes.d: drivers listening to overly loud music.
quizzes.explain: Watch for: vehicles that may drift over the lane divider lines or within their own lane; vehicles traveling at inconsistent speeds; drivers who are preoccupied with maps, food, cigarettes, cell phones, or other objects; drivers who appear to be involved in conversations with their passengers.

quizzes.question: Tie downs do you have to be of the proper type and strength. The combined strength of cargo tie downs do you have to be strong enough to lift.
quizzes.a: The weight of the cargo tied down
quizzes.b: One and one-half times the weight of the cargo tied down
quizzes.c: Twice the weight of the cargo tied down
quizzes.d: Three times the weight of the cargo tied down
quizzes.explain: Tie-downs should be of the proper type and proper strength. Federal regulations require the aggregate working load limit of any securement system used to secure an article or group of articles against movement should be at least one and one-half times the weight of the article or group of articles.

quizzes.question: Which of the following CMVs are most likely to get stuck at a raised railroad crossing?
quizzes.a: Moving van
quizzes.b: Lowboy
quizzes.c: Car carrier
quizzes.explain: These trailers can get stuck on raised crossings: Low slung units (lowboy, car carrier, moving van, possum-belly livestock trailer). Single-axle tractor pulling a long trailer with its landing gear set to accommodate a tandem-axle tractor.

quizzes.question: What do you do if a car coming toward you at night keeps its high beams on?
quizzes.a: Look toward the right edge of your lane or the right edge of the road.
quizzes.b: Flash your high beams at the other driver.
quizzes.c: Slow down and look straight ahead in your lane.
quizzes.explain: Don't look directly at bright lights when driving. Look at the right side of the road. Watch the sidelines when someone coming toward you has very bright lights on.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about using turn signals is true?
quizzes.a: When turning, you should cancel the signal just before you make the turn
quizzes.b: You do not need to use your signal when changing lanes on a four-lane highway
quizzes.c: When turning, you should signal early
quizzes.d: You should use your turn signal to mark your vehicle when it is pulled off the side of the road
quizzes.explain: Signal early and leave the signal on until the maneuver is complete. Signal well before you turn. It is the best way to keep others from trying to pass you.

quizzes.question: On a two-way, two-lane road, if you do you have to stop on a hill, what is the safe distance back should you place your reflective triangles?
quizzes.a: Within 100 feet behind the vehicle
quizzes.b: Within 250 feet behind the vehicle
quizzes.c: Within 500 feet behind the vehicle
quizzes.explain: If line of sight view is obstructed due to hill or curve, move the rear-most triangle to a point back down the road (up to 500 feet) so warning is provided.

quizzes.question: How many tie-downs are required for a 20-foot load?
quizzes.explain: Cargo should have at least one tie-down for each ten feet of cargo. Make sure you have enough tiedowns to meet this need. For a 20-foot load you would need at least 2 tie downs.

quizzes.question: On which of the following types of fires should you NOT use a B:C fire extinguisher?
quizzes.a: Wood
quizzes.b: Electrical
quizzes.c: Grease
quizzes.explain: The B:C type fire extinguisher is designed to work on electrical fires and burning liquids, not on wood.

quizzes.question: The best way to stop all skids is to
quizzes.a: use stab or controlled braking.
quizzes.b: counter steer and accelerate.
quizzes.c: restore traction to the tires.
quizzes.explain: When any vehicle starts to skid, you must act to restore traction to the wheels.

quizzes.question: If you have been drinking alcohol, before you drive, you should
quizzes.a: take a cold shower.
quizzes.b: wait for it to wear off.
quizzes.c: drink coffee.
quizzes.explain: The liver can only process one-third an ounce of alcohol per hour, which is considerably less than the alcohol in a standard drink. This is a fixed rate, so only time, not black coffee or a cold shower, will sober you up.

quizzes.question: Which of the following statements about an escape ramp is FALSE?
quizzes.a: It may turn uphill.
quizzes.b: It may be located a few miles from the top of a downgrade.
quizzes.c: It may be made of soft gravel.
quizzes.d: It is not useful if you are traveling too fast.
quizzes.explain: Your best hope is an escape ramp. If there is one, there will be signs telling you about it. Use it. Ramps are usually located a few miles from the top of the downgrade. Escape ramps save lives, equipment and cargo.

quizzes.question: Which fires can you use water to put out?
quizzes.a: Tire fires
quizzes.b: Gasoline fires
quizzes.c: Electrical fires
quizzes.explain: Water can be used on wood, paper, or cloth, but don't use water on an electrical fire or a gasoline fire. A burning tire should be cooled. Lots of water may be required.

quizzes.question: Gross truck weight rating or GVWR means the following:
quizzes.a: Total weight of a single vehicle
quizzes.b: Total weight of a single vehicle plus its load
quizzes.c: Both above
quizzes.explain: The Gross Vehicle Weight Rating (GVWR) is the value specified by the manufacturer as the loaded weight of a single vehicle.

quizzes.question: To safely adjust your speed to current driving conditions, what should you look for ahead?
quizzes.a: Traffic and road conditions
quizzes.b: Road signs and traffic
quizzes.c: Police and weigh stations
quizzes.explain: Driving too fast is a major cause of fatal crashes. You should adjust your speed depending on driving conditions. These include traction, curves, visibility, traffic and hills.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements is true about medicines used to treat the common cold?
quizzes.a: They should only be used when driving during the daytime.
quizzes.b: They can be used while driving as long as you only take half the regular dose.
quizzes.c: They often make you sleepy. Therefore, they should not be used while driving.
quizzes.explain: This includes a variety of prescription and over-the counter drugs or cold medicines, which may make the driver drowsy or otherwise affect safe driving ability.

quizzes.question: Inspect your cargo after you have driven
quizzes.a: 25 miles
quizzes.b: 50 miles
quizzes.c: 100 miles
quizzes.explain: Inspect the cargo and its securing devices within the first 50 miles after beginning a trip. Make any adjustments needed.

quizzes.question: Which of these tell you that cargo contains hazardous materials?
