quizzes.a: The name of the hazard class on the shipping paper
quizzes.b: A four-inch, diamond shaped, hazardous materials label on the container
quizzes.c: Hazardous material placards on the vehicle
quizzes.explain: Shipping papers listing a hazard class, hazardous material labels on the cargo, or placards on the vehicle all show the driver that the load contains hazardous material.

quizzes.question: Where should you place your warning devices if you do you have to stop on a one-way road or divided highway?
quizzes.a: 10 feet, 100 feet, and 200 feet toward approaching traffic
quizzes.b: 50 feet, 100 feet, and 150 feet toward approaching traffic
quizzes.c: 100 feet, 200 feet, and 300 feet toward approaching traffic
quizzes.d: 20 feet, 50 feet, and 100 feet toward approaching traffic
quizzes.explain: If you must stop on or by a one-way or divided highway, place warning devices 10 feet, 100 feet, and 200 feet toward the approaching traffic.

quizzes.question: You do you have to drive on a slippery road. Which of these is a good thing to do in such a situation?
quizzes.a: Use a smaller following distance
quizzes.b: Apply the brakes during turns
quizzes.c: Slow down gradually
quizzes.explain: I It will take longer to stop, and it will be harder to turn without skidding, when the road is slippery. Wet roads can double stopping distance at any speed, reduce speed, and slow down gradually on a wet road.

quizzes.question: Which of the following is NOT something you should check during a trip?
quizzes.a: Mirrors
quizzes.b: Cargo and cargo covers
quizzes.c: Tires
quizzes.explain: Your CDL will be disqualified after two or more convictions of any state law on texting while operating a CMV. No motor carrier shall allow or require its drivers to engage in texting while driving.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about managing space to the sides is true?
quizzes.a: Strong winds make it easy to stay in your lane.
quizzes.b: You should avoid traveling next to others whenever possible.
quizzes.c: Always keep your vehicle to the right side of your lane.
quizzes.explain: Commercial vehicles are often wide and take up most of a lane. Safe drivers will manage what little space they have. You can do this by keeping your vehicle centered in your lane and avoid driving alongside others.

quizzes.question: Too much weight on the steering axle can cause the following:
quizzes.a: Hard steering
quizzes.b: Damage to the steering axle
quizzes.c: Damage to the tires
quizzes.explain: Poor weight balance can make vehicle handling unsafe. Too much weight on the steering axle can cause hard steering. It can damage the steering axle and tires.

quizzes.question: Total stopping distance equals
quizzes.a: perception distance + reaction distance + braking distance.
quizzes.b: reaction distance + braking distance.
quizzes.c: reaction distance + viewing distance + braking distance.
quizzes.explain: Stopping distance is the sum of your Perception Distance + Reaction Distance + Braking Distance. In vehicles with air brakes you must include the brake lag distance.

quizzes.question: Name two causes of fires.
quizzes.a: Underinflated tires and duals that touch
quizzes.b: Tight turns and gravel roads
quizzes.c: Driver smoking and following too close
quizzes.explain: The following are some causes of vehicle fires: spilled fuel, improper use of flares, under-inflated tires, duals that touch, short circuits, loose connections, improper fueling, loose fuel connections, flammable cargo that is improperly sealed or loaded cargo or has poor ventilation.

quizzes.question: A truck is loaded with most of the weight on the steering axle. What may result?
quizzes.a: Hard steering and possible breakdown
quizzes.b: Better handling
quizzes.c: A need to disconnect the steering axle brakes
quizzes.explain: Too much weight on the steering axle can cause hard steering. It can damage the steering axle and tires.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about accelerating is true?
quizzes.a: When traction is poor, more power should be applied to the accelerator
quizzes.b: Improper acceleration can cause mechanical damage
quizzes.c: You should feel a jerking motion if you are accelerating your vehicle properly
quizzes.explain: Speed up smoothly and gradually so the vehicle does not jerk. Rough acceleration can cause mechanical damage. When pulling a trailer, rough acceleration can damage the coupling.

quizzes.question: Serious traffic violations that can cause your CDL license to be suspended include
quizzes.a: excessive speeding (15 mph or more above the posted limit) and improper lane changes.
quizzes.b: reckless driving and following a vehicle too closely.
quizzes.c: both of the above.
quizzes.explain: Serious traffic violations are excessive speeding, reckless driving, improper or erratic lane changes, following a vehicle too closely, traffic offenses committed in a CMV in connection with fatal traffic accidents, etc.

quizzes.question: Which of these will help keep an engine cool in hot weather?
quizzes.a: Avoiding high speed driving
quizzes.b: Making sure the engine has the right amount of oil
quizzes.c: Properly adjusted v-belts
quizzes.explain: Do a normal Vehicle inspection but pay special attention to the following items: tires, engine oil, engine coolant, engine belts, and hoses. High speeds create more heat for tires and the engine. In desert conditions the heat may build up to the point where it is dangerous.

quizzes.question: When do you downshift an automatic transmission?
quizzes.a: When going down grades
quizzes.b: When going around curves
quizzes.c: When going up grades
quizzes.explain: You can select a low range to get greater engine braking when going down grades. The lower ranges prevent the transmission from shifting up beyond the selected gear.

quizzes.question: Your truck is in a traffic emergency and may collide with another truck if you do not act. Which of these is a good rule to remember at such a time?
quizzes.a: Stopping is always the safest action in a traffic emergency
quizzes.b: Heavy vehicles can almost always turn more quickly than they can stop
quizzes.c: Leaving the road is always riskier than hitting another vehicle
quizzes.explain: When you don't have enough room to stop, you may have to steer away from what's ahead. Remember, you can almost always turn to miss an obstacle more quickly than you can stop.

quizzes.question: The formula for stopping distance with air brakes is?
quizzes.a: Reaction distance and effective braking distance
quizzes.b: Perception distance and effective braking  distance
quizzes.c: Perception distance, reaction distance, brake lag distance, and effective braking distance
quizzes.explain: Perception Distance + Reaction Distance + Brake Lag Distance + Braking Distance = Total Stopping Distance.

quizzes.question: You are testing the stopping action of service brakes on a hydraulic system. Which of these can mean there is a problem?
quizzes.a: The vehicle pulls to one side when the brake pedal is pressed
quizzes.b: Stopping action is delayed
quizzes.c: The brake pedal feels unusual
quizzes.explain: With hydraulic systems a delay in braking, spongy or unusual feeling pedal, or pulling to one side or the other can mean there are issues.

quizzes.question: Which of these describes how you should use the brake pedal on a steep downhill grade?
quizzes.a: Light, pumping action
quizzes.b: Release the brake when you are 5mph below your safe speed, then let your speed come back up to your safe speed and repeat.
quizzes.c: Light steady pressure
quizzes.explain: Once the vehicle is in the proper low gear, the following are the proper braking techniques: Apply the brakes just hard enough to feel a definite slowdown, when your speed has been reduced to approximately five mph below your "safe" speed, release the brakes. When your speed has increased to your "safe" speed, repeat.

quizzes.question: When you're driving in cold weather, your tires do you have to
quizzes.a: have at least 4/32-inch tread depth.
quizzes.b: have at least 6/32-inch tread depth.
quizzes.c: provide enough traction to steer and push the vehicle through snow.
quizzes.explain: Make sure you have enough tread on your tires. The drive tires must provide traction to push the rig over wet pavement and through snow. The steering tires must have traction to steer the vehicle. Enough tread is especially important in winter conditions.

quizzes.question: The oil pressure gauge should come up to normal within how long after starting the engine?
quizzes.a: Seconds
quizzes.b: It does not matter.
quizzes.c: Minutes
quizzes.explain: Oil pressure. Should come up to normal within seconds after engine is started.

quizzes.question: Which of these is NOT required knowledge for drivers needing a HAZMAT endorsement?
quizzes.a: When to use placards
quizzes.b: Basic chemistry
quizzes.c: Which products can be loaded together
quizzes.explain: Hazardous materials drivers must also know which products they can load together, and which they cannot, when to use placards.

quizzes.question: When roads are slippery, you should:
quizzes.a: Drive alongside other drivers
quizzes.b: Make turns as gently as possible
quizzes.c: Decrease the distance that you look ahead of your vehicle
quizzes.explain: It will take longer to stop, and it will be harder to turn without skidding, when the road is slippery. So, making gentle turns is key when the roads are slippery.

quizzes.question: When driving through roadway work zones, you should
quizzes.a: turn on your parking lights.
quizzes.b: watch for sharp pavement drop-offs.
quizzes.c: reduce speed only if workers are close to the roadway.
quizzes.explain: When people are working on the road, it is a hazard. There may be narrower lanes, sharp turns, or uneven surfaces.

quizzes.question: How can you start moving without rolling backward?
quizzes.a: Engage the clutch before removing your foot from the brake.
quizzes.b: Apply the trailer brake hand valve.
quizzes.c: Set the parking brake whenever necessary.
quizzes.explain: Don't roll back when you start. You may hit someone behind you. If you have a manual transmission vehicle, partly engage the clutch before you take your right foot off the brake. Put on the parking brake whenever necessary to keep from rolling back. Release the parking brake only when you have applied enough engine power to keep from rolling back.

quizzes.question: Escape ramps are
quizzes.a: used to get out of a burning truck.
quizzes.b: used to stop runaway vehicles.
quizzes.c: for combination vehicles only.
quizzes.explain: Escape ramps are made to stop runaway vehicles safely without injuring drivers and passengers.

quizzes.question: Dry bulk tanks and hanging meat
quizzes.a: are unstable loads.
quizzes.b: do not require special care.
quizzes.c: have low centers of gravity.
quizzes.explain: Hanging meat and dry bulk can be a very unstable load with a high center of gravity. Particular caution is needed on sharp curves such as off ramps and on ramps. Go slowly.

quizzes.question: You are checking your tires for a pre-trip inspection.  Which of these statements is true?
quizzes.a: Dual tires should be touching each other
quizzes.b: Tires of mismatched sizes should not be used on the same vehicle
quizzes.c: Radial and bias-ply tires can be used together on the same vehicle
quizzes.explain: Tire problems include: too much or too little air pressure, bad wear, at least 4/32-inch tread depth on front tires, 2/32 inch on all other tires, no fabric should show through the tread or sidewall, cuts or other damage, tread separation, dual tires that come in contact with each other or parts of the vehicle, mismatched sizes, radial and bias-ply tires used together.

quizzes.question: Cargo covers:
quizzes.a: Protect people from spilled cargo
quizzes.b: Protect cargo from weather
quizzes.c: May be required by law
quizzes.explain: There are two basic reasons for covering cargo: to protect people from spilled cargo, and to protect the cargo from weather. Spill protection is a safety requirement in many states. Be familiar with the laws in the states you drive in.

quizzes.question: What do you do when your truck hydroplanes?
quizzes.a: Start stab braking
quizzes.b: Accelerate slightly
quizzes.c: Release the accelerator
quizzes.explain: You can regain control by releasing the accelerator and pushing in the clutch. This will slow your vehicle and let the wheels turn freely. If the vehicle is hydroplaning, do not use the brakes to slow down.

quizzes.question: The total weight of the powered unit, the trailer, and the cargo is called
quizzes.a: gross vehicle weight.
quizzes.b: gross combination weight.
quizzes.c: gross axle weight.
quizzes.explain: Gross Combination Weight (GCW) is the total weight of a powered unit, plus trailer(s), plus the cargo.

quizzes.question: When do you review the post-trip inspection report from the previous driver?
quizzes.a: You should review it during your pre-trip inspection.
quizzes.b: It doesn't have to be reviewed.
quizzes.c: You should review it once a week.
quizzes.explain: Before performing the pre-trip inspection on your vehicle, you must review the inspection report made by the previous driver. Only if defects reported earlier have been certified as repaired or not needed to be repaired, should you sign the previous driver's report.

quizzes.question: All of the following behaviors are signs of aggressive driving EXCEPT
quizzes.a: frequent changes of speed.
quizzes.b: purposely blocking another vehicle from changing lanes.
quizzes.c: purposely straddling two lanes of traffic.
quizzes.explain: Aggressive driving is the act of operating a motor vehicle in a selfish, bold, or pushy manner, without regard for the rights or safety of others. The frequent changes of speed is a distracted driver trait.

quizzes.question: If a truck continues to drive in your blind spot you should?
quizzes.a: Speed up
quizzes.b: Signal them to pass you
quizzes.c: Back off
quizzes.explain: Backing off just means you slow down, if the vehicle was in a blind spot this change in speed should force it out of the blind spot.

quizzes.question: Containerized loads
quizzes.a: are typically used for freight carried partway by rail or ship.
quizzes.b: should come with their own tie-down devices.
quizzes.c: do not need to be inspected or secured by the driver.
quizzes.explain: Containerized loads generally are used when freight is carried part way by rail or ship. Delivery by truck occurs at the beginning and/or end of the journey.

quizzes.question: What will help someone who is drunk sober up?
quizzes.a: Time
quizzes.b: Fresh air
quizzes.c: A glass of water
quizzes.explain: The liver can only process one-third an ounce of alcohol per hour, which is considerably less than the alcohol in a standard drink. This is a fixed rate, so only time, not black coffee or a cold shower, will sober you up.

quizzes.question: According to the driver's manual, why should you limit the use of your horn?
quizzes.a: It can startle other drivers
quizzes.b: It wears down the battery
quizzes.c: The horn is not a good way to let others know you are there
quizzes.explain: Your horn can let others know you're there. It can help to avoid a crash. Use your horn when needed. However, it can startle others and could be dangerous when used unnecessarily.

quizzes.question: The amount of liquid to load into a tank depends on:
quizzes.a: The amount of liquid will expand in transit
quizzes.b: The weight of the liquid
quizzes.c: The legal weight limits
quizzes.explain: A full tank of dense liquid (such as some acids) may exceed legal weight limits. The amount of liquid to load into a tank depends on: the amount the liquid will expand in transit, the weight of the liquid, legal weight limits.

quizzes.question: When driving in an area with few streetlights on a clear night, if you cannot see well with your headlights, you should
quizzes.a: find another route that is better lit.
quizzes.b: turn your interior lights on.
quizzes.c: use your high beams when legal and keep your interior lights off.
quizzes.explain: Some drivers make the mistake of always using low beams. This seriously cuts down on their ability to see ahead. Use high beams when it is safe and legal to do so. Use them when you are not within 500 feet of another vehicle. Keep the interior light off and adjust your instrument lights as low as you can to still be able to read the gauges.

quizzes.question: To prevent brake fade, you should
quizzes.a: coast down hills that are not very steep inclines.
quizzes.b: apply constant hard pressure on the brakes.
quizzes.c: select a gear that will keep your vehicle at a safe speed on steep downgrades.
quizzes.explain: You should select an appropriate safe speed, then use a low gear, and proper braking techniques.

quizzes.question: What is the minimum tread depth for tires other than front tires?
quizzes.a: 4/32 inch
quizzes.b: 2/32 inch
quizzes.c: 3/32 inch
quizzes.explain: You should have at least 4/32-inch tread depth in every major groove on front tires and at least 2/32-inch on other tires

quizzes.question: The height of the truck center of gravity is very important for safe handling. A high center of gravity means you are more likely to do the following:
quizzes.a: Increase stopping distance
quizzes.b: Tip over
quizzes.c: Increase speed going downhill
quizzes.explain: The height of the vehicle's center of gravity is very important for safe handling. A high center of gravity means you are more likely to tip over. It is most dangerous in curves, or if you have to swerve to avoid a hazard.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about drinking alcohol is true?
quizzes.a: Some people aren't affected by drinking
quizzes.b: A few beers have the same effect on driving as a few shots of whisky
quizzes.c: Coffee and fresh air can sober a person up
quizzes.explain: All of the following drinks contain the same amount of alcohol: A 12-ounce glass of 5% beer. A 5-ounce glass of 12% wine. A 1 1/2-ounce shot of 80 proof whiskey.

quizzes.question: When inspecting mirrors and windshields for cracks, dirt, illegal stickers, and other obstructions to your vision, you should
quizzes.a: not worry about any of it.
quizzes.b: look in the mirror to see if you look good.
quizzes.c: clean and adjust as necessary.
quizzes.explain: Inspect mirrors and windshield for cracks, dirt, illegal stickers, or other obstructions to seeing clearly. Clean and adjust as necessary.

quizzes.question: Overloading can have a bad effect on?
quizzes.a: Steering
quizzes.b: Braking
quizzes.c: Speed control
quizzes.explain: Overloading can have bad effects on steering, braking, and speed control. Overloaded trucks have to go very slowly on upgrades, and they may gain too much speed on downgrades. Stopping distance increases. Brakes can fail when forced to work too hard.

quizzes.question: If the truck in front of you is smaller than yours, it can probably
quizzes.a: outrun you.
quizzes.b: stop faster than you.
quizzes.c: make turns faster than you.
quizzes.explain: Remember, if the vehicle ahead of you is smaller than yours, it can probably stop faster than you can. You may crash if you are following too closely.

quizzes.question: The distance that you should look ahead of your truck while driving is about _______ at highway speed.
quizzes.a: 25 feet
quizzes.b: 1 mile
quizzes.c: 1/4 mile
quizzes.explain: Most good drivers look at least 12 to 15 seconds ahead. That means looking ahead the distance you will travel in 12 to 15 seconds. At lower speeds, that's about one block. At highway speeds it's about a quarter of a mile.

quizzes.question: Name some things you should check on the FRONT of your truck during your pre-trip inspection.
quizzes.a: Low beams, high beams, four-way flashers, and turn signals
quizzes.b: Windshield wipers, mirrors, and hood latches
quizzes.c: Oil, transmission, air compressor, and radiator
quizzes.explain: Go to front of vehicle and check that low beams are on and both of the four-way flashers are working, check that high beams, parking, clearance, side-marker, and identification lights work. Turn on right turn signal and start walk-around inspection, then check the left turn.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about truck fires is true?
quizzes.a: If cargo in a van or a box trailer catches on fire, you should open the cargo doors as soon as you can
quizzes.b: If your engine is on fire, you should open the hood as soon as you can
quizzes.c: If a trailer is on fire, you should drive fast to put out the flames
quizzes.d: A burning tire must be cooled
quizzes.explain: A burning tire should be cooled. Lots of water may be required.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements is NOT true about engine belts in hot weather?
quizzes.a: Cracking is likely to occur, but it is not a safety threat.
quizzes.b: Loose belts will not turn the water pump and/or fan on properly.
quizzes.c: You can check the tightness of belts by pressing on them.
quizzes.explain: Learn how to check v-belt tightness on your vehicle by pressing on the belts. Loose belts will not turn the water pump and/or fan properly. This will result in overheating. Also, check belts for cracking or other signs of wear.

quizzes.question: While driving at night, which lights should you use as often as you can?
quizzes.a: Low beams
quizzes.b: Novelty lights
quizzes.c: Emergency flashers
quizzes.explain: Some drivers make the mistake of always using low beams. This seriously cuts down on their ability to see ahead. Use high beams when it is safe and legal to do so. Use them when you are not within 500 feet of an approaching vehicle.

quizzes.question: Cargo should have at least one tie down for each:
quizzes.a: 10 feet of cargo
quizzes.b: 12 feet of cargo
quizzes.c: 15 feet of cargo
quizzes.explain: Cargo should have at least one tie-down for each ten feet of cargo. Make sure you have enough tiedowns to meet this need.

quizzes.question: When you start to drive down a steep downgrade, which of the following should influence your choice of speed?
quizzes.a: The road conditions
quizzes.b: The total weight of your vehicle and its cargo
quizzes.c: The steepness of the grade
quizzes.explain: Your most important consideration is to select a speed that is not too fast for the: total weight of the vehicle and cargo, length of the grade, steepness of the grade, road conditions, and weather.

quizzes.question: Implied consent means that when you operate a CMV on public roads, you
quizzes.a: consent to be tested for alcohol in your blood.
quizzes.b: understand that you may now drink alcohol before driving.
quizzes.c: consent to have your vehicle inspected for alcohol.
quizzes.explain: If you operate a CMV, you shall be deemed to have given your consent to alcohol testing.

quizzes.question: With a BAC of _____, most people lose consciousness, and some die.
quizzes.explain: At a BAC of .40 most people will lose consciousness, and some will die.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about speed management is true?
quizzes.a: On a wet road you should reduce your speed by about 1/3
quizzes.b: On packed snow you should reduce your speed by about 1/2
quizzes.c: When the road is slippery it will take longer to stop, and it will be harder to turn without skidding
quizzes.explain: It will take longer to stop, and it will be harder to turn without skidding, when the road is slippery. Reduce speed by about one-third on a wet road. On packed snow, reduce speed by a half, or more. If the surface is icy, reduce speed to a crawl and stop driving as soon as you can safely do so.

quizzes.question: Which of these is a good rule to follow when steering to avoid a crash?
quizzes.a: Apply the brakes while turning
quizzes.b: Steer with one hand so that you can turn the wheel more quickly
quizzes.c: Don't turn any more than is needed to clear what is in your way
quizzes.explain: Do not turn any more than needed to clear whatever is in your way. The more sharply you turn, the greater the chances of a skid or rollover.

quizzes.question: Optional safety equipment may include emergency phone numbers, tire chains, and
quizzes.a: warning devices.
quizzes.b: a charged fire extinguisher.
quizzes.c: tire changing equipment.
quizzes.explain: Check for optional emergency items such as: chains, tire changing equipment, list of emergency phone numbers, and accident reporting kit.

quizzes.question: You are driving a heavy truck and do you have to exit a highway using an off-ramp that curves downhill. You should:
quizzes.a: Slow down to a safe speed before the turn
quizzes.b: Slow to the posted speed limit for the off-ramp
quizzes.c: Come to a full stop at the top of the ramp
quizzes.d: Wait until you are in the curve before downshifting
quizzes.explain: When exiting the expressway: Make necessary traffic checks, use proper signals, decelerate smoothly in the exit lane.

quizzes.question: While driving, ice builds up on your wipers and they no longer clean the windshield. You should:
quizzes.a: Keep driving, and reach out the window and knock the ice off
quizzes.b: Keep driving, and turn your defroster on
quizzes.c: Pull over in a safe place and remove the ice
quizzes.explain: Before the ice buildup becomes dangerous you should stop in a safe location and clear off the ice. With ice on the wiper blade it might not clear the windshield enough for safe driving.

quizzes.question: You are checking your steering and exhaust systems for a pre-trip inspection. Which of these statements is true?
quizzes.a: Steering wheel play of more than 10 degrees can make it hard to steer
quizzes.b: Leaks in the exhaust system are not a problem if they are outside the cab
quizzes.c: Some leakage of power steering fluid is normal
quizzes.explain: Steering wheel play of more than 10 degrees (approximately 2 inches movement at the rim of a 20-inch steering wheel) can make it hard to steer.

quizzes.question: The safety release valve is located on the Air tanks and is used by?
quizzes.a: Pulling a hand valve
quizzes.b: Self-operated when the air pressure is above 150 PSI
quizzes.c: Must be pulled after every working day
quizzes.explain: A safety relief valve is installed in the first tank the air compressor pumps air to. The safety valve protects the tank and the rest of the system from too much pressure. The valve is usually set to open automatically at 150 psi.

quizzes.question: What is the average perception distance?
quizzes.a: 117 feet
quizzes.b: 142 feet
quizzes.c: 158 feet
quizzes.explain: ¾ seconds. At 55 mph this accounts for 142 feet traveled.

quizzes.question: You should try to park your truck so that
quizzes.a: there is at least one curb next to your vehicle.
quizzes.b: you can pull forward when you leave.
quizzes.c: your vehicle is protected by trees or some overhang.
quizzes.explain: Avoid backing whenever you can. When you park, try to park so you will be able to pull forward when you leave.

quizzes.question: Stab braking:
quizzes.a: Should never be used
quizzes.b: Should only be used on slick roads
quizzes.c: Involves locking the wheels
quizzes.d: Involves steady pressure on the brake pedal
quizzes.explain: With the stab braking method, you apply your brakes all the way and release brakes when wheels lock up.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about driving in areas with strong winds is true?
quizzes.a: You should drive alongside other vehicles to help break up the wind
quizzes.b: The lighter your vehicle, the less trouble you will have with the wind
quizzes.c: Winds are especially a problem when coming out of tunnels
quizzes.explain: Strong winds make it difficult to stay in your lane. The problem is usually worse for lighter vehicles. This problem can be especially bad coming out of tunnels.

quizzes.question: The distance that you should look ahead of your truck while driving amounts to about _____ at highway speed.
quizzes.a: One block
quizzes.b: 500 feet
quizzes.c: 1/4 mile
quizzes.explain: Most good drivers look at least 12 to 15 seconds ahead. That means looking ahead the distance you will travel in 12 to 15 seconds. At lower speeds, that's about one block. At highway speeds it's about a quarter of a mile.

quizzes.question: The key principle in balancing cargo weight is to keep the load:
quizzes.a: To the front
quizzes.b: To the rear
quizzes.c: On the side away from most traffic
quizzes.explain: As part of your vehicle inspection, make sure the truck is not overloaded and the cargo is balanced and secured properly.

quizzes.question: What do you do if you get stuck on the railroad tracks?
quizzes.a: Stay in your vehicle.
quizzes.b: Scream for help.
quizzes.c: Get out of your vehicle and away from the tracks.
quizzes.explain: If for any reason you get stuck on the tracks, get out of the vehicle and away from the tracks. Check signposts or signal housing at the crossing for emergency notification information. Call 911  and give the location of the crossing using all identifiable landmarks, especially the DOT number, if posted.

quizzes.question: It has just reached freezing. Which of the following areas may be slippery?
quizzes.a: A wet-looking road
quizzes.b: A bridge
quizzes.c: A shaded area
quizzes.explain: Here are some signs of slippery roads: shaded areas, bridges, melting Ice, black Ice makes the road look wet, and just after rain begins.

quizzes.question: You are driving a new truck with a manual transmission. To take a long, steep downhill grade,
quizzes.a: use a lower gear than you would use to climb the hill.
quizzes.b: use the same gear you would use to climb the hill.
quizzes.c: shift into neutral and coast.
quizzes.explain: Newer trucks have low friction parts, streamlined shapes for fuel economy, more powerful engines meaning  they can go up hills in higher gears. For that reason, drivers of modern trucks may have to use lower gears going down a hill than would be required to go up the hill.

quizzes.question: Which of these tells you that cargo contains hazardous materials?
quizzes.a: A hazardous materials placard is on the vehicle.
quizzes.b: There is a four-inch, diamond-shaped hazardous materials label on the container.
quizzes.c: Both of these answers are correct.
quizzes.explain: If the cargo contains hazardous materials, you must inspect for proper papers, labeling, and placarding.

quizzes.question: What is the most important thing to remember about emergency braking?
quizzes.a: It wears brake linings
quizzes.b: Disconnecting steering axle brakes will help keep your vehicle in a straight-line during emergency braking
quizzes.c: If the wheels are skidding, you cannot control the vehicle
quizzes.explain: Emergency braking does not mean pushing down on the brake pedal as hard as you can. That will only keep the wheels locked up and cause a skid. If the wheels are skidding, you cannot control the vehicle.

quizzes.question: How often do you have to you stop to check your cargo while on the road?
quizzes.a: Every three hours or 150 miles
quizzes.b: Within the first 50 miles
quizzes.c: After each break you take
quizzes.explain: Inspect the cargo and its securing devices again within the first 50 miles after beginning a trip, and you will need to inspect again after you have driven for 3 hours or 150 miles and after every break you take during driving.

quizzes.question: What's the safest way to use turn signals when you intend to turn?
quizzes.a: Signal well in advance of the turn.
quizzes.b: Signal continuously up through the turn.
quizzes.c: Do both of the above.
quizzes.explain: There are three good rules for using turn signals: signal early, signal continuously, cancel your signal after the turn is completed.

quizzes.question: There are three types of truck inspections, which one is one of them?
quizzes.a: Pre-trip
quizzes.b: En-route
quizzes.c: Post-trip
quizzes.explain: Pre-trip is an inspection before you leave, en-route occurs during your daily travel, and post-trip happens at the end of your day.

quizzes.question: You are driving a heavy truck with a manual transmission. You do you have to stop the truck on the shoulder while driving on an upgrade. Which of these is a good rule to follow when putting it back in motion?
quizzes.a: Keep the clutch slipping while slowly accelerating
quizzes.b: Use the parking brake to hold the vehicle until the clutch engages
quizzes.c: Let the vehicle roll backwards a few feet before you engage the clutch
quizzes.d: Let the vehicle roll backwards a few feet before you engage the clutch, but turn the wheel so that the back moves away from the roadway
quizzes.explain: Keeping the parking brake set until you can feel the pull of the vehicle against the brakes will help you get moving on an uphill grade without rolling backwards.

quizzes.question: What is a common cause of tire fires?
quizzes.a: Underinflated tires
quizzes.b: Cold tires
quizzes.c: Overinflated tires
quizzes.explain: Under-inflated tires and duals that touch are the most common causes of tire fires.

quizzes.question: What are the proper collision procedures that are required for any collision in which you are involved but not seriously injured?
quizzes.a: Care for the injured and collect required information.
quizzes.b: Protect the area and notify the authorities.
quizzes.c: Both of the above are required procedures
quizzes.explain: When you're in an accident and not seriously hurt, you need to act to prevent further damage or injury. The basic steps to be taken at any accident are to: protect the area, notify authorities, and care for the injured.

quizzes.question: When driving in fog, you should be going?
quizzes.a: Fast enough to keep up with other drivers
quizzes.b: Faster than other traffic
quizzes.c: Only fast enough so that you can stop within the distance that you can see ahead
quizzes.explain: You should always be able to stop within the distance you can see ahead. Fog, rain, or other conditions may require that you slowdown to be able to stop in the distance you can see.

quizzes.question: You do you have to park on the side of a level, straight, four lanes, divided highway. Where should you place the three reflective triangles?
quizzes.a: One within 10 feet of the rear of the vehicle, one about 100 feet to the rear, and one about 200 feet to the rear
quizzes.b: One within 10 feet of the rear of the vehicle, one about 100 feet to the rear, and one about 100 feet from the front of the vehicle
quizzes.c: One about 50 feet from the rear of the vehicle, one about 100 feet to the rear, and one about 100 feet from the front of the vehicle
quizzes.explain: If you must stop on or by a one-way or divided highway, place warning devices 10 feet, 100 feet, and 200 feet toward the approaching traffic.

quizzes.question: To prevent skidding, you should
quizzes.a: turn the wheel sharply for all turns.
quizzes.b: adjust to conditions while driving.
quizzes.c: brake hard at all stops.
quizzes.explain: Don't over steer, over accelerate, or over brake by adjusting to conditions while driving. These include traction, curves, visibility, traffic and hills.

quizzes.question: What is counter steering?
quizzes.a: Turning the steering wheel counter clockwise
quizzes.b: Steering in the opposite direction from what other drivers expect you to do
quizzes.c: Using the steering axle brakes to prevent over steering
quizzes.d: Turning the wheel in the opposite direction after steering to avoid a traffic emergency
quizzes.explain: Be prepared to "counter-steer," that is, to turn the wheel back in the other direction, once you've passed whatever was in your path. You should think of emergency steering and counter-steering as two parts of one driving action.

quizzes.question: Hazardous materials placards are
quizzes.a: signs that help tax collectors determine how much to tax a hazardous cargo.
quizzes.b: signs that warn the public to stay at least 1,000 feet from the vehicle.
quizzes.c: signs on the inside of the vehicle that remind the driver of what he or she is carrying.
quizzes.d: signs on the outside of the vehicle that identify the hazard class of the cargo.
quizzes.explain: Placards are signs put on the outside of a vehicle that identify the hazard class of the cargo. A placarded vehicle must have at least four identical placards. They are put on the front, rear, and both sides.

quizzes.question: You are starting your truck in motion from a stop, as you apply power to the drive wheels they start to spin. You should:
quizzes.a: Take your foot off the accelerator
quizzes.b: Take your foot off the accelerator and apply the brakes
quizzes.c: Try a lower gear
quizzes.explain: Skids caused by acceleration usually happen on ice or snow. Taking your foot off the accelerator can easily stop them. If it is very slippery, push the clutch in. Otherwise, the engine can keep the wheels from rolling freely and regaining traction.

quizzes.question: The Commercial Driver's Handbook suggests several things to do when you pass a truck. Which of these is NOT one of them?
quizzes.a: Constantly blow your horn while passing the vehicle.
quizzes.b: Assume the other driver does not see you.
quizzes.c: At night, flash your lights from low to high beam and back while you pass the vehicle.
quizzes.explain: Whenever you are about to pass a vehicle, pedestrian, or bicyclist, assume they don't see you. They could suddenly move in front of you. When it is legal, tap the horn lightly or, at night, flash your lights from low to high beam and back. And, drive carefully enough to avoid a crash even if they don't see or hear you.

quizzes.question: How can you test the parking brake?
quizzes.a: Set the parking brake and pull forward gently.
quizzes.b: Move back slowly and set the parking brake.
quizzes.c: Set the parking brake at highway speeds.
quizzes.explain: To test the parking brake: fasten safety belt, set parking brake, place vehicle into a low gear, and gently pull forward against parking brake to make sure the parking brake holds.

quizzes.question: Medical certificates do you have to be renewed every:
quizzes.a: One year
quizzes.b: Two years
quizzes.c: Four years
quizzes.explain: A DOT physical exam is valid for up to 24 months. The medical examiner may also issue a medical examiner's certificate for less than 24 months when it is desirable to monitor a condition, such as high blood pressure.

quizzes.question: What is your most valuable way to see the sides and rear while driving?
quizzes.a: Get out and inspect the areas.
quizzes.b: Look out the window.
quizzes.c: Check your mirrors regularly.
quizzes.explain: It's important to know what's going on behind and to the sides. Check your mirrors regularly. Check more often in special situations.

quizzes.question: When does hydroplaning occur?
quizzes.a: Only occurs when there is a lot of water
quizzes.b: Only occurs at speeds above 50 mph
quizzes.c: Cannot occur when driving through a puddle
quizzes.d: Is more likely if tire pressure is low
quizzes.explain: Hydroplaning is more likely if tire pressure is low, or the tread is worn. The grooves in a tire carry away the water; if they aren't deep, they don't work well.

quizzes.question: Where or when should you test the stopping action of your service brakes?
quizzes.a: In a parking lot when the vehicle is not moving
quizzes.b: When the vehicle is moving at about 5 mph
quizzes.c: At a special brake testing center only
quizzes.explain: Wait for normal air pressure, release the parking brake, move the vehicle forward slowly about five mph, and apply the brakes firmly using the brake pedal. Note any vehicle "pulling" to one side, unusual feel, or delayed stopping action.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about double clutching and shifting is true?
quizzes.a: Double clutching should not be used when the road is slippery
quizzes.b: Double clutching should only be used with a heavy load
quizzes.c: You can use the tachometer to tell you when to shift
quizzes.explain: Use either the tachometer or the speedometer and upshift/downshift at the right rpm or road speed.

quizzes.question: The height of the truck center of gravity is very important for safe handling. A high center of gravity means you are more likely to do the following:
quizzes.a: Increase stopping distance
quizzes.b: Tip over
quizzes.c: Increase speed going downhill
quizzes.explain: The height of the vehicle's center of gravity is very important for safe handling. A high center of gravity means you are more likely to tip over. It is most dangerous in curves, or if you have to swerve to avoid a hazard.

quizzes.question: You do not have a hazardous materials endorsement on your commercial driver's license. When can you drive a truck hauling hazardous materials?
quizzes.a: Never
quizzes.b: Only when the vehicle does not require placards
quizzes.c: Only when the shipment will not cross state lines
quizzes.explain: You can drive a vehicle that carries hazardous materials if it does not require placards. If it requires placards, you cannot drive it unless your driver license has the hazardous materials endorsement.

quizzes.question: How often should you check your mirrors?
quizzes.a: Every 1/4 mile
quizzes.b: Every 8 to 10 seconds
quizzes.c: When turning or changing lanes
quizzes.explain: You should check your mirrors every 8 to 10 seconds to know what is going on around your vehicle at all times.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about backing a heavy truck is true?
quizzes.a: Backing is always dangerous
quizzes.b: You should back and turn toward the driver's side whenever possible
quizzes.c: You should use a helper and communicate with hand signals
quizzes.d: All answers are correct are true
quizzes.explain: Because you cannot see everything behind your vehicle, backing is always dangerous. Avoid backing whenever you can. When you have to back, here are a few simple safety rules: Start in the proper position, look at your path, use mirrors on both sides, back slowly, back and turn toward the driver's side whenever possible, and use a helper with clear hand signals whenever possible.

quizzes.question: Trucks and buses are subject to certain laws, restrictions, and regulations. Which of these statements is true?
quizzes.a: Federal regulations apply only to trucks and buses driven at least 50 miles on a trip.
quizzes.b: Laws and restrictions can vary from place to place.
quizzes.c: County and city laws do not apply to trucks and buses engaged in interstate commerce.
quizzes.explain: Be familiar with the laws in the states you drive in. These laws can cover aspects such as vehicle weight, cargo, and allowed routes. The regulations can vary from one jurisdiction to another, so know which jurisdictions you'll be driving through.

quizzes.question: Which of the following is a key steering component?
quizzes.a: Gear box
quizzes.b: Bearing plate
quizzes.c: Torque rod
quizzes.explain: The gear box is part of the steering system, and other choices are parts of the suspension system.

quizzes.question: Which of the following statements about retarders are correct?
quizzes.a: Retarders help slow a vehicle, reducing the need for braking.
quizzes.b: You should turn the retarder off whenever the road is wet, icy, or snow-covered.
quizzes.c: When your drive wheels have poor traction, the retarder may cause them to skid.
quizzes.d: All of the above statements are correct.
quizzes.explain: Retarders help slow a vehicle, reducing the need for using your brakes. When your drive wheels have poor traction, the retarder may cause them to skid. Therefore, you should turn the retarder off whenever the road is wet, icy, or snow covered.

quizzes.question: Which of the following materials can be used in a Class ABC fire extinguisher to put out fires?
quizzes.a: Carbon dioxide
quizzes.b: Water
quizzes.c: Dry chemical
quizzes.explain: An ABC fire extinguisher is a multi-purpose extinguisher and usually uses dry chemicals.

quizzes.question: Which of these is a sign of tire failure?
quizzes.a: Steering that feels heavy
quizzes.b: A loud bang
quizzes.c: Vibration
quizzes.explain: When driving a loud bang, vibrations, or heavy steering can indicate that a tire has failed.

quizzes.question: You do you have to inspect your cargo:
quizzes.a: Before starting
quizzes.b: Every 3 hours or 150 miles
quizzes.c: After every break
quizzes.explain: As part of your Vehicle inspection, make sure the truck is not overloaded and the cargo is balanced and secured properly. You need to inspect again: after you have driven for 3 hours or 150 miles, and after every break you take during driving.

quizzes.question: If you are confronted by an aggressive driver, what should you do?
quizzes.a: Avoid eye contact.
quizzes.b: Call the police from your cell phone if you can do it safely.
quizzes.c: Ignore rude gestures and refuse to react negatively.
quizzes.explain: First and foremost, make every attempt to get out of their way. Do not challenge them by speeding up, avoid eye contact, ignore gestures and refuse to react to them, and report aggressive drivers to the appropriate authorities.

quizzes.question: The total weight of the powered unit, the trailer, and the cargo is called
quizzes.a: gross vehicle weight.
quizzes.b: gross combination weight.
quizzes.c: gross axle weight.
quizzes.explain: Gross Combination Weight (GCW) is the total weight of a powered unit, plus trailer(s), plus the cargo.

quizzes.question: You should inspect wheel bearing seals for
quizzes.a: leaks.
quizzes.b: broken leaf springs.
quizzes.c: twisted axles.
quizzes.explain: Check wheel bearing seals to make sure they are not leaking.

quizzes.question: For an average commercial truck, being driven at 55 mph on dry pavement it will take about _____ to bring the truck to a stop.
quizzes.a: The length of a vehicle
quizzes.b: Twice the length of the vehicle
quizzes.c: More than the length of a football field
quizzes.d: The length of a football field

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about using mirrors is true?
quizzes.a: You should look at a mirror for several seconds at a time
quizzes.b: Convex mirrors make things look closer than they really are
quizzes.c: There are blind spots that your mirror cannot show you
quizzes.d: You should check your mirrors twice for a lane change
quizzes.explain: Convex mirrors present a view of people and objects that does not accurately reflect their size and distance from the vehicle.

quizzes.question: You are testing the stopping action of service brakes on a hydraulic system. Which of these can mean there is a problem?
quizzes.a: The vehicle pulls to one side when the brake pedal is pressed
quizzes.b: Stopping action is delayed
quizzes.c: The brake pedal feels unusual
quizzes.explain: With hydraulic systems a delay in braking, spongy or unusual feeling pedal, or pulling to one side or the other can mean there are issues.

quizzes.question: If a straight truck goes into a front wheel skid it will:
quizzes.a: Slide sideways and spin out
quizzes.b: Go straight ahead but will turn if you turn the steering wheel
quizzes.c: Go straight ahead even if the steering wheel is turned
quizzes.explain: In a front-wheel skid, the front end tends to go in a straight line regardless of how much you turn the steering wheel. On a very slippery surface, you may not be able to steer around a curve or turn.

quizzes.question: What three things related to cargo are the driver's responsibility?
quizzes.a: Inspecting the cargo, recognizing overloads, and properly securing the cargo
quizzes.b: Preparing the shipping papers, inspecting the cargo, and properly securing the cargo
quizzes.c: Weighing the cargo, properly securing the cargo, and delivering the cargo
quizzes.explain: You should make sure the truck is not overloaded and the cargo is balanced and secured before each trip.

quizzes.question: A truck is loaded with very little weight on the drive axle. What may result:
quizzes.a: Poor traction
quizzes.b: A need to disconnect the steering axle brakes
quizzes.c: Damage to drive axle tires
quizzes.explain: Too little weight on the driving axles can cause poor traction. The drive wheels may spin easily.

quizzes.question: If you do not have a CB radio, what is the first thing you should do at an accident scene?
quizzes.a: Protect the accident scene.
quizzes.b: Flag down help.
quizzes.c: Clear the area.
quizzes.explain: The basic steps to be taken at any accident are to: protect the area, notify authorities, care for the injured.

quizzes.question: How long does it take a typical tractor-trailer to clear a double railroad track?
quizzes.a: 14 seconds
quizzes.b: More than 30 seconds
quizzes.c: 10 seconds
quizzes.explain: It takes a typical tractor-trailer unit at least 14 seconds to clear a single track and more than 15 seconds to clear a double track.

quizzes.question: Which of the following is true about a truck with a high center of gravity?
quizzes.a: The cargo should be rearranged so that the heaviest parts of the cargo are under the lightest parts.
quizzes.b: The vehicle is less likely to tip over.
quizzes.c: The vehicle is less dangerous on curves.
quizzes.explain: It is very important to distribute the cargo, so it is as low as possible. Put the heaviest parts of the cargo under the lightest parts.

quizzes.question: Some traffic emergencies may require you to leave the road. Which of these is a good thing to remember?
quizzes.a: If you must leave the road, try to get all wheels off the pavement or at least one side of vehicle's tires off the road
quizzes.b: Brake gently to avoid skidding
quizzes.c: Use hard braking if you are moving at a speed greater that 20-mph
quizzes.d: Most shoulders will not support a large vehicle
quizzes.explain: In some emergencies, you may have to drive off the road. It may be less risky than facing a collision with another vehicle. Most shoulders are strong enough to support the weight of a large vehicle and, therefore, offer an available escape route.

quizzes.question: The most common cause of serious truck skids is:
quizzes.a: Driving too fast for road conditions
quizzes.b: Poorly adjusted brakes
quizzes.c: Bad tires
quizzes.explain: A skid happens whenever the tires lose their grip on the road. Most serious skids result from driving too fast for road conditions. Drivers who adjust their driving to conditions don't overaccelerate and don't have to over-brake or oversteer from too much speed.

quizzes.question: In your mirror, you see a car approaching from the rear. The next time you check your mirror, you don't see the car. To change lanes, you should
quizzes.a: assume the car left the roadway and change lanes as usual.
quizzes.b: ease into the other lane slowly so the other car can get out of the way.
quizzes.c: wait until you are sure the car isn't in your blind spot.
quizzes.explain: Before you change lanes, you must first make sure that no vehicles are hiding in your blind spots.

quizzes.question: You should use your mirrors to check:
quizzes.a: The condition of the tires and cargo
quizzes.b: Where the rear wheels of your vehicle are while you make turns
quizzes.c: Traffic gaps before you merge
quizzes.explain: If you're carrying open cargo, you can use the mirrors to check it. Special situations require more than regular mirror checks including; lane changes, turns, merges, and tight maneuvers. Use your mirrors to make sure the gap in traffic is large enough for you to enter safely.

quizzes.question: Which of the following should you NOT do in the event of hydraulic brake failure?
quizzes.a: Shift up.
quizzes.b: Pump the brakes.
quizzes.c: Use the parking or emergency brake.
quizzes.explain: When the system won't build up pressure here are some things you can do: downshift, pump the Brakes, use the parking brake, and find an Escape Route.

quizzes.question: How many red reflective triangles should you carry?
quizzes.explain: Safety requirements call for three red reflective triangles.

quizzes.question: Which of the following statements about backing is true?
quizzes.a: You should back and turn toward the driver's side whenever possible.
quizzes.b: Backing is always dangerous.
quizzes.c: Both of the above are true.
quizzes.explain: Because you cannot see everything behind your vehicle, backing is always dangerous. Avoid backing whenever you can. When you have to back, here are a few simple safety rules: start in the proper position, look at your path, use mirrors on both sides, back slowly, back and turn toward the driver's side if possible, use a helper whenever possible.

quizzes.question: You are driving on a two-lane road. An oncoming truck drifts into your lane and is headed straight for you. Which of the following should you do?
quizzes.a: Steer to the right.
quizzes.b: Brake hard.
quizzes.c: Prepare for impact.
quizzes.explain: If an oncoming driver has drifted into your lane, a move to your right is best. If that driver realizes what has happened, the natural response will be to return to his or her own lane.

quizzes.question: High beams should be:
quizzes.a: Used whenever it is safe and legal to do so
quizzes.b: Turned on when an oncoming driver does not dim his or her lights
quizzes.c: Dimmed when you are within 100 feet of another vehicle
quizzes.explain: Use high beams when it is safe and legal to do so. Use them when you are not within 500 feet of an approaching vehicle.

quizzes.question: In snow and ice, you should reduce your speed by?
quizzes.explain: On packed snow, reduce speed by a half, or more. If the surface is icy, reduce speed to a crawl and stop driving as soon as you can safely do so.

quizzes.question: One can recognize hazardous materials by looking at the container's
quizzes.a: shape.
quizzes.b: color.
quizzes.c: label.
quizzes.explain: Emergency personnel look for these things on the shipping paper. That is why it is vital that the proper shipping name, identification number, label, and placards are correct.

quizzes.question: The distance that you should scan ahead in a congested area is about?
quizzes.a: 32 feet
quizzes.b: One block
quizzes.c: Two Vehicle lengths ahead
quizzes.explain: Most good drivers look at least 12 to 15 seconds ahead. At lower speeds, that's about one block. At highway speeds it's about a quarter of a mile.

quizzes.question: Axle weight means the following?
quizzes.a: The weight transmitted to the tires from the axle
quizzes.b: The weight transmitted to the ground by one axle or one set of axles
quizzes.c: Both above
quizzes.explain: Axle Weight is the weight transmitted to the ground by one axle or one set of axles

quizzes.question: What is the I.P.D.E. method of driving?
quizzes.a: Identify, project, dedicate, execute
quizzes.b: Idea, predicts, decide, execute
quizzes.c: Identify, predict, decide, execute
quizzes.explain: Identify, Predict, Decide, and Execute (IPDE) is the step-by-step process behind the principles of defensive driving and complexities of visual perception in traffic.

quizzes.question: You should stop driving:
quizzes.a: After 5 hours
quizzes.b: After 7 hours
quizzes.c: After 9 hours
quizzes.explain: If you look sleepy, or you just feel sleepy, stop driving! You are in a very dangerous condition. The only safe cure is to sleep.

quizzes.question: Should the pre-trip inspection report from the last driver be reviewed during your pre-trip inspection?
quizzes.a: Yes
quizzes.b: No
quizzes.explain: You should review the inspection report made by the previous driver. Only if defects reported earlier have been certified as repaired or not needed to be repaired, should you sign the previous driver's report.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about drugs is true?
quizzes.a: A driver can use any prescription drug while driving
quizzes.b: Amphetamines can be used to help the driver stay alert
quizzes.c: Use of drugs can lead to accidents and / or arrest
quizzes.explain: Use of drugs can lead to traffic accidents resulting in death, injury, and property damage. Furthermore, it can lead to arrest, fines, and jail sentences. It can also mean the end of a person's driving career.

quizzes.question: Cargo that is not loaded or secured properly can cause many problems. Which of these statements is true?
quizzes.a: Overloading can damage vehicle
quizzes.b: Other highway users can hit or be hit by loose cargo
quizzes.c: Loose cargo can cause injury to the driver or passengers during a quick stop or crash
quizzes.d: All answers are correct are true
quizzes.explain: Loose cargo that falls off a vehicle can cause traffic problems and others could be hurt or killed. Loose cargo could hurt or kill you during a quick stop or crash. Your vehicle could be damaged by an overload.

quizzes.question: The minimum tire tread depth for front tires is
quizzes.a: 4/32 inch.
quizzes.b: 1/32 inch.
quizzes.c: 3/8 inch.
quizzes.explain: The steering tires must have traction to steer the vehicle. Enough tread is especially important in winter conditions. You should have at least 4/32-inch tread depth in every major groove on front tires and at least 2/32 inch on other tires.

quizzes.question: What is/are the important reason(-s) for doing a truck inspection?
quizzes.a: A vehicle defect that is found during inspection and corrected can prevent problems later.
quizzes.b: Federal and state regulations require you to inspect your vehicle.
quizzes.c: Both of the above
quizzes.explain: A vehicle defect found during an inspection could save you problems later. You could have a breakdown on the road that will cost time and dollars, or even worse, a crash caused by the defect. Also, Federal and state laws require that drivers inspect their vehicles.

quizzes.question: As the blood alcohol concentration or BAC goes up, what will happen?
quizzes.a: The drinker clearly sees how alcohol is affecting them
quizzes.b: The effects of alcohol decreases
quizzes.c: The person becomes more dangerous if allowed to drive
quizzes.d: The drinker can sober up in less time
quizzes.explain: Accident statistics show that the chance of a crash is much greater for drivers who have been drinking than for drivers who have not.

quizzes.question: In which of the following two situations should you downshift?
quizzes.a: Starting up a hill and finishing a curve
quizzes.b: Starting down a hill and finishing a curve
quizzes.c: Starting down a hill and entering a curve
quizzes.d: Starting up a hill and entering a curve
quizzes.explain: Special conditions where you should downshift are: before starting down a hill slow down and shift down to a speed that you can control without using the brakes hard, and before entering a curve slow down to a safe speed and downshift to the right gear before entering the curve.

quizzes.question: Which of these is a good rule to follow when driving at night?
quizzes.a: Keep your speed slow enough that you can stop within the range of your headlights
quizzes.b: Look directly at oncoming headlights only briefly
quizzes.c: Wear sun glasses
quizzes.explain: You should always be able to stop within the distance you can see ahead. At night, you can't see as far with low beams as you can with high beams. When you must use low beams, slow down.

quizzes.question: Which of these can cause the truck to skid?
quizzes.a: Turning too sharply
quizzes.b: Not enough weight on the front axle
quizzes.c: Over acceleration
quizzes.explain: Turning too sharply, not enough weight on the front axle, and over acceleration are all example of how to cause vehicle skids.

quizzes.question: When getting in to start the engine and inspect inside the cab, you do you have to
quizzes.a: start the engine and listen for unusual noises.
quizzes.b: make sure the parking brake is on and put the gearshift in neutral (or park if automatic).
quizzes.c: Both of the above
quizzes.explain: To get in and start the engine, make sure: the parking brake is on, gearshift is in neutral.

quizzes.question: Which is NOT one of the four basic skills that operating a commercial motor truck requires?
quizzes.a: Accelerating
quizzes.b: Steering
quizzes.c: First-aid certification
quizzes.explain: To drive a vehicle safely, you should be able to control its speed and direction. Safe operation of a commercial vehicle requires skill in: accelerating, steering, stopping, and backing safely.

quizzes.question: Which of the following statements is true?
quizzes.a: Many heavy vehicle accidents occur between midnight and 6 a.m.
quizzes.b: Most hazards are more easily seen at night than during the day.
quizzes.c: Most people are more alert at night than during the day.
quizzes.explain: If possible, try to schedule trips for the hours you are normally awake. Many heavy motor vehicle accidents occur between midnight and 6 a.m.

quizzes.question: Which one of these is not part of the engine compartment pre-trip inspection?
quizzes.a: Engine oil level
quizzes.b: Valve clearance
quizzes.c: Condition of belts and hoses
quizzes.explain: Oil Level: Indicate where dipstick is located and see that oil level is within safe operating range. Engine Compartment Belts Check belts for snugness up to 3/4-inch play at center of belt with no cracks or frays. Hoses: Inspect hoses for condition and leaks. Valve clearance is the incorrect answer.

quizzes.question: No matter how small the cargo is, it should have at least:
quizzes.a: One tie down
quizzes.b: Two tie downs
quizzes.c: Small loads do not have to have tie downs
quizzes.explain: No matter how small the cargo, it should have at least two tie-downs.

quizzes.question: The reaction distance is the distance traveled from the time
quizzes.a: the eyes see a hazard to the time the brain knows that it is a hazard.
quizzes.b: the eyes see a hazard to the time the foot pushes the brake pedal.
quizzes.c: the brain tells the foot to push the brake pedal to the time the foot actually pushes the pedal.

quizzes.question: The load means the following?
quizzes.a: The maximum safe weight a tire can carry at a specified pressure
quizzes.b: Specified pressure an air tire can carry
quizzes.c: Both above
quizzes.explain: The tire load is the maximum safe weight a tire can carry at a specified pressure. This rating is stated on the side of each tire.

quizzes.question: If an automatic transmission is forced into a lower gear while driving, what is not affected on a downgrade?
quizzes.a: Brakes
quizzes.b: Steering
quizzes.c: Clutch
quizzes.explain: Forcing an automatic transmission into a lower gear at high speed could damage the transmission and also lead to loss of all engine braking effect.

quizzes.question: A GPS device
quizzes.a: should have a screen larger than 4 inches.
quizzes.b: should be designed for truck navigation.
quizzes.c: should be made in the USA.
quizzes.explain: Most GPS devices are made for cars or other smaller vehicles, and so not have the size or weight of large vehicles programmed in. Make sure your GPS device is designed for large commercial vehicles.

quizzes.question: How far ahead should you look while driving?
quizzes.a: 7 to 12 seconds
quizzes.b: 5 to 10 seconds
quizzes.c: 12 to 15 seconds
quizzes.explain: Most good drivers look at least 12 to 15 seconds ahead. That means looking ahead the distance you will travel in 12 to 15 seconds.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about staying alert is true?
quizzes.a: A half-hour break for coffee will do more to keep you alert that a half-hour nap
quizzes.b: There are drugs that can overcome being tired
quizzes.c: If you must stop to take a nap, it should be at a truck stop or other public area never on the side of the road
quizzes.d: The only thing that can cure fatigue is sleep
quizzes.explain: If you are drowsy, the only safe cure is to get off the road and get some sleep. If you don't, you risk your life and the lives of others.

quizzes.question: When you check the condition of visible parts during your pre-trip inspection, make sure that the ___________ are secured against snagging, rubbing, or wearing.
quizzes.a: primary and secondary safety cab locks
quizzes.b: frame and cross members
quizzes.c: air lines and electrical wiring
quizzes.explain: Air lines and electrical wiring needs to be secured against snagging, rubbing, wearing.

quizzes.question: How do you correct a rear wheel acceleration skid?
quizzes.a: Apply more power to the wheels
quizzes.b: Stop accelerating
quizzes.c: Apply the brake
quizzes.explain: Skids caused by acceleration usually happen on ice or snow. Taking your foot off the accelerator can easily stop them. If it is very slippery, push the clutch in. Otherwise, the engine can keep the wheels from rolling freely and regaining traction.

quizzes.question: A car suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you NOT do?
quizzes.a: Slow down to prevent a crash.
quizzes.b: Signal and change lanes to avoid the car if possible.
quizzes.c: Honk and stay close behind the car.
quizzes.explain: What you should do is make a lane change or slow down to prevent a crash if the car suddenly cuts in front of you, and you should not honk or stay close behind the car.

quizzes.question: Blocking the cargo to keep it from shifting do you have to be done
quizzes.a: at the front, back, and/or sides of a piece of cargo.
quizzes.b: only at the front of a piece of cargo.
quizzes.c: at the cargo deck.
quizzes.explain: Blocking is used in the front, back, and/or sides of a piece of cargo to keep it from sliding. Blocking is shaped to fit snugly against cargo. It is secured to the cargo deck to prevent cargo movement.

quizzes.question: Which of these is a proper use of truck lights and flashers?
quizzes.a: Turning on your headlights during the day when visibility is reduced due to rain or snow
quizzes.b: Flashing your brake lights to warn someone behind you of a hazard that will require slowing down
quizzes.c: Flashing your brake lights to warn someone behind you that you're are going to stop on the road
quizzes.explain: Warn following drivers by flashing your brake lights, don't stop suddenly. If you see a hazard that will require slowing down, warn the drivers behind by flashing your brake lights. At dawn, dusk, in rain, or snow, you need to make yourself easier to see so turn on your lights.

quizzes.question: How far should a driver look ahead of the truck while driving?
quizzes.a: 6-9 seconds
quizzes.b: 9-12 seconds
quizzes.c: 12-15 seconds
quizzes.explain: Most good drivers look at least 12 to 15 seconds ahead. That means looking ahead the distance you will travel in 12 to 15 seconds.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements is true about causes of truck fires?
quizzes.a: Poor trailer ventilation can cause flammable cargo to catch fire.
quizzes.b: Carrying a properly charged fire extinguisher will help prevent fires.
quizzes.c: Underinflated tires will NOT cause a vehicle fire.
quizzes.explain: The following are some causes of vehicle fires: spilled fuel, improper use of flares, under-inflated tires , duals that touch, short circuits, loose connections, improper fueling, loose fuel connections, flammable cargo, improperly sealed or loaded cargo or with poor ventilation.

quizzes.question: Cargo should have at least one tie down for each:
quizzes.a: 10 feet of cargo
quizzes.b: 12 feet of cargo
quizzes.c: 15 feet of cargo
quizzes.explain: Cargo should have at least one tie-down for each ten feet of cargo. Make sure you have enough tiedowns to meet this need.

quizzes.question: What is average effective braking distance time?
quizzes.a: 214 feet
quizzes.b: 215 feet
quizzes.c: 216 feet
quizzes.explain: Braking distance is the distance your vehicle will travel, in ideal conditions; while you are braking. At 55 mph on dry pavement with good brakes, it can take about 216 feet.

quizzes.question: What is hydroplaning?
quizzes.a: Driving in the snow
quizzes.b: When you hit a pothole
quizzes.c: When the tires skim over the road surface
quizzes.explain: In some weather, water or slush collects on the road. When this happens, your vehicle can hydroplane. It's like water skiing--the tires lose their contact with the road and have little or no traction. You may not be able to steer or brake.

quizzes.question: Gross combination weight rating or GCWR means the following?
quizzes.a: The total weight of single vehicle
quizzes.b: The total weight of single plus load
quizzes.c: The total weight of a powered unit plus trailer(s)
quizzes.d: The total weight of a powered unit plus trailer(s) plus the cargo
quizzes.explain: The Gross Combination Weight Rating (GCWR) is the value specified by the manufacturer of the power unit and the towed unit(s), including load,  or any combination thereof.

quizzes.question: The center of gravity of a load:
quizzes.a: Should be kept as high as possible
quizzes.b: Can make a vehicle more likely to tip over on curves
quizzes.c: Is only a problem if the vehicle is overloaded
quizzes.explain: When more cargo is piled up in a truck, the "center of gravity" moves higher up from the road. The truck becomes easier to turn over.

quizzes.question: Which item below lists almost all or all the emergency equipment that do you need on a school bus?
quizzes.a: A hammer, nails, screwdriver, pliers, and screws
quizzes.b: A wrecking bar and fire extinguisher only
quizzes.c: A can of brake fluid, flashlight and a new bottle of window washer fluid
quizzes.d: A fire extinguisher, spare electrical fuses, road flare (fusees) or triangles, emergency kit, and body fluid cleanup kit.
quizzes.explain: In addition to checking for spare electrical fuses (if equipped), three red reflective triangles, and a properly charged and rated fire extinguisher, a school bus must also have: emergency kit, and  body fluid cleanup kit

quizzes.question: Which of the following statements about an escape ramp is FALSE?
quizzes.a: It may turn uphill.
quizzes.b: It may be located a few miles from the top of a downgrade.
quizzes.c: It may be made of soft gravel.
quizzes.d: It is not useful if you are traveling too fast.
quizzes.explain: Your best hope is an escape ramp. If there is one, there will be signs telling you about it. Use it. Ramps are usually located a few miles from the top of the downgrade. Escape ramps save lives, equipment and cargo.

quizzes.question: Which of these is especially true about your tires in hot weather?
quizzes.a: You should bleed a small amount of air to keep tire pressure steady.
quizzes.b: You should check tire mounting and air pressure before driving.
quizzes.c: If a tire is too hot to touch, you should hose it down with water.
quizzes.explain: Check the tire mounting and air pressure, inspect the tires every two hours or every 100 miles, air pressure increases with temperature, do not let air out or the pressure will be too low when the tires cool off, if a tire is too hot to touch remain stopped until the tire cools off.

quizzes.question: If you are traveling at 55 mph in a 30-foot truck, you should leave how many seconds of following distance?
quizzes.a: 3 seconds
quizzes.b: 4 seconds
quizzes.c: 7 seconds

quizzes.question: You are checking your wheels and rims for a pre-trip inspection. Which of these statements is true?

quizzes.question: If a straight truck (no trailer or articulation) goes into a front-wheel skid, it will

quizzes.question: Why should you signal continuously while turning?

quizzes.question: Whenever you stop for a break during your trip, you should

quizzes.question: You don't want to be a distracted driver, so you

To name a few.

quizzes.question: Some liquid tanks are divided into several smaller tanks by:

quizzes.question: You do you have to drive on a slippery road. Which of these is a good thing to do in such a situation?
