quizzes.b: brake firmly while slowly moving forward.
quizzes.c: brake firmly while slowly moving backward.
quizzes.explain: Pull forward at 5 mph, apply the service brake and stop. Check to see that the vehicle does not pull to either side and that it stops when brake is applied.

quizzes.question: Slack adjusters are
quizzes.a: between the power screw and push rod on disc brakes.
quizzes.b: a part of the air brake system that is used to adjust the brakes.
quizzes.c: between the push rod and S-cam on drum brakes.
quizzes.explain: Slack adjusters are an important part of your air brake system that allows you to adjust the brakes to ensure that they are safe. They are located in different places, depending on the type of brakes that you have.

quizzes.question: Brake drums have to not have cracks longer than _____ the width of the friction area?
quizzes.explain: Brake drums or discs have to not have cracks longer than one half the width of the friction area.

quizzes.question: A converter dolly with antilock brakes (ABS) is required to have
quizzes.a: a yellow lamp on the left side.
quizzes.b: a white lamp on the left side.
quizzes.c: a white lamp on the right side.
quizzes.explain: Converter dollies built on or after March 1, 1998, are required to have antilock brakes. These dollies will have a yellow lamp on the left side of the dolly.

quizzes.question: In an emergency stop you need to?
quizzes.a: Use the hand valve and service brakes.
quizzes.b: Use the stab braking method
quizzes.c: Use the brakes hard without locking the wheels.
quizzes.explain: Stab braking means that you: apply your brakes all the way, and release brakes when wheels lock up. As soon as the wheels start rolling, apply the brakes fully again.

quizzes.question: What’s the S-cam used for?
quizzes.a: To release the brakes.
quizzes.b: To test the slack adjusters.
quizzes.c: To apply the brakes.
quizzes.explain: When you push the brake pedal, air is let into each brake chamber. Air pressure pushes the rod out, moving the slack adjuster, thus twisting the brake camshaft. This turns the s-cam forcing the brake shoes away from one another and presses them against the inside of the brake drum.

quizzes.question: The application pressure gauge shows the driver how much pressure:
quizzes.a: Has been used on the trip.
quizzes.b: Is in the air tanks.
quizzes.c: Is being applied to the brakes.
quizzes.explain: Application Pressure Gauge shows how much air pressure you are applying to the brakes.

quizzes.question: If your truck or bus has dual parking control valves it means that you can use pressure from a separate tank to:
quizzes.a: Release the spring brakes to move a short distance.
quizzes.b: Apply more brake pressure if the main tank is getting low.
quizzes.c: Stay parked without using up service air pressure.
quizzes.explain: When main air pressure is lost, the spring brakes come on. Some vehicles have a separate air tank which can be used to release the spring brakes. This is so you can move the vehicle in an emergency.

quizzes.question: Spring brakes are
quizzes.a: brakes that come on automatically on a truck or tractor when the psi drops too low.
quizzes.b: made up of powerful springs that are held back by air pressure while you are driving.
quizzes.c: not going to take full effect until your psi drops to a certain range, typically 20 to 30 psi.
quizzes.explain: Spring brakes are an important backup system: powerful springs that automatically apply the brakes if they sense that air pressure has been lost for some reason, such as a leak. They will also apply the brakes if the psi gets too low, although ideally, you need to take control of your brakes before that happens.

quizzes.question: Air brake equipped vehicles have to have:
quizzes.a: An air use gauge.
quizzes.b: A supply pressure gauge.
quizzes.c: At least two brake heaters.
quizzes.explain: All vehicles with air brakes have a pressure gauge connected to the air tank. If the vehicle has a dual air brake system, there will be a gauge for each half of the system.

quizzes.question: If the low air pressure warning signal is not working,
quizzes.a: it may lead to sudden emergency braking in a single-circuit air system.
quizzes.b: you may lose air pressure, but at least you'll know about it anyway.
quizzes.c: neither of the above will happen.
quizzes.explain: If the warning signal doesn't work, you could lose air pressure and you would not know it. This could cause sudden emergency braking in a single-circuit air system. In dual systems the stopping distance will be increased. Only limited braking can be done before the spring brakes come on.

quizzes.question: During normal driving, spring brakes are usually held back by
quizzes.a: bolts and braces.
quizzes.b: springs.
quizzes.c: air pressure.
quizzes.explain: Parking or emergency brakes have to be held on by mechanical force because air pressure can eventually leak away. Spring brakes are usually used to meet these needs. When driving, powerful springs are held back by air pressure.

quizzes.question: Which of the following makes the total stopping distance for air brakes longer than that for hydraulic brakes?
quizzes.a: Perception distance.
quizzes.b: Reaction distance.
quizzes.c: Brake lag distance.
quizzes.explain: With air brakes there is an added delay or Brake Lag. This is the time required for the brakes to work after the brake pedal is pushed. With hydraulic brake, the brakes work instantly. With air brakes it takes a little time, one half second or more, for the air to flow through the lines to the brakes.

quizzes.question: What’s the best way to test if your vehicle's spring brakes come on automatically?
quizzes.a: Continue to step on and off the brake pedal until the manufacturer's low psi specification is met for spring brakes to deploy.
quizzes.b: On single vehicles, continue to step on and off the brake pedal until the parking brake valve pops out.
quizzes.c: On tractor-trailer vehicles, continue to step on and off the brake pedal until the parking brake valve pops out.
quizzes.d: All of the above are correct.
quizzes.explain: On both tractor-trailers and single vehicles, to test whether the spring brakes will come on automatically, use the same method you use for testing the low air pressure warning signal: Step on and off the brake pedal, this time until you reach an even lower psi reading and the parking brake valve closes or pops out.

quizzes.question: The brake pedal in an air brake system:
quizzes.a: Controls the speed of the air compressor.
quizzes.b: Is to be used as a footrest during normal driving.
quizzes.c: Controls the air pressure applied to the brakes.
quizzes.explain: You put on the brakes by pushing down the brake pedal. Pushing the pedal down harder applies more air pressure. Letting up on the brake pedal reduces the air pressure and releases the brakes.

quizzes.question: What activates the stop switch?
quizzes.a: Air pressure.
quizzes.b: Electrical.
quizzes.c: Mechanical force.
quizzes.explain: Drivers behind you have to be warned when you put your brakes on. The air brake system does this with an electric switch that works by air pressure. The switch turns on the brake lights when you put on the air brakes.

quizzes.question: Under which conditions are front wheel brakes good?
quizzes.a: None
quizzes.b: All weather conditions
quizzes.c: Wet or icy conditions only
quizzes.explain: Front wheel brakes have been shown to be ideal under all weather and driving conditions. Front wheel braking is unlikely to cause a skid even on icy roads.

quizzes.question: Excessive use of the service brakes may result in overheating, which can lead to
quizzes.a: expansion of the brake drums.
quizzes.b: improper adjustment of the S-cams.
quizzes.c: increased contact between the brake drums and the brake linings.
quizzes.explain: Brake fade results from excessive heat causing chemical changes in the brake lining, which reduce friction, and also causing expansion of the brake drums.

quizzes.question: On a long or steep downgrade, once you have reached your "safe" speed, brake until you are traveling
quizzes.a: 5 mph slower.
quizzes.b: 15 mph slower.
quizzes.c: 10 mph slower.
quizzes.explain: Snub braking method is used for steep downhill grades, in this method apply the brakes just hard enough to feel a definite slowdown. When your speed has been reduced to approximately five mph below your "safe" speed, release the brakes. When your speed has increased to your "safe" speed, repeat.

quizzes.question: In the event of a brake system failure, the emergency brake system uses __________ to stop the vehicle.
quizzes.a: only the parking brakes
quizzes.b: parts of the service brakes and parking brakes
quizzes.c: only the service brakes
quizzes.explain: The emergency brake system uses parts of the service and parking brake systems to stop the vehicle in a brake system failure.

quizzes.question: Before starting down a hill, you need to be in the proper gear
quizzes.a: so you can coast downhill.
quizzes.b: so you only have to apply the brake just hard enough to feel a definite slowdown.
quizzes.c: so you can go through the gears on the way down.
quizzes.explain: The use of brakes on a long and/or steep downgrade is only a supplement to the braking effect of the engine. Once the vehicle is in the proper low gear you need to only have to apply the brakes just hard enough to feel a definite slowdown.

quizzes.question: Which of the following are true about a dual air brake system?
quizzes.a: Usually, one system operates the front axle and the other one operates the rear axle.
quizzes.b: It uses a single set of brake controls.
quizzes.c: One system is called the "primary" system and the other one is called the "secondary" system.
quizzes.d: All of the above are true.
quizzes.explain: Most heavy-duty vehicles use dual air brake systems for safety. A dual air brake system has two separate air brake systems, which use a single set of brake controls. One system or primary system typically operates the regular brakes on the rear axle or axles. The other or secondary system operates the regular brakes on the front axle and possibly one rear axle.

quizzes.question: Brake lag distance at 55 mph is _____ feet?
quizzes.explain: The air brake lag distance at 55 mph on dry pavement adds about 32 feet.

quizzes.question: To test the static air leakage rate, you need to
quizzes.a: turn off the engine, release the parking brake, and let the system settle.
quizzes.b: charge the air system and leave the engine running.
quizzes.c: leave the engine running and release the parking brake.
quizzes.explain: With a fully-charged air system (typically 125 psi), turn off the engine, release the parking brake (push in); and time the air pressure drop.

quizzes.question: You need to know that your brakes are fading when:
quizzes.a: You must push harder on the brake pedal to control your speed on a downgrade.
quizzes.b: The brake feels spongy when pressure is applied.
quizzes.c: Pressure on the brake pedal is released and speed increases.
quizzes.explain: Increasing application pressure to hold the same speed means the brakes are fading.

quizzes.question: In air brake vehicles, the parking brakes need to be used:
quizzes.a: Whenever the vehicle is parked.
quizzes.b: To hold your speed when going downhill.
quizzes.c: Only during pre and post trip inspections.
quizzes.explain: Any time you park use the parking brakes. Pull the parking brake control knob out to apply the parking brakes, push it in to release.

quizzes.question: If your vehicle has an alcohol evaporator, every day during cold weather you need to:
quizzes.a: Check and fill the alcohol level.
quizzes.b: Change the alcohol from a new bottle.
quizzes.c: Clean the air filter with alcohol
quizzes.explain: Check the alcohol container and fill up as necessary, every day during cold weather.

quizzes.question: Which of the following need to you do before leaving your vehicle unattended?
quizzes.a: Set the parking brakes.
quizzes.b: Remove the keys.
quizzes.c: Chock the wheels.
quizzes.explain: Never leave your vehicle unattended without applying the parking brakes or chocking the wheels. Your vehicle might roll away and cause injury and damage

quizzes.question: Air brakes use _________ to make the brakes work.
quizzes.a: hydraulic fluid
quizzes.b: compressed air
quizzes.c: natural gas
quizzes.explain: Air brakes use compressed air to make the brakes work. Air brakes are a good and safe way of stopping large and heavy vehicles, but the brakes have to be well maintained and used properly.

quizzes.question: The air compressor governor controls:
quizzes.a: The speed of the air compressor.
quizzes.b: Air pressure applied to the brakes.
quizzes.c: When air is pumped into the air tanks.
quizzes.explain: The governor controls when the air compressor will pump air into the air storage tanks. When air tank pressure rises to the "cut-out" level around 125 psi, the governor stops the compressor from pumping air. When the tank pressure falls to the "cut-in" pressure around 100 psi, the governor allows the compressor to start pumping again.

quizzes.question: Vehicles with air brakes have to have:
quizzes.a: At least two air tanks.
quizzes.b: An air pressure gauge to show the pressure available for braking.
quizzes.c: An air pressure gauge to show air used by the brake chambers for braking.
quizzes.explain: All vehicles with air brakes have a pressure gauge connected to the air tank. If the vehicle has a dual air brake system, there will be a gauge for each half of the system.

quizzes.question: Modern air brake systems are three different systems combined: the service brakes, parking brakes, and _______ brakes.
quizzes.a: S-cam
quizzes.b: emergency
quizzes.c: foot
quizzes.explain: Air brakes are really three different braking systems: service brake, parking brake, and emergency brake.

quizzes.question: How can you tell if your vehicle is equipped with an antilock braking system (ABS)?
quizzes.a: Check if the vehicle was manufactured after 2000.
quizzes.b: Check if the vehicle was manufactured after 2010.
quizzes.c: ABS is still optional.
quizzes.d: Check if the vehicle was manufactured after 1998.
quizzes.explain: The Department of Transportation requires that ABS be on: air brake vehicles built on or after March 1, 1998.

quizzes.question: What can legally hold a parking or emergency brake in position for a truck, truck tractor or bus?
quizzes.a: Fluid pressure
quizzes.b: Spring pressure
quizzes.c: Air pressure
quizzes.explain: All trucks, truck tractors, and buses have to be equipped with emergency brakes and parking brakes. They have to be held on by mechanical force because air pressure can eventually leak away. Spring brakes are usually used to meet these needs.

quizzes.question: In which of the following situations need to you NOT apply the parking brakes?
quizzes.a: When you are testing whether they will hold the vehicle
quizzes.b: If the brakes are very hot
quizzes.c: If you're parking for less than one hour
quizzes.explain: Don't use the parking brakes if the brakes are very hot (from just having come down a steep grade), or if the brakes are very wet in freezing temperatures. If they are used while they are very hot, they can be damaged by the heat. If they are used in freezing temperatures when the brakes are very wet, they can freeze so the vehicle cannot move. Use wheel chocks instead.

quizzes.question: Air loss in a straight truck or bus need to not be more than _____ with the engine off and the brakes applied.
quizzes.a: 1 psi in 30 seconds
quizzes.b: 1 psi in one minute
quizzes.c: 3 psi in one minute
quizzes.explain: With a fully-charged air system, turn off the engine, release the parking brake, and time the air pressure drop. The loss rate need to be less than two psi in one minute for single vehicle brakes released, and three with the brakes applied.

quizzes.question: The most common type of foundation brakes found on heavy vehicles is the:
quizzes.a: Disc brakes
quizzes.b: Wedge drum
quizzes.c: S-cam brake
quizzes.explain: Wedge brakes and disc brakes are less common than s-cam brakes.

quizzes.question: If your vehicle has a properly functioning dual air brake system and minimum-sized air tanks, the air pressure need to build from 85 to 100 psi within ____ seconds.
quizzes.explain: When the engine is at operating rpms, the pressure need to build from 85 to 100 psi within 45 seconds in dual air systems. If the vehicle has larger than minimum air tanks, the buildup time can be longer and still be safe.

quizzes.question: If oil and water collects in the air tanks, what could happen to the brakes?
quizzes.a: The brakes could heat up.
quizzes.b: The brakes could lock up.
quizzes.c: The brakes could fail.
quizzes.explain: Compressed air usually has some water and some compressor oil in it, which is bad for the air brake system. For example, the water can freeze in cold weather and cause brake failure.

quizzes.question: When you press the brake pedal,
quizzes.a: compressed air enters the brake chambers.
quizzes.b: compressed air is released from the air tanks.
quizzes.c: compressed air is released from the brake chambers.
quizzes.explain: When you push the brake pedal, air is let into each brake chamber.

quizzes.question: If you need to stop quickly and your vehicle lacks antilock brakes, you can use
quizzes.a: the "controlled braking" method.
quizzes.b: the "stab braking" method.
quizzes.c: either of the above.
quizzes.explain: You need to brake in a way that will keep your vehicle in a straight line and allow you to turn if it becomes necessary. You can use the "controlled braking" method or the "stab braking" method.

quizzes.question: The modulating control valve allows you to control the
quizzes.a: amount of pressure in the brake system.
quizzes.b: front brakes.
quizzes.c: spring brakes.
quizzes.explain: In some vehicles a control handle on the dash board may be used to apply the spring brakes gradually. This is called a modulating valve. It is spring-loaded, so you have a feel for the braking action. The more you move the control lever, the harder the spring brakes come on.

quizzes.question: During your final air brake check, if the air pressure does not build up fast enough,
quizzes.a: the air pressure may drop too low during driving.
quizzes.b: have the problem fixed after your trip is over.
quizzes.c: the alcohol evaporator may be low.
quizzes.explain: If air pressure does not build up fast enough, your pressure may drop too low during driving, requiring an emergency stop. Don't drive until you get the problem fixed.

quizzes.question: If you have to make an emergency stop, you need to brake so that you:
quizzes.a: Can steer hard while braking hard.
quizzes.b: Use the full power of the brakes and lock them.
quizzes.c: Stay in a straight line and can steer.
quizzes.explain: You need to brake in a way that will keep your vehicle in a straight line and allow you to turn if it becomes necessary. You can use the "controlled braking" method or the "stab braking" method.

quizzes.question: After the initial drop, the maximum acceptable leakage rates per minute are
quizzes.a: 5 psi for single vehicles and 6 psi for combination vehicles.
quizzes.b: 5 psi for single vehicles and 10 psi for combination vehicles.
quizzes.c: 3 psi for single vehicles and 4 psi for combination vehicles.
quizzes.d: 1 psi for single vehicles and 3 psi for combination vehicles.
quizzes.explain: With a fully-charged air system typically 125 psi, turn off the engine, release the parking brake; and time the air pressure drop. The loss rate need to be less than two psi in one minute for single vehicles brakes released and three with the brakes applied, and less than three psi in one minute for combination vehicles with the brakes released and four with the brakes applied.

quizzes.question: How do brakes work on a long, steep downgrade?
quizzes.a: They work as a supplement to the braking effect of your engine.
quizzes.b: Not applicable; no braking effect is involved in a downgrade.
quizzes.c: They work as the main braking mechanism.
quizzes.d: They work as the main braking mechanism with the engine braking effect as an emergency backup.
quizzes.explain: The use of brakes on a long and/or steep downgrade is only a supplement to the braking effect of the engine.

quizzes.question: Oil and water usually collect in compressed air tanks. If you do not have an automatic tank drain, when need to you drain the air tanks?
quizzes.a: After every four hours of service.
quizzes.b: After every working day.
quizzes.c: Once a week.
quizzes.explain: If your vehicle does not have automatic air tank drains, drain your air tanks at the end of each working day to remove moisture and oil. Otherwise, the brakes could fail.

quizzes.question: An antilock braking system (ABS)
quizzes.a: increases your normal braking capability.
quizzes.b: activates when your wheels are about to lock up.
quizzes.c: decreases your normal braking capability.
quizzes.explain: ABS is a computerized system that keeps your wheels from locking up during hard brake applications.

quizzes.question: When can you leave your truck unattended without first applying the parking brakes or chocking the wheels?
quizzes.a: Never
quizzes.b: If you will only be away from the truck for a few minutes
quizzes.c: If you will be conducting your pre-trip inspection
quizzes.explain: Never leave your vehicle unattended without applying the parking brakes or chocking the wheels. Your vehicle might roll away and cause injury and damage.

quizzes.question: Air braking takes more time than hydraulic braking because air brakes:
quizzes.a: Use different brake drums.
quizzes.b: Need to have airflow through the lines to work.
quizzes.c: Require heavier return springs.
quizzes.explain: With air brakes there is an added delay called Brake Lag. This is the time required for the brakes to work after the brake pedal is pushed.

quizzes.question: When need to you use the parking brake?
quizzes.a: Only if you are away from your vehicle for an extended period of time
quizzes.b: Every time you leave your vehicle, with a few exceptions
quizzes.c: Only in urban areas where there are many other vehicles
quizzes.d: Every time you leave your vehicle for any length of time
quizzes.explain: Never leave your vehicle unattended without applying the parking brakes or chocking the wheels. Your vehicle might roll away and cause injury and damage. Exceptions are when the brakes are very hot, or wet and it is very cold outside. In this case use wheel chocks.

quizzes.question: Modern air brake systems combines three different systems.  They are the service brakes, the parking brakes and the:
quizzes.a: Emergency brakes.
quizzes.b: Foot brakes.
quizzes.c: S-cam brakes.
quizzes.explain: Air brakes are really three different braking systems: service brake, parking brake, and emergency brake.

quizzes.question: Which vehicles have to have low air pressure warning signals?
quizzes.a: Vehicles built after 2005 must have low air pressure warning signals.
quizzes.b: All vehicles with air brakes currently in operation must have low air pressure warning signals.
quizzes.c: Vehicles built after 2010 must have low air pressure warning signals.
quizzes.d: None; low air pressure warning signals are optional.
quizzes.explain: A low air pressure warning signal is required on vehicles with air brakes.

quizzes.question: The parking brake control
quizzes.a: applies the brakes during normal driving.
quizzes.b: lets the air out of the brake chambers.
quizzes.c: applies the brakes in the event of an emergency.
quizzes.explain: A parking brake control in the cab allows the driver to let the air out of the spring brakes. This lets the springs put the brakes on.

quizzes.question: Your vehicle has a dual air brake system. One of the systems loses air pressure. What will happen?
quizzes.a: The manual slack adjusters will not be set properly.
quizzes.b: The emergency brakes will come on immediately.
quizzes.c: Either the front or rear brakes will not be fully operational.
quizzes.explain: A dual air brake system has two separate air brake systems, which use a single set of brake controls. Each system has its own air tanks, hoses, lines, etc. One system typically operates the regular brakes on the rear axle or axles. The other system operates the regular brakes on the front axle and possibly one rear axle.

quizzes.question: The modulating control valve is?
quizzes.a: A spring-loaded valve that will let you put on the brakes on slowly if the service brakes fail.
quizzes.b: There is no such thing.
quizzes.c: Should not be used because it is very unsafe.
quizzes.explain: In some vehicles, a control handle on the dash board may be used to apply the spring brakes gradually. This is called a modulating valve. It is spring loaded, so you have a feel for the braking action. The more you move the control lever, the harder the spring brakes come on. They work this way, so you can control the spring brakes if the service brakes fail.

quizzes.question: Slack adjusters need to not have any more than _____ of play?
quizzes.a: 1/2 inch
quizzes.b: 1 inch
quizzes.c: 1-1/2 inches
quizzes.explain: Park on level ground and chock the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving, release the parking brakes so you can move the slack adjusters, using gloves and pull hard on each slack adjuster that you can reach, and if a slack adjuster moves more than about one inch where the push rod attaches to it then adjustments are needed.

quizzes.question: The brake system that applies and releases the brakes when the driver uses the brake pedal is the:
quizzes.a: Emergency brake system.
quizzes.b: Service brake system.
quizzes.c: Parking brake system.
quizzes.explain: The service brake system applies and releases the brakes when you use the brake pedal during normal driving.

quizzes.question: Tractor and straight truck spring brakes will come fully on when the air pressure drops to a range of
quizzes.a: 60 to 80 psi.
quizzes.b: 20 to 45 psi.
quizzes.c: 10 to 15 psi.
quizzes.explain: Tractor and straight truck spring brakes will come fully on when air pressure drops to a range of 20 to 45 psi (typically 20 to 30 psi).

quizzes.question: The air compressor will stop pumping air into the air tanks at ____ psi.
quizzes.explain: The governor controls when the air compressor will pump air into the air storage tanks. When air tank pressure rises to the "cut-out" level around 125 psi, the governor stops the compressor from pumping air. When the tank pressure falls to the "cut-in" pressure around 100 psi, the governor allows the compressor to start pumping again.

quizzes.question: Under ideal conditions, the average driver of a truck or bus equipped with air brakes and traveling at 55 mph would require what stopping distance?
quizzes.a: 300 to 350 feet
quizzes.b: More than 400 feet
quizzes.c: 100 to 250 feet
quizzes.explain: The total minimum distance your vehicle has traveled, in ideal conditions; with everything considered, including perception distance, reaction distance and braking distance, until you can bring your vehicle to a complete stop. At 55 mph, your vehicle will travel about 450 feet.

quizzes.question: To check the free play of manual slack adjusters on S-cam brakes you need to:
quizzes.a: Stop on level ground and apply the parking brakes.
quizzes.b: Park on level ground, chock the wheels, and release the parking brakes.
quizzes.c: Park on level ground and drain off air pressure before adjusting.
quizzes.explain: For manual slack adjustors, the brake pushrod need to not move more than one inch, with the brakes released, when pulled by hand.

quizzes.question: Your truck or bus has a dual air brake system. If a low air pressure warning comes on for only one system, what need to you do?
quizzes.a: Reduce your speed and drive to the nearest garage for repairs.
quizzes.b: Continue at normal speed and find a garage before the brakes lock.
quizzes.c: Stop. Safely park and continue only after the system is fixed.
quizzes.explain: The warning light and buzzer need to come on before the air pressure drops below 60 psi in either system. If this happens while driving, you need to stop right away and safely park the vehicle. If one air system is very low on pressure, either the front or the rear brakes will not be operating fully. This means it will take you longer to stop. Bring the vehicle to a safe stop and have the air brakes system fixed.

quizzes.question: When driving down a long steep hill you need to:
quizzes.a: Release the brake when you are 5 mph below your "safe" speed.
quizzes.b: Use stab braking.
quizzes.c: Begin braking when you are 10 mph above your safe speed.
quizzes.explain: Snub braking method is used for steep downhill grades, in this method apply the brakes just hard enough to feel a definite slowdown. When your speed has been reduced to approximately five mph below your "safe" speed, release the brakes. When your speed has increased to your "safe" speed, repeat.

quizzes.question: S-cam drum brakes have an S-cam in each brake chamber. Why is it called an "S-cam?"
quizzes.a: It is shaped like the letter "S."
quizzes.b: It makes the brake shoes move in an S-shaped path.
quizzes.c: It is constantly spinning whenever the wheel is spinning.
quizzes.explain: The S-cam is S-shaped. The s-cam forces the brake shoes away from one another and presses them against the inside of the brake drum.

quizzes.question: The supply pressure gauge shows the driver how much pressure:
quizzes.a: Has been used in this trip.
quizzes.b: Is in the air tanks.
quizzes.c: Is being sent to the brake chambers.
quizzes.explain: All vehicles with air brakes have a pressure gauge connected to the air tank, and it tells you how much pressure is in the air tanks.

quizzes.question: The brake pads need to be _____ for the brakes to be on?
quizzes.a: Worn 1/32 of an inch.
quizzes.b: Against the drum.
quizzes.c: Disconnected from the slack adjusters.
quizzes.explain: To stop, the brake shoes and linings are pushed against the inside of the drum. This causes friction, which slows the vehicle.

quizzes.question: Which of the following is not part of the braking process when you're driving a tractor-trailer combination vehicle with an antilock braking system (ABS)?
quizzes.a: Brake the same way no matter what you're driving: a vehicle with ABS, a vehicle with a trailer, or something else.
quizzes.b: When you slow down, you should monitor your tractor and trailer and ease off the brakes to keep control.
quizzes.c: You should use only the braking necessary to stay safely in control.
quizzes.d: You should drive faster so that you will be able to keep the trailer and tractor straight.
quizzes.explain: You need to not drive faster to keep the tractor and trailer straight. When you drive a vehicle with ABS, you need to brake as you always have. In other words: use only the braking force necessary to stop safely and stay in control; brake the same way regardless of whether you have ABS on the bus, tractor, the trailer, or both; as you slow down monitor your tractor and trailer and back off the brakes if it is safe to do so to stay in control.

quizzes.question: The safety release valve will blow at _____ psi?
quizzes.explain: A safety relief valve is installed in the first tank the air compressor pumps air to. The safety valve protects the tank and the rest of the system from too much pressure. The valve is usually set to open at 150 psi. If the safety valve releases air, something is wrong. Have the fault fixed by a mechanic.

quizzes.question: What’s the first thing you need to do if the low air pressure warning comes on?
quizzes.a: Stop.
quizzes.b: Upshift.
quizzes.c: Downshift.
quizzes.explain: If the low air pressure warning comes on, stop and safely park your vehicle as soon as possible.

quizzes.question: In controlled braking, you
quizzes.a: lock the wheels for short periods of time.
quizzes.b: can turn sharply.
quizzes.c: brake in a straight line.
quizzes.explain: You apply the brakes as hard as you can without locking the wheels. Keep steering wheel movements very small while doing this. If you need to make a larger steering adjustment or if the wheels lock, release the brakes. Re-apply the brakes as soon as you can.

quizzes.question: With S-cam drum brakes, when the brake chamber fills with air, air pressure pushes the push rod out, moving the ________ and thus rotating the ________.
quizzes.a: slack adjuster; brake camshaft
quizzes.b: slack adjuster; tie rod
quizzes.c: brake camshaft; tie rod
quizzes.explain: In S-cam brakes when you push the brake pedal, air is let into each brake chamber. Air pressure pushes the rod out, moving the slack adjuster, thus twisting the brake camshaft. This turns the s-cam. The s-cam forces the brake shoes away from one another and presses them against the inside of the brake drum.

quizzes.question: The tractor protection valve
quizzes.a: will close automatically if the air supply drops to a certain level.
quizzes.b: will close if you apply the parking brakes.
quizzes.c: provides the air supply for the brake system.
quizzes.explain: The tractor protection valve keeps air in the tractor or truck brake system need to the trailer break away or develop a bad leak, and it will close automatically if air pressure is low (typically 20-45 psi).

quizzes.question: To make an emergency stop with air brakes, using the stab braking method, you need to:
quizzes.a: Pump the brake pedal rapidly and lightly.
quizzes.b: Brake as hard as you can, get off the brakes when the wheels lock, get back on the brakes when the wheels start rolling again.
quizzes.c: Brake hard until the wheels lock, and then get off the brakes for as much time as the wheels were locked.
quizzes.explain: Stab braking means that you: apply your brakes all the way, and release brakes when wheels lock up. As soon as the wheels start rolling, apply the brakes fully again.

quizzes.question: Which of the following can cause brakes to fail or fade?
quizzes.a: Overheating, low air pressure, and not relying on the engine braking effect
quizzes.b: Not taking your foot off the accelerator
quizzes.c: Not pressing the brake pedal hard enough
quizzes.explain: Brakes can fade or fail from excessive heat caused by using them too much and not relying on the engine braking effect, they are also affected by adjustment, and low air pressure.

quizzes.question: Of the choices below, the first thing to do when a low air pressure warning comes on is:
quizzes.a: Stop and safely park as soon as possible.
quizzes.b: Up shift.
quizzes.c: Adjust the brake pedal for more travel.
quizzes.explain: When the low air pressure warning light and buzzer first come on, bring the vehicle to a safe stop right away, while you can still control the brakes.

quizzes.question: If your vehicle has an alcohol evaporator, it is there to:
quizzes.a: Rid the wet tank of alcohol that condenses and sits at the bottom.
quizzes.b: Eliminate the need for daily tank draining.
quizzes.c: Reduce the risk of ice in air brake valves in cold weather.
quizzes.explain: Some air brake systems have an alcohol evaporator to put alcohol into the air system. This helps to reduce the risk of ice in air brake valves and other parts during cold weather. Daily air tank drainage is still needed to get rid of water and oil.

quizzes.question: A straight truck or bus air brake system need to not leak at a rate of more than ____ psi per minute with the engine off and the brakes released.
quizzes.explain: With a fully-charged air system, turn off the engine, release the parking brake, and time the air pressure drop. The loss rate need to be less than two psi in one minute for single vehicle brakes released, and three with the brakes applied.

quizzes.question: The driver have to be able to see a warning that is given before air pressure in the service air tanks falls below:
quizzes.a: 20 psi
quizzes.b: 40 psi
quizzes.c: 60 psi
quizzes.explain: Low air warning devices (buzzer, light, flag) need to activate before air pressure drops below 60 psi or level specified by the manufacturer.

quizzes.question: If the air tanks are not drained,
quizzes.a: your transmission fluid may drain out.
quizzes.b: your brakes may fail because of water freezing.
quizzes.c: you will drive too quickly.
quizzes.d: your left side brake will cease to operate.
quizzes.explain: Compressed air usually has some water and some compressor oil in it, which is bad for the air brake system. For example, the water can freeze in cold weather and cause brake failure.

quizzes.question: A typical air brake system is fully charged at
quizzes.a: 150 psi.
quizzes.b: 75 psi.
quizzes.c: 125 psi.
quizzes.explain: Pumping by the air compressor need to start at about 100 psi and stop at about 125 psi.

quizzes.question: If the spring brakes are on, when need to you push the brake pedal?
quizzes.a: Only when driving downhill
quizzes.b: Never
quizzes.c: Only on a slippery road
quizzes.explain: Never push the brake pedal down when the spring brakes are on. If you do, the brakes could be damaged by the combined forces of the springs and the air pressure.

quizzes.question: Which of the following is the most important thing about hard braking?
quizzes.a: Disconnecting the steering axle brakes will help keep your vehicle in a straight-line during emergency braking.
quizzes.b: Don't lock the wheels for longer than an instant.
quizzes.c: Never do it without downshifting first.
quizzes.explain: Emergency braking does not mean pushing down on the brake pedal as hard as you can. That will only keep the wheels locked up and cause a skid. If the wheels are skidding, you cannot control the vehicle.

quizzes.question: Which of the following will be true about your brake function if your antilock braking system (ABS) fails?
quizzes.a: You will still have normal brake function and will just need to get the ABS repaired soon.
quizzes.b: It may cause problems with other mechanical systems and possibly pose a huge fire risk.
quizzes.c: It will slow your truck to a halt and force you to pull over.
quizzes.d: You will have no brake function and your truck will be out of control.
quizzes.explain: Without ABS you still have normal brake functions. Drive and brake as you always have.

quizzes.question: What’s the best way to test your vehicle's low air pressure warning signal?
quizzes.a: With the engine off, step on and off the brake pedal to lower the air pressure below 60 psi.
quizzes.b: Pump the brakes while your vehicle is fully on.
quizzes.c: Pump the brakes until the air pressure drops below 30 psi.
quizzes.d: Manually let the air out of your brakes and see if the signal comes on.
quizzes.explain: Shut the engine off when you have enough air pressure so that the low-pressure warning signal is not on. Turn the electrical power on and step on and off the brake pedal to reduce air tank pressure. The low air pressure warning signal have to come on before the pressure drops to less than 60 psi in the air tank.

quizzes.question: Which of the following is NOT part of the drum brake?
quizzes.a: Slack adjuster
quizzes.b: Brake drum
quizzes.c: Return spring
quizzes.explain: Drum brakes are on each of your vehicle's axles and contain about 10 different parts, including the axle, slack adjuster, and brake drum itself. While a safety valve is part of the air brake system, it is not part of the drum brake.

quizzes.question: Which of the following can cause brakes to fade or fail?
quizzes.a: Excessive use of the service brakes
quizzes.b: Not relying enough on engine braking
quizzes.c: Brakes being out of adjustment
quizzes.explain: Brakes can fade or fail from excessive heat caused by using them too much and not relying on the engine braking effect. Brake fade is also affected by adjustment.

quizzes.question: If the air compressor need to develop a leak, what keeps the air in the tanks?
quizzes.a: The tractor protection valve
quizzes.b: The emergency relay valve
quizzes.c: The one-way check valve
quizzes.explain: Installed on the compressor side of the air tank is a one-way check valve, it allows air into the tanks, but does not allow it to flow back to the compressor.

quizzes.question: To apply the parking brakes under normal conditions,
quizzes.a: be sure the air brake system is fully pressurized.
quizzes.b: let the air out of the brake chambers.
quizzes.c: turn off the engine.
quizzes.explain: A parking brake control in the cab allows the driver to let the air out of the spring brakes. This lets the springs put the brakes on.

quizzes.question: What are spring brakes?
quizzes.a: If the air brakes leak down, springs apply the brakes to stop the vehicle.
quizzes.b: They are the CamLaster brakes.
quizzes.c: They are the springs on the brake pedal.
quizzes.explain: When driving, powerful springs are held back by air pressure. If the air pressure is removed, the springs put on the brakes. A leak in the air brake system, which causes all the air to be lost, will also cause the springs to put on the brakes.

quizzes.question: Excessive heat caused by overuse of the service brakes can cause
quizzes.a: the modulating control valve to wear out.
quizzes.b: the brakes to fade.
quizzes.c: the brake linings to split.
quizzes.explain: Brakes can fade or fail from excessive heat caused by using them too much and not relying on the engine braking effect.

quizzes.question: Why drain water from the compressed air tanks?
quizzes.a: The low boiling point of water reduces braking power.
quizzes.b: Water can freeze in cold weather and cause brake failure.
quizzes.c: Water over cools the compressor.
quizzes.explain: Compressed air usually has some water and some compressor oil in it, which is bad for the air brake system, the water can freeze in cold weather and cause brake failure. The water and oil tend to collect in the bottom of the air tank. Be sure that you drain the air tanks completely.

quizzes.question: The braking power of the spring brakes:
quizzes.a: Increases when the service brakes are hot.
quizzes.b: Depends on the adjustment of the service brakes.
quizzes.c: Is not affected by the condition of the service brakes.
quizzes.explain: The braking power of spring brakes depends on the brakes being in adjustment. If the brakes are not adjusted properly, neither the regular brakes nor the emergency/parking brakes will work right.

quizzes.question: Which of the following can cause brakes to fade or fail?
quizzes.a: Excessive use of the service brakes
quizzes.b: Not relying enough on engine braking
quizzes.c: Brakes being out of adjustment
quizzes.explain: Brakes can fade or fail from excessive heat caused by using them too much and not relying on the engine braking effect. Brake fade is also affected by adjustment.

quizzes.question: As part of your vehicle inspection test, if your vehicle is equipped with air brakes and has a trailer, you will inspect the air connections between the truck or tractor and the trailer. Make sure that the ________ are locked in place and free of damage or air leaks.
quizzes.a: glad hands
quizzes.b: lug nuts
quizzes.c: pins
quizzes.explain: Glad hands are coupling devices used to connect the service and emergency air-lines from the truck or tractor to the trailer.

quizzes.question: Which statement best illustrates the "crack-the-whip" effect?
quizzes.a: The trailer is half full, and the cargo is loaded in the front of the trailer. When making a sudden movement of the steering wheel, the cargo will tend to forcefully slide to the back of the trailer, forcing the trailer to roll over.
quizzes.b: When making a quick lane change or sudden movement of the steering wheel, the tractor tends to rock and sway. The velocity of the rearmost trailer forces the tractor to roll over before the trailer.
quizzes.c: When making a quick lane change or sudden movement of the steering wheel, the rear trailer tends to swing out. The force of the rear trailer becomes amplified, causing it to roll over.
quizzes.explain: Trucks with trailers have a dangerous crack-the-whip effect caused by rearward amplification. When you make a quick lane change, the crack-the-whip effect can turn the trailer over. There are many accidents where only the trailer has overturned.

quizzes.question: You need to not use the trailer hand brake to straighten out a jackknifing trailer, because
quizzes.a: the brakes on the trailer wheels caused the skid in the first place.
quizzes.b: the brakes on the trailer wheels will not respond to the hand brake.
quizzes.c: the brake handle is too hard to reach.
quizzes.explain: When the wheels of a trailer lock up, the trailer will tend to swing around. This is more likely to happen when the trailer is empty or lightly loaded. This type of jackknife is often called a "trailer jackknife." Applying the trailer brakes would extend the skid and trailer jackknife.

quizzes.question: In normal driving, some drivers use the hand valve before applying the brake pedal to prevent a jackknife. Which of these statements is true?
quizzes.a: It should not be done
quizzes.b: It results in less skidding than using the brake pedal alone
quizzes.c: It is the best way to brake and keep the truck in a straight line
quizzes.explain: The trailer hand valve, also called the trolley valve or Johnson bar, works the trailer brakes. The trailer hand valve need to be used only to test the trailer brakes. Do not use it in driving because of the danger of making the trailer skid.

quizzes.question: When you test the tractor protection valve, the red air supply control knob need to go into the ________ position.
quizzes.a: emergency
quizzes.b: normal
quizzes.c: neutral
quizzes.explain: –45 psi, the trailer air supply control knob need to pop out, or the valve control need to go from the "normal" to the "emergency" position.

quizzes.question: A tractor with a(n) _______ trailer requires the shortest amount of stopping distance.
quizzes.a: fully loaded
quizzes.b: empty
quizzes.c: lightly loaded
quizzes.explain: The heavier the vehicle, the more work the brakes have to do to stop it, and the more heat they absorb. But the brakes, tires, springs, and shock absorbers on heavy vehicles are designed to work best when the vehicle is fully loaded. Empty trucks require greater stopping distances because an empty vehicle has less traction.

quizzes.question: Air lines on a combination vehicle are often color coded to keep them from getting mixed up. The emergency line is _____; the service line is _____.
quizzes.a: Red, blue
quizzes.b: Black, yellow
quizzes.c: Blue, red
quizzes.explain: Emergency lines are often coded with red (red hose, red couplers, or other parts) to keep from getting them mixed up with the blue service line.

quizzes.question: Trucks roll over more easily when fully loaded and are
quizzes.a: two times more likely to roll over in a crash than empty rigs.
quizzes.b: five times more likely to roll over in a crash than empty rigs.
quizzes.c: ten times more likely to roll over in a crash than empty rigs.
quizzes.explain: When more cargo is piled up in a truck, the "center of gravity" moves higher up from the road. The truck becomes easier to turn over. Fully loaded rigs are ten times more likely to roll over in a crash than empty rigs.

quizzes.question: You need to not back a tractor under a trailer until the whole air system is
quizzes.a: at normal pressure.
quizzes.b: bled down to half the maximum pressure.
quizzes.c: between 60 and 80 psi.
quizzes.explain: Make sure air pressure is up to normal before backing under the trailer.

quizzes.question: Air and electrical lines from the tractor to the trailer need to be
quizzes.a: pulled tight with very little slack.
quizzes.b: secured but with enough slack for turns.
quizzes.c: resting on the frame of the tractor.
quizzes.explain: Make sure air and electrical lines are not tangled, pinched, dragging against tractor parts, and have enough slack for turns.

quizzes.question: If you do not do the final air brake check for air leaks and fix them before driving,
quizzes.a: you could lose your brakes while driving.
quizzes.b: tire pressure will drop.
quizzes.c: your fuel usage will increase.
quizzes.explain: If the air pressure falls more than the specified psi in one minute for combination vehicles, the air loss rate is too much. Check for air leaks and fix before driving the vehicle. Otherwise, you could lose your brakes while driving.

quizzes.question: Which answer is correct for the air valves when testing the trailer service brakes only?
quizzes.a: Service Brake: off; Parking Brake: off; Trailer air supply: in / open; Trolley: applied
quizzes.b: Service Brake: off; Parking Brake: off; Trailer air supply: in / open; Trolley: released
quizzes.c: Service Brake: off; Parking Brake: off; Trailer air supply: out; Trolley: applied
quizzes.explain: Check for normal air pressure, release the parking brakes, release the service brake, make sure the trailer air supply is in / open, move the vehicle forward slowly, and apply trailer brakes with the hand control or trolley valve. You need to feel the brakes come on. This tells you the trailer brakes are connected and working.

quizzes.question: You are coupling a tractor to a semi-trailer and have backed up but are not under  it. What need to you hook up before backing under?
quizzes.a: The electrical service cable
quizzes.b: The emergency and service air lines
quizzes.c: Nothing; back up and lock the fifth wheel
quizzes.explain: Check glad hand seals and connect tractor emergency and service air-line to trailer emergency and service glad hand. Make sure air-lines are safely supported where they won't be crushed or caught while tractor is backing under the trailer.

quizzes.question: When coupling, the proper position of the fifth wheel is
quizzes.a: level with the ground.
quizzes.b: tilted down toward the rear of the tractor.
quizzes.c: tilted up toward the rear of the tractor.
quizzes.explain: Check if fifth wheel is in proper position for coupling: The fifth wheel need to be tilted down toward rear of tractor.

quizzes.question: If your test of the tractor protection valve is successful,
quizzes.a: the tractor protection valve control (trailer air supply control) will pop out or go from "normal" to "emergency."
quizzes.b: the parking brake valve will pop out.
quizzes.c: the low air pressure warning signal will come on.
quizzes.explain: The tractor protection valve keeps air in the tractor or truck brake system need to the trailer break away or develop a bad leak. The tractor protection valve is controlled by the "trailer air supply" control valve in the cab. The control valve allows you to open and shut the tractor protection valve. The tractor protection valve will close automatically if air pressure is low (in the range of 20 to 45 psi). When the tractor protection valve closes, it stops any air from going out of the tractor.

quizzes.question: The tractor protection valve will close and the trailer _______ brakes will come on when there is a major leak in the brake line.
quizzes.a: emergency
quizzes.b: service
quizzes.c: parking
quizzes.explain: When the tractor protection valve closes, it stops any air from going out of the tractor. It also lets the air out of the trailer emergency line. This causes the trailer emergency brakes to come on

quizzes.question: You are driving a combination vehicle when the trailer breaks away, pulling apart both air lines. You would expect the trailer brakes to come on and:
quizzes.a: The tractor to lose all air pressure
quizzes.b: The tractor protection valve to close
quizzes.c: The trailer supply valve to stay open
quizzes.explain: The tractor protection valve keeps air in the tractor or truck brake system need to the trailer break away or develop a bad leak. The tractor protection valve is controlled by the trailer air supply control valve in the cab. The control valve allows you to open and shut the tractor protection valve. The tractor protection valve will close automatically if air pressure is low (in the range of 20 to 45 psi). When the tractor protection valve closes, it stops any air from going out of the tractor. It also lets the air out of the trailer emergency line. This causes the trailer emergency brakes to come on, with possible loss of control.

quizzes.question: The front trailer supports are up, and the trailer is resting on the tractor, make sure:
quizzes.a: There is enough clearance between the tops of the tractor tires and the nose of the trailer
quizzes.b: There is enough clearance between the tractor frame and the landing gear
quizzes.c: Both answers are correct
quizzes.explain: Check for enough clearance between rear of tractor frame and landing gear and  between the top of the tractor tires and the nose of the trailer.

quizzes.question: What’s the safest way for you to make a turn without entering another traffic lane?
quizzes.a: If you must cross into the oncoming lane to make a turn and you see vehicles coming toward you, stop and back up for them.
quizzes.b: You should turn wide as you complete the turn.
quizzes.c: You should turn wide before you start the turn.
quizzes.explain: If you are driving a truck or bus that cannot make the right turn without swinging into another lane, turn wide as you complete the turn. Keep the rear of your vehicle close to the curb. This will stop other drivers from passing you on the right.

quizzes.question: You are coupling a tractor and semi-trailer and have connected the air lines. Before backing under the trailer, you need to:
quizzes.a: Supply air to the trailer system, then pull out the trailer air supply knob to lock the trailer brakes
quizzes.b: Make sure that the trailer brakes are off
quizzes.c: Apply the service brakes twice to alert others
quizzes.explain: From cab, push in air supply knob or move tractor protection valve control from the emergency to the normal position to supply air to the trailer brake system. Check brake system for crossed air-lines. Shut engine off so you can hear the brakes. Check air brake system pressure gauge for signs of major air loss.

quizzes.question: The best way to tell if your trailer has started to skid is to
quizzes.a: hear the wheels skidding.
quizzes.b: feel for "pulling" in the cab.
quizzes.c: see it in your mirrors.
quizzes.explain: The earliest way to notice that your trailer is jackknifing is to see it swinging out in your mirrors.

quizzes.question: A tractor with a(n) _______ trailer requires the shortest amount of stopping distance.
quizzes.a: fully loaded
quizzes.b: empty
quizzes.c: lightly loaded
quizzes.explain: The heavier the vehicle, the more work the brakes have to do to stop it, and the more heat they absorb. But the brakes, tires, springs, and shock absorbers on heavy vehicles are designed to work best when the vehicle is fully loaded. Empty trucks require greater stopping distances because an empty vehicle has less traction.

quizzes.question: How need to you test the tractor trailer connection for security?
quizzes.a: Put the tractor in gear and pull ahead with a sharp jerk
quizzes.b: Pull gently forward in low gear against the locked trailer brakes, then inspect the coupling
quizzes.c: Rock the trailer back and forth with the trailer brakes locked
quizzes.explain: Raise trailer landing gear slightly off ground. Pull tractor gently forward while the trailer brakes are still locked to check that the trailer is locked onto the tractor.

quizzes.question: Low underneath clearance vehicles can be risky at railroad crossings because
quizzes.a: they are more likely to get stuck on raised railroad crossings.
quizzes.b: they are more likely to jackknife on the uneven ground.
quizzes.c: they may take longer to stop.
quizzes.explain: Railroad tracks can also cause problems, particularly when pulling trailers with a low underneath clearance. Don't take a chance on getting hung up halfway across.

quizzes.question: On a trailer, where is the yellow antilock brake (ABS) malfunction lamp located?
quizzes.a: On the front left or rear left corner
quizzes.b: On the left side and on the front center
quizzes.c: On the right rear corner
quizzes.explain: Trailers will have yellow ABS malfunction lamps on the left side, either on the front or rear corner.

quizzes.question: Before you start to uncouple, you have to
quizzes.a: make sure the trailer has enough of an air supply for its brakes to hold.
quizzes.b: call in for any special requests.
quizzes.c: make sure the ground is solid and can support the weight of the trailer.
quizzes.explain: Make sure surface of parking area can support weight of trailer.

quizzes.question: You supply air to the trailer tanks by:
quizzes.a: Pushing in the trailer air supply valve
quizzes.b: Pulling out the trailer air supply valve
quizzes.c: Connecting the service line glad hand
quizzes.d: Pulling out the system parking brake
quizzes.explain: From cab, push in air supply knob or move tractor protection valve control from the emergency to the normal position to supply air to the trailer brake system.

quizzes.question: At night, when a vehicle is carrying a load that extends four feet or more beyond the rear of the body, there have to be _______ at the extreme end of the load.
quizzes.a: red flags
quizzes.b: red lights
quizzes.c: a red flag
quizzes.explain: According to federal regulations, if the load projects more than 4 feet behind the rear of the vehicle, the end of the load have to be marked as follows: (1) with red flags, each 18 inches square, in the daytime; or (2) with two red lights at night.

quizzes.question: What gear need to the tractor engine be in after you uncouple the trailer and are inspecting the trailer supports?
quizzes.a: Neutral
quizzes.b: High reverse
quizzes.c: Low reverse
quizzes.explain: Before inspection the trailer while coupling you need to secure the vehicle. Put transmission in neutral. Put parking brakes on. Shut off engine and take key with you so someone else won't move truck while you are under it.

quizzes.question: The tractor protection valve is designed to close automatically when the air pressure falls into the pressure range specified by the manufacturer, typically
quizzes.a: 75 to 100 psi.
quizzes.b: 50 to 75 psi.
quizzes.c: 20 to 45 psi.

quizzes.question: If the service airline comes apart while you are driving a combination vehicle, but the emergency line stays together, what will happen right away?
quizzes.a: The emergency tractor brakes will come on
quizzes.b: The trailer's air tank will exhaust through the open line
quizzes.c: Nothing is likely to happen until you try to apply the brakes
quizzes.explain: You may not notice a major leak in the service line until you try to put the brakes on. Then, the air loss from the leak will lower the air tank pressure quickly. If it goes low enough, the trailer emergency brakes will come on.

quizzes.question: If the trailer has antilock brakes (ABS) but the tractor doesn't,
quizzes.a: the trailer is more likely to swing out.
quizzes.b: the trailer is still less likely to swing out.
quizzes.c: it doesn't make it any more, or less likely that the trailer will swing out.
quizzes.explain: When only the trailer has ABS, the trailer is less likely to swing out, but if you lose steering control or start a tractor jackknife, let up on the brakes if you can safely do so until you regain control.

quizzes.question: The air leakage rate for a combination vehicle (engine off, brakes off) need to be no more than ____ PSI per minute.
quizzes.explain: With a fully-charged air system, turn off the engine, release the parking brake; and time the air pressure drop. The loss rate need to be less than three psi in one minute for combination vehicles, we do not add the additional second here because the brakes are released.

quizzes.question: Which part of the kingpin need to the locking jaws close around?
quizzes.a: The shank
quizzes.b: The head
quizzes.c: The base
quizzes.explain: Go under trailer and investigate the back of the fifth wheel. Make sure the fifth wheel jaws have closed around the shank of the kingpin.

quizzes.question: You need to use chocks when parking a trailer without spring brakes because
quizzes.a: if the air supply leaks away, there will be no brakes.
quizzes.b: you don't want the trailer rolling down a hill.
quizzes.c: some states require chocking of trailer wheels.
quizzes.explain: Trailers that do not have spring brakes have emergency brakes, which work from the air stored in the trailer air tank. A major leak in the emergency line will cause the tractor protection valve to close and the trailer emergency brakes to come on, but the brakes will hold only if there is air pressure in the trailer air tank. Eventually, the air will leak away and then there will be no brakes. Therefore, it is very important for safety that you use wheel chocks when you park trailers without spring brakes.

quizzes.question: You are coupling a tractor to a semi-trailer and have backed up but are not under  it. What need to you hook up before backing under?

quizzes.a: to disconnect the safety chains.
quizzes.b: to slowly pull clear of it.
quizzes.c: to lower its landing gear.

quizzes.question: Which of these will result in the best control on curves?
quizzes.a: Braking during the turn
quizzes.b: Slowing to a safe speed before entering the curve, then accelerate slightly during the curve
quizzes.c: Downshift after you enter the curve
quizzes.explain: Slow down to a safe speed, and downshift to the right gear before entering the curve. This lets you use some power through the curve to help the vehicle be more stable while turning.

quizzes.question: If you have to drive through deep puddles or flowing water, which of these need to you not do?
quizzes.a: Use a lower gear
quizzes.b: Increase engine rpm
quizzes.c: Drive though quickly
quizzes.d: Gently pressing the brake pedal while driving through the water.
quizzes.explain: Slow down and place transmission in a low gear. Gently put on the brakes. This presses linings against brake drums or discs and keeps mud, silt, sand, and water from getting in.

quizzes.question: When need to you check your mirrors while making a lane change?
quizzes.a: After signaling the change
quizzes.b: Right after starting the lane change
quizzes.c: After completing the lane change
quizzes.explain: Check your mirrors: Before you change lanes to make sure there is enough room. After you have signaled, to check that no one has moved into your blind spot. Right after you start the lane change, to doublecheck that your path is clear. After you complete the lane change.

quizzes.question: You are doing a walk around inspection of a double or triple trailer rig. You need to be sure the converter dolly air tank drain valves are _____ and the pintle hook is _____.
quizzes.a: Open, free
quizzes.b: Closed, latched
quizzes.c: Open, latched
quizzes.explain: Converter dolly air tank drain valve are closed, and make sure pintle hook is latched.

quizzes.question: In order, the four steps to test your trailer's service brakes are as follows
quizzes.a: Check for normal air pressure. Release the parking brakes. Pull forward slowly. Apply the trailer brakes, using the hand control if so equipped.
quizzes.b: Apply the trailer brakes, using the hand control if so equipped. Release the trailer's parking brakes. Check for normal air pressure. Pull forward slowly.
quizzes.c: Check for normal air pressure. Release the parking brakes. Apply the trailer brakes, using the hand control if so equipped. Step off the brakes and pull forward slowly.
quizzes.explain: Wait for normal air pressure, release the parking brake, move the vehicle forward slowly about five mph, and apply the brakes firmly using the trailers hand control. Note any vehicle pulling to one side, unusual feel, or delayed stopping action.

quizzes.question: If your test of the tractor protection valve is successful,
quizzes.a: the tractor protection valve control (trailer air supply control) will pop out or go from "normal" to "emergency."
quizzes.b: the parking brake valve will pop out.
quizzes.c: the low air pressure warning signal will come on.
quizzes.explain: The trailer air supply control also called the tractor protection valve control need to pop out or go from "normal" to "emergency" position when the air pressure falls into the pressure range specified by the manufacturer usually within the range of 20 to 45 psi.

quizzes.question: Why have to you inspect your double or triple combination vehicle more extensively than a vehicle with only one such semitrailer?
quizzes.a: Its design makes it more likely to have problems.
quizzes.b: There are more critical parts to check.
quizzes.c: The types of cargoes it carries make it more likely to have problems.
quizzes.explain: There are more things to inspect on a double or triple combination vehicle than on a single vehicle. Many of these items are simply more of what you would find on a single vehicle. For example, tires, wheels, lights, reflectors, etc. However, there are also some new things to check.

quizzes.question: How can you be sure you supplied air to a second trailer?
quizzes.a: Go to the rear of the second trailer and open the emergency line shut off
quizzes.b: Watch each trailers air gauge for a drop of 30 PSI
quizzes.c: Apply the hand valve at 10 MPH, you should stop in the same distance as a truck with one trailer at 5 MPH
quizzes.explain: Use the tractor parking brake and/or chock the wheels to hold the vehicle. Wait for air pressure to reach normal, then push in the red "trailer air supply" knob. This will supply air to the emergency (supply) lines. Open the emergency line shut-off valve at the rear of the last trailer. You need to hear air escaping, showing the entire system is charged.

quizzes.question: If a converter dolly has spring brakes, you release the brakes by
quizzes.a: opening the air tank petcock.
quizzes.b: using the dolly's parking brake control.
quizzes.c: doing both of the above.
quizzes.explain: Release dolly brakes by opening the air tank petcock, or, if the dolly has spring brakes, use the dolly parking brake control.

quizzes.question: To test the tractor protection valve, charge the trailer air brake system, turn off the engine, and
quizzes.a: flash your high-beam headlights on and off several times.
quizzes.b: keep pressing the brake pedal firmly.
quizzes.c: step on and off the brake pedal several times.
quizzes.explain: Charge the trailer air brake system. Shut the engine off. Step on and off the brake pedal several times to reduce the air pressure in the tanks. The trailer air supply control need to pop out or go from "normal" to "emergency" position when the air pressure falls into the pressure range specified by the manufacturer. Usually within the range of 20 to 45 psi.

quizzes.question: To uncouple the rear trailer, the first thing you do is
quizzes.a: park the vehicle in a straight line on firm level ground.
quizzes.b: park the vehicle at a 45-degree angle on an incline.
quizzes.c: park the vehicle at a 45-degree angle on level ground.
quizzes.explain: Park rig in a straight line on firm level ground.

quizzes.question: You are driving with double trailers and have to use your brakes to avoid a crash. For emergency braking you need to:
quizzes.a: Push the brake pedal as hard as you can and hold it there
quizzes.b: Use controlled or stab braking
quizzes.c: Use only the trailer brakes
quizzes.explain: You need to brake in a way that will keep your vehicle in a straight line and allow you to turn if it becomes necessary. You can use the controlled braking method or the stab braking method.

quizzes.question: The crack the whip effects trucks with trailers. Which of the following is most likely to tip over?
quizzes.a: The rear trailer of a triple
quizzes.b: The rear trailer of a double
quizzes.c: A full trailer behind a truck
quizzes.explain: Due to rearward amplification a double is twice as likely, and a triple is 3.5 times more likely to roll over than a five-axel trailer.

quizzes.question: Empty trucks:
quizzes.a: Require shorter stopping distances than full ones.
quizzes.b: May have poor traction due to bouncing and wheel lockup
quizzes.c: Are the easiest to stop since there is no shifting cargo

quizzes.question: A converter dolly consists of a ______ wheel and ________ axles.

quizzes.question: Converter dollies

quizzes.c: usually need a glad hand converter.

quizzes.question: During an inspection of a double or triple combination, check the usual things for any combination vehicle and check
quizzes.a: the fifth wheel and the landing gear.
quizzes.b: the trailers and the radios in the tractor.
quizzes.c: the shut-off valves, the converter dolly or dollies, and the air brakes on all trailers.
quizzes.explain: To inspect a double or triple, first inspect it just as you would inspect any combination vehicle. Then check that the shut-off valves are open on all trailers but the last trailer. Check each converter dolly to be sure that the pintle hook is properly latched.

quizzes.question: When parking your double or triple combination, you need to look for a parking space
quizzes.a: that you can pull straight through.
quizzes.b: that is as close as possible to your destination.
quizzes.c: that you can back out of.
quizzes.explain: Make sure you do not get in a spot you cannot pull straight through. You need to be aware of how parking lots are arranged to avoid a long and difficult escape.

quizzes.question: Double and triple combination vehicles are ________ stable than other types of commercial vehicles.
quizzes.a: less
quizzes.b: more
quizzes.c: neither more nor less
quizzes.explain: Take special care when pulling two and three trailers. There are more things that can go wrong, and doubles/triples are less stable than other commercial vehicles.

quizzes.question: You are driving a 100-foot twin trailer combination at 50 mph. The road is dry, and visibility is good. You need to keep at least _____ seconds of space ahead of you.

quizzes.c: Open, latched
quizzes.explain: Converter dolly air tank drain valve are closed, and make sure pintle hook is latched.

quizzes.question: You want to hook your combination to a second trailer that has no spring brakes. To do this without wheel chocks you need to:
quizzes.a: Supply air to the trailer air system with the tractor and then disconnect the emergency line
quizzes.b: Make sure the trailer will roll freely when coupling
quizzes.c: Hook the trailer electric cord to a portable generator for braking power
quizzes.explain: If the second trailer doesn't have spring brakes, drive the tractor close to the trailer, connect the emergency line, charge the trailer air tank, and disconnect the emergency line. This will set the trailer emergency brakes if the slack adjusters are correctly adjusted.

quizzes.question: The best way to keep brakes from overheating while going down a steep grade is to:
quizzes.a: Use only the trailer brakes
quizzes.b: Go 5 MPH below your safe speed
quizzes.c: Use stab braking
quizzes.explain: The use of brakes on a long and/or steep downgrade is only a supplement to the braking effect of the engine. The following are the proper braking techniques: Apply the brakes just hard enough to feel a definite slowdown. When your speed has been reduced to approximately five mph below your "safe" speed, release the brakes. When your speed has increased to your "safe" speed, repeat.

quizzes.question: A converter dolly is
quizzes.a: an electronic device that connects the electric power from a semitrailer to the rear of a tractor-trailer.
quizzes.b: a coupling device that connects a semitrailer to the rear of a tractor-trailer.
quizzes.c: a coupling device that converts the electricity between a semitrailer and a tractor-trailer for international trucking.
quizzes.explain: A converter gear on a dolly is a coupling device of one or two axles and a fifth wheel by which a semitrailer can be coupled to the rear of a tractor trailer combination forming a double bottom rig.

quizzes.question: Converter dollies:
quizzes.a: Often do not have spring brakes
quizzes.b: Have little braking power because they are small
quizzes.c: Usually need a glad hand converter
quizzes.explain: Converter dollies often do not have spring brakes.

quizzes.question: You need to check the height of the trailer before connecting a converter dolly to a second or third trailer. The trailer height is right when:
quizzes.a: The trailer will be raised slightly when the converter dolly is backed under it.
quizzes.b: The center of the kingpin lines up with the locking jaws

quizzes.question: When driving with more than one trailer, which trailer need to be the first one behind the tractor?
quizzes.a: The shortest trailer
quizzes.b: The heaviest trailer
quizzes.c: The lightest trailer
quizzes.explain: For the safest handling on the road, the more heavily loaded semitrailer need to be in first position behind the tractor. The lighter trailer need to be in the rear.

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about quick steering movements and doubles / triples is true?
quizzes.a: Doubles / triples flip over from quick steering movement easier than many other vehicles
quizzes.b: You should put on the brakes at the same time you perform quick steering movements
quizzes.c: Counter steering is easier with doubles / triples than with most other vehicles

Triples have a rearward amplification of 3.5 meaning you can roll the last trailer of triples 3.5 times as easily as a five-axle tractor. quizzes.question: You are visually checking the coupling of a converter dolly to the rear trailer. How much space need to be between the upper and lower fifth wheel?

quizzes.question: Coupling a triple trailer is different from coupling other combinations because
quizzes.a: you couple the third trailer to the second trailer before you couple them to the first trailer.
quizzes.b: you do not have to use a converter dolly.
quizzes.c: you couple the second trailer to the first trailer and then couple them both to the tractor.
quizzes.explain: A triple combination vehicle has four units (not counting the converter dollies): a tractor and three trailers. You couple a triple as follows: 1. Couple the first trailer to the tractor the same way that you couple any combination vehicle. 2. Couple the third trailer to the second trailer using the method for coupling doubles (which will involve the use of a converter dolly). 3. Move another converter dolly into position. 3. Couple the tractor and first trailer to the second and third trailer using the method for coupling doubles (which will involve another converter dolly).

quizzes.question: Which of these statements about handling of doubles and triples is true?
quizzes.a: A triple rig can stop quicker than a 5-axle tractor semi-trailer due to off tracking
quizzes.b: The rear trailer of a 100-foot triple is less likely to turn over than a single semi-trailer due to the crack the whip effect
quizzes.c: A sudden movement with the steering wheel can result in a tipped over rear trailer
quizzes.explain: To prevent trailers from rolling over, you have to steer gently and go slowly around corners, on ramps, off ramps, and curves. A safe speed on a curve for a straight truck or a single trailer combination vehicle may be too fast for a set of doubles or triples.

quizzes.question: With the hand valve on, you need to test the trailer brakes by opening the service line valve at the rear of the rig. When you do this, you need to hear:
quizzes.a: The emergency line valve open and release air
quizzes.b: The service brakes slowly move to the fully applied position
quizzes.c: Air escapes from the open valve

quizzes.question: Some large trucks have convex or spot mirrors.

quizzes.question: If your landing gear is power operated, you need to check for ________ during your walk-around inspection.

quizzes.question: You are driving a set of doubles, and a set of trailer wheels goes into a skid. Which of these is most likely to occur?

quizzes.a: Use the engine brake or speed retarder
quizzes.b: Keep other traffic out of you side space
