quizzes.explain: If equipped with a handicap lift, look for leaking, damaged, or missing parts and explain how lift need to be checked for correct operation. Lift have to be fully retracted and latched securely.

quizzes.question: When getting onto a highway you need to?
quizzes.a: Keep your eyes on the car in front of you and watch mirrors for gaps
quizzes.b: Watch for gaps
quizzes.c: Speed up
quizzes.explain: When entering a highway, you need to make sure there are no sudden changes by the car in front of you, while checking the mirrors for the proper gap to merge.

quizzes.question: During your vehicle inspection test, you have to check that the entry door is undamaged. Also check that it
quizzes.a: operates smoothly and closes securely from the inside.
quizzes.b: operates smoothly and closes securely from the outside.
quizzes.c: operates smoothly and closes securely by remote control.
quizzes.explain: Check that the entry door is not damaged, operates smoothly, and closes securely from the inside.

quizzes.question: A passive railroad crossing
quizzes.a: doesn't have a crossbuck sign.
quizzes.b: doesn't have any type of traffic control device.
quizzes.c: is a railroad crossing at which you don't have to stop.
quizzes.explain: This type of crossing does not have any type of traffic control device. You have to stop at these crossings and follow proper procedures. However, the decision to proceed rests entirely in your hands.

quizzes.question: At a railroad crossing, you have to stop at the stop line. If there is no stop line, you have to stop
quizzes.a: between 15 and 50 feet from the nearest rail.
quizzes.b: between 10 and 40 feet from the nearest rail.
quizzes.c: between 15 and 30 feet from the nearest rail.
quizzes.explain: Stop no closer than 15 feet and no farther than 50 feet from the nearest rail, where you have the best view of the tracks.

quizzes.question: What’s the "golden rule" for school buses when approaching and crossing railroad tracks?
quizzes.a: Stop, go, and stop.
quizzes.b: Stop, look, and listen.
quizzes.c: Stop, look, and turn on the emergency flashers.
quizzes.explain: At the Crossing: stop no closer than 15 feet and no farther than 50 feet from the nearest rail, place the transmission in Park, turn off all radios and noisy equipment, silence the passengers, open the service door and driver's window, and look and listen for an approaching train.

quizzes.question: As part of your post-trip inspection of your bus, check for each of the following EXCEPT
quizzes.a: damage or vandalism.
quizzes.b: personal belongings that were left on the bus.
quizzes.c: dirt or shoeprints on the floor.
quizzes.explain: Make sure that all emergency exits are not damaged, operate smoothly, and close securely from the inside.

quizzes.question: What do Anti-Lock Brakes do?
quizzes.a: Apply more breaking force to the front axle
quizzes.b: Help the breaks lock when they refuse to
quizzes.c: Prevent breaks from locking up when hard pressure is applied
quizzes.explain: ABS is a computerized system that keeps your wheels from locking up during hard brake applications.

quizzes.question: Front tire tread depth need to be at least?
quizzes.explain: Front axle or steer axel tires have to have a tread depth of at least 4/32 of an inch.

quizzes.question: When is the use of alcohol, tobacco, and non-prescription drugs allowed on the school bus?
quizzes.a: At any time
quizzes.b: Never
quizzes.c: Only when the bus driver says it is ok
quizzes.explain: The use of alcohol, tobacco, and non-prescription drugs need to not be allowed on the school bus.

quizzes.question: The left and right danger zones extend up to _______ from the left and right sides of the school bus.
quizzes.a: 10 feet
quizzes.b: 5 feet
quizzes.c: 20 feet
quizzes.explain: The danger zones may extend as much as 30 feet from the front bumper with the first 10 feet being the most dangerous, 10 feet from the left and right sides of the bus and 10 feet behind the rear bumper of the school bus.

quizzes.question: Is the bus driver allowed to pick up or discharge students at other than their assigned locations?
quizzes.a: Only if the school district allows and a written note from a parent has been received
quizzes.b: Only if the bus driver wants to
quizzes.c: Only one time a month can this be done
quizzes.explain: If the school district allows this, and there is a written note from the parent, then yes, the driver can discharge at another location.

quizzes.question: Students may never walk within how many feet of the bus at any time?
quizzes.explain: The danger zone is the area on all sides of the bus where children are in the most danger of being hit, either by another vehicle or their own bus. The danger zones may extend as much as 30 feet from the front bumper with the first 10 feet being the most dangerous, 10 feet from the left and right sides of the bus and 10 feet behind the rear bumper of the school bus.

quizzes.question: In addition to spare electrical fuses (if equipped), three red reflective triangles, and a working fire extinguisher, emergency equipment for a school bus includes
quizzes.a: a first-aid kit and a body fluid cleanup kit.
quizzes.b: a first-aid kit and alcohol.
quizzes.c: three flares and a bolt cutter.
quizzes.explain: In addition to checking for spare electrical fuses, three red reflective triangles, and a properly charged and rated fire extinguisher, school bus drivers have to also inspect the following emergency equipment: Emergency Kit Body, and Fluid Cleanup Kit

quizzes.question: The front danger zone extends up to ________ from the front bumper of the school bus.
quizzes.a: 30 feet
quizzes.b: 15 feet
quizzes.c: 50 feet
quizzes.explain: The danger zones may extend as much as 30 feet from the front bumper with the first 10 feet being the most dangerous, 10 feet from the left and right sides of the bus and 10 feet behind the rear bumper of the school bus.

quizzes.question: To load students after you have stopped the school bus,
quizzes.a: put the transmission in park or neutral and set the parking brake.
quizzes.b: count the number of students at the bus stop and make sure that all of them board the bus.
quizzes.c: load students two abreast when possible for efficiency.
quizzes.explain: Count the number of students at the bus stop and be sure all board the bus. If possible, know names of students at each stop. If there is a student missing, ask the other students where the student is.

quizzes.question: When is the most dangerous time during a bus ride?
quizzes.a: At a highway railroad crossing
quizzes.b: Loading and unloading students
quizzes.c: Crossing an intersection
quizzes.explain: When loading or unloading students they can be three times more likely to be injured.

quizzes.question: Most states require school bus drivers to take a physical examination
quizzes.a: annually.
quizzes.b: every 3 years.
quizzes.c: every 5 years.
quizzes.explain: Most states require school bus drivers to have an annual physical (including a vision test) to confirm that they are still fit to perform the duties of a school bus driver.

quizzes.question: The right front mirror need to be adjusted to see?
quizzes.a: The right front tire meeting the ground
quizzes.b: The right rear tire hub
quizzes.c: 200 feet behind the bus
quizzes.explain: Ensure that the mirrors are properly adjusted so you can see: The entire area in front of the bus from the front bumper at ground level to a point where direct vision is possible, direct vision and mirror view vision need to overlap, the right and left front tires touching the ground, and the area from the front of the bus to the service door.

quizzes.question: What do the red flashing lights on an eight-light system bus signify to other drivers?
quizzes.a: The school bus is stopped for a red light
quizzes.b: The school bus is stopped for a train crossing
quizzes.c: The school bus is stopped because it is broken down
quizzes.d: The school bus is stopped to pick up or discharge pupils
quizzes.explain: Red flashing lights on a school bus indicate that the bus is stopped to pick up or discharge students.

quizzes.question: Before you proceed through a railroad crossing, make sure that your bus will have enough containment to completely clear the railroad tracks. As a general rule, adequate containment is

quizzes.b: the length of the bus plus 10 feet.
quizzes.c: the length of the bus plus 25 feet.

quizzes.question: When can you put a misbehaving student off the bus?
quizzes.a: Never
quizzes.b: If the behavior is serious enough
quizzes.c: Only at school or the student's designated bus stop
quizzes.explain: Never put a student off the bus except at school or at his or her designated school bus stop. If you feel that the offense is serious enough that you cannot safely drive the bus, call for a school administrator or the police to come and remove the student.

quizzes.question: When you inspect the battery and battery box during your pre-trip vehicle inspection test, make sure that

quizzes.question: When loading or unloading students, you need to check your mirrors
quizzes.a: before entering traffic.
quizzes.b: constantly.
quizzes.c: after all students have entered or exited the bus.
quizzes.explain: Monitor all mirrors continuously.

quizzes.question: You have stopped your bus to load students. Before you signal them to approach the bus, you need to
quizzes.a: set the parking brake.
quizzes.b: check for traffic once more.
quizzes.c: turn on the alternating flashing red lights.

quizzes.question: What color are all school buses painted?
quizzes.a: National School Bus Glossy Yellow
quizzes.b: Orange-yellow
quizzes.c: Fluorescent yellow
quizzes.explain: The National Highway Transportation Safety Administration issued guidelines to the states on pupil transportation safety. One of these guidelines is that all school buses need to be painted National School Bus Glossy Yellow.

quizzes.question: An active railroad crossing is
quizzes.a: a railroad crossing that has a traffic control device.
quizzes.b: a railroad crossing without traffic control devices.
quizzes.c: a railroad crossing at which you don't have to stop.
quizzes.explain: This type of crossing has a traffic control device installed at the crossing to regulate traffic at the crossing. These active devices include flashing red lights, with or without bells and flashing red lights with bells and gates.

quizzes.question: Which of the following statements is true about students who have to cross in front of the bus after exiting it?
quizzes.a: The driver should make a U-turn, so those students won't have to cross in front of the bus after exiting it.
quizzes.b: When the driver signals that it is safe to proceed, the students should cross the street while remaining in the driver's view.
quizzes.c: When the driver signals that it is safe to proceed, the students should run across the street to reduce their exposure to danger.
quizzes.explain: Wait for your signal before crossing the roadway. Upon your signal, the students need to: Cross far enough in front of the school bus to be in your view.

quizzes.question: When leaving a freeway, you need to begin to slow down?
quizzes.a: 100 feet in advance
quizzes.b: 300 feet in advance
quizzes.c: 500 feet in advance
quizzes.explain: You need to start to slow down at least 100 feet in advance.

quizzes.question: When driving a school bus in high winds, you need to
quizzes.a: tailgate a big truck so it can shield you from the wind.
quizzes.b: speed up to get away from the wind as quickly as possible.
quizzes.c: keep a strong grip on the steering wheel and try to anticipate gusts.
quizzes.explain: Strong winds affect the handling of the school bus! The side of a school bus acts like a sail on a sailboat. Strong winds can push the school bus sideways. They can even move the school bus off the road or, in extreme conditions, tip it over.

quizzes.question: Which school bus accidents need to be reported?
quizzes.a: All
quizzes.b: Only those involving injury or death
quizzes.c: None
quizzes.explain: All school bus accidents have to be reported whether or not they involve death, injury, or property damage.

quizzes.question: The school buses stop arm is to only be operated with the:
quizzes.a: Yellow warning and red warning lights
quizzes.b: Yellow warning lights
quizzes.c: Red warning lights
quizzes.d: Whenever the driver wants to stop traffic
quizzes.explain: Activate alternating red lights when traffic is a safe distance from the school bus and ensure stop arm is extended.

quizzes.question: In most states, school buses are equipped with ________ warning light system to control traffic at school bus stops.
quizzes.a: an eight-light
quizzes.b: a four-light
quizzes.c: a six-light
quizzes.explain: Federal regulations require school buses to be equipped with a warning light system. Each bus have to have two flashing red lights in front and two in the rear, and optionally two flashing amber lights in front and two in the rear.

quizzes.question: When approaching a railroad crossing you need to turn on the hazards?
quizzes.a: At least 100 feet from the railroad crossing
quizzes.b: At least 200 feet from the railroad crossing
quizzes.c: At least 300 feet from the railroad crossing
quizzes.explain: Activate hazard lights approximately 200 feet before the crossing. Make sure your intentions are known.

quizzes.question: The convex, crossover, and flat mirrors need to be viewed
quizzes.a: in a logical sequence to ensure that a child or object is not in any of the danger zones.
quizzes.b: every 4 seconds.
quizzes.c: every 10 seconds and more often in heavy traffic.

quizzes.question: Who is the person responsible for the daily pre-trip bus inspections?

quizzes.b: The schools bus mechanic and the bus driver
quizzes.c: The schools designated pre-trip inspection person
quizzes.explain: The bus driver is responsible for preforming the pre-trip inspection daily.

quizzes.question: When approaching a school bus stop, you need to
quizzes.a: activate your alternating flashing amber lights.
quizzes.b: check all mirrors constantly.
quizzes.c: do both of the above.
quizzes.explain: When approaching the stop, you need to: approach cautiously at a slow rate of speed; look for pedestrians, traffic, or other objects before, during, and after coming to a stop; continuously check all mirrors; activate alternating flashing amber warning lights at least 200 feet or approximately 5-10 seconds before the school bus stop or in accordance with state law.

quizzes.question: When several students are exiting the bus, the driver need to count the students, if one is missing?

quizzes.b: Ask the other students if they have seen the missing student
quizzes.c: Get off the bus and locate the student

quizzes.question: If a railroad crossing signal is malfunctioning, you need to

quizzes.b: call your dispatcher and ask for instructions.

quizzes.question: Which of the following statements about the special dangers of loading and unloading is true?

quizzes.c: Tell students not to use the handrail when exiting the bus because they could get caught.

quizzes.question: When checking the lights at the front of the vehicle what need to you check for?

quizzes.question: What lights will you need to check on the exterior?

quizzes.c: Left turn, right turn, headlights high and low beam, running, and clearance lights.

Please remember to check each at the front of the vehicle except brake lights, all but headlights and brake lights on both sides, and all except headlights at the back of the vehicle. If this is a combination vehicle check the rear of the tractor for all except headlights.

quizzes.question: What need to the water temperature gauge do when you start the vehicle?

quizzes.b: Rise immediately.
quizzes.c: Nothing, then rise slowly as the vehicle warms up.

quizzes.question: At the rear of the tractor there are still a few things to check, what are they?

quizzes.c: Air lines, ICC bumper, and reflectors.
quizzes.d: Mud flaps, air lines, and ICC bumper.
quizzes.explain: The only things you needed to check at the rear of the tractor are the light lens covers, reflectors, and the mud flaps.

quizzes.question: When you check the Fuel tank you can also say you would check the same items on the air tanks. What need to these two items be checked for?
quizzes.a: Securely mounted, and no leaks
quizzes.b: Securely mounted, mounting bands and rubber grommets in good condition, lines between the tanks secure with no damage, and no leaks from the tanks or the lines.
quizzes.c: Securely mounted, mounting bands in good condition, lines between the tanks secure with no damage, and no leaks from the tanks or the lines.
quizzes.d: Securely mounted, mounting bands in good condition, lines between the tanks secure with no damage, and no leaks from the tanks.
quizzes.explain: Please make sure that you point at or touch both tanks to insure you receive credit for them, and they both need checked for security, bands and grommets, the lines between tanks, and leaks.

quizzes.question: To test the service brake test you will need to have the trailer air supply valve in, parking brake in, and the hand brake  released. How do you test the service brake?
quizzes.a: Pull against the service brake with no movement.
quizzes.b: Pull against the service brake with a little movement.
quizzes.c: Move quickly and apply the service brake to stop the vehicle.
quizzes.d: Move slowly and apply the service brake to stop the vehicle.
quizzes.explain: Moving slowly, less than 5 MPH, and apply the service brake with steady pressure. The vehicle need to come to a smooth and even stop with no pull to one side or the other.

quizzes.question: Steps leading into the vehicle need to be?
quizzes.a: Properly mounted.
quizzes.b: Properly mounted and not damaged.
quizzes.c: Properly mounted, not damaged, and all bolts tight and secure.
quizzes.d: Strong enough to support twice your weight.
quizzes.explain: Make sure the steps are properly mounted, no damage, and bolts are present and secure.

quizzes.question: You need to check to make sure that the locking jaws are completely wrapped around the shank of the kingpin during your pre-trip inspection?
quizzes.a: TRUE
quizzes.b: FALSE
quizzes.explain: This is true. The kingpin needs to be completely extended and around the shank of the kingpin.

quizzes.question: Brake drums (or discs) have to not have cracks longer than:
quizzes.a: 1/2 the width of the friction area.
quizzes.b: One inch across in a straight line.
quizzes.c: No cracks are allowed.
quizzes.explain: The area where the brake shoes touch the drum is considered the friction area, there need to be no cracks 1/2 the width of that area.

quizzes.question: The leaf springs, shocks, U-bolts, shackles, and air bags are part of what system?
quizzes.a: The coupling system.
quizzes.b: The safety system.
quizzes.c: The suspension system
quizzes.explain: These are all components of the suspension system and will need checked independently in your pre-trip exam.

quizzes.question: Brake drums?
quizzes.a: Are not out of round and have no illegal welds.
quizzes.b: No cracks, or illegal welds.
quizzes.c: Not out of round, no illegal welds, and no cracks.
quizzes.explain: Make sure they are not misshapen (out of round), no illegal welds, and no cracks.

quizzes.question: The apron is the metal plate welded on the bottom of the trailer that gives the 5th wheel a smooth surface for vehicle connection. What need to you check the apron for?
quizzes.a: That it is not bent, damaged, cracked, and that it is securely mounted.
quizzes.b: That it is not bent, and that it is securely mounted.
quizzes.c: That it is not bent, damaged, or cracked.
quizzes.d: That it is not bent, damaged, or cracked, has no illegal welds, and that it is securely mounted.
quizzes.explain: The apron itself need to not be bent, cracked, or damaged. It will be welded to the bottom of the trailer, but it need to not have welds on the surface that the 5th wheel contacts, and it need to be securely mounted.

quizzes.question: You don't have to make both the air and city horns work to get credit for them.
quizzes.a: TRUE
quizzes.b: FALSE
quizzes.explain: You need to make both the air and city horns work to get credit for checking them.

quizzes.question: Should you do an overview of your vehicle as you approach it (including looking for leaks, leaning, or excessive damage)?
quizzes.a: Yes
quizzes.b: No
quizzes.explain: Overviews give you a chance to catch major problems early.

quizzes.question: Which of the following is not an engine compartment belt?
quizzes.a: Power steering belt.
quizzes.b: Water pump belt.
quizzes.c: Safety belt.
quizzes.explain: The safety belt secures the driver in the cab.

quizzes.question: To test air leakage the air valves need to be?
quizzes.a: Trailer air supply in, parking brake in, trolley released, and pressure on brake pedal.
quizzes.b: Trailer air supply out, parking brake in, trolley released, and pressure on the brake pedal.
quizzes.c: Trailer air supply in, parking brake out, trolley released, and no pressure on the brake pedal.
quizzes.d: Trailer air supply in, parking brake in, trolley applied, and pressure on the brake pedal.
quizzes.explain: To properly test the air leakage you will need trailer air supply in to supply air to the trailer, parking brake in filling the red line with air, steady pressure applied to the brake pedal filling the blue line with air, and the trolley released so no extra air is supplied to the blue line.

quizzes.question: What need to you remember to check while exiting the vehicle?
quizzes.a: Handrails and steps.
quizzes.b: Fuel tanks and air tanks.
quizzes.c: Condition of the exterior cab.
quizzes.explain: Best to make sure you check the handrails, steps, fuel tank, and air tanks at this time.

quizzes.question: You need to mention you would check all light covers and reflectors for damage on the side of the vehicle, both the tractor and the trailer, again to cover the side since you have only checked the front at this time?
quizzes.a: TRUE
quizzes.b: FALSE
quizzes.explain: This is true, on each side of the vehicle you need to check the light lenses and reflectors, and you need to get credit for both the tractor and the trailer if you tell the examiner you would check both at this time. The lenses and reflectors need to be mounted, clean, and not damaged or missing.

quizzes.question: The next step is the CDL air brake test. This portion is done with the engine off, but need to you have air pressure built up to governor cut of 120-140?
quizzes.a: Yes.
quizzes.b: No
quizzes.explain: Yes, the pressure need to be built up to governor cutoff to ensure you have enough air pressure to complete the CDL air brake test.

quizzes.question: Is it best to check the seat and the seatbelts before sitting down?
quizzes.a: Yes.
quizzes.b: No.
quizzes.explain: We suggest checking the seat and belt for securement and damage before sitting down. You will be in a hurry, and it is best to mention them when you see them.

quizzes.question: Air chambers are?
quizzes.a: Part of the braking system.
quizzes.b: Where air is stored for use.
quizzes.c: Not on a commercial vehicle.
quizzes.explain: Also called brake chambers, they are found on most commercial vehicles, and filled with air to apply the brakes.

quizzes.question: Items inside the cab you have to make function in order to get credit for them are?
quizzes.a: Windshield wipers.
quizzes.b: Air and city horns.
quizzes.c: Blower motors, temperature control, and diverter, lights.
quizzes.explain: If you just mention the wipers and do not check to make sure they work you will not get credit for them. This is true with all the answers here.

quizzes.question: When checking the windshield, what need to you be looking for?
quizzes.a: That the windshield is there, not cracked or chipped.
quizzes.b: That the windshield is there, not cracked or chipped, clean, the seals are in good condition, and not leaking.
quizzes.c: That it is clean, and not leaking.
quizzes.explain: Mentioning the windshield and checking it for cracks, chips, and cleanliness is not enough. You will have to check the seals and for leaks to get it marked as checked.

quizzes.question: The rest of the axels on the vehicle are nearly the same as the front steer axels, with a few differences. What are the differences?
quizzes.a: Torsion bar, space between the tires or spacers, and air bags.
quizzes.b: Torsion bar, treads, space between the tires or spacers, and air bags.
quizzes.c: Torsion bar, treads, and air bags.
quizzes.d: Tread depth, space between the tires or spacers, and air bags.
quizzes.explain: There are FOUR differences between the steer axel, and the tractor and trailer axels. They are the Torsion bar, the space between the axels so bud rims or spacers, tread depth changes from four thirty seconds to two thirty seconds, and retreads are allowed on every axel but the steer axel, and the air bags portion of the suspension.

quizzes.question: What need to you check each of the fluids in the engine compartment for?
quizzes.a: Proper level.
quizzes.b: Clean of debris.
quizzes.c: Not leaking.
quizzes.explain: All fluids need to be at the proper level, clean, free of debris, with no leaks. You can also add proper color to this list. Some coolants are red, green and orange. Red or clear for most power steering. Oil can be difficult, it need to be tan in color, but normally after use of the vehicle it gets black.

quizzes.question: Hoses in the engine compartment need to be checked for?
quizzes.a: Cracks, frays, and tears, leaks
quizzes.b: Connections tight and secure.
quizzes.c: Welds.
quizzes.explain: Make sure the lines are connected and secure, no frays, cracks, tears, and no leaks to get hoses marked off. The trick is you need to say horses for the air compressor, power steering, water pump independently to get credit.

quizzes.question: Differences between the steer axel and the rest of the axles are: tread depth, spacers or budding rims, space between the tires, torsion bars, and air bags.
quizzes.a: True.
quizzes.b: False
quizzes.explain: Steer axels are as simple as an axel can get. They only have one tire on each side, so no spacers, space, or bud rims are required. The tread depth is different from any other axel, and it usually does not have a torsion bar or air bags.

quizzes.question: You can leave the hood open when moving on with the pre-trip.
quizzes.a: True.
quizzes.b: False.
quizzes.explain: Open the hood to do the engine compartment,  and close it before walking away. You need to never leave the engine compartment with the hood open.

quizzes.question: Exterior lights that need checked are on which side of the vehicle?
quizzes.a: Front of vehicle, rear of vehicle.
quizzes.b: Front of vehicle, both sides of vehicle, and rear of vehicle.
quizzes.c: Front of vehicle, and both sides.
quizzes.d: Answer B plus rear of tractor in combination vehicles.
quizzes.explain: Lights will need to be checked on the front, both sides, rear of tractor on combination vehicles, and the rear of the vehicle.

quizzes.question: Most 5th wheels are adjustable for weight distribution and turn clearance, these are called sliding 5th wheels, they have a release are that needs to be completely in and locked, and a locking mechanism. What locks the 5th wheel in place?
quizzes.a: Locking jaws
quizzes.b: Springs
quizzes.c: Air
quizzes.explain: Locking pins extend through holes in the platform to lock the sliding 5th wheel in place.

quizzes.question: Handrails need to be checked for?
quizzes.a: Mounted
quizzes.b: Tight and secure
quizzes.c: All bolts in place
quizzes.explain: Handrails will need to be tight and secure, properly mounted, all bolts in place, and no excessive damage.

quizzes.question: Which gauge need to be between 12-14, and in the green?
quizzes.a: Voltmeter.
quizzes.b: Water temperature.
quizzes.c: Air pressure.
quizzes.explain: The voltmeter need to be between 12-14, and in the green to be working properly.

quizzes.question: Before you leave the inside can you need to not check the exterior lights.
quizzes.a: True.
quizzes.b: False.
quizzes.explain: It is best to check the lights before getting out, and it will allow the air pressure to build back up if you safely restart the engine.

quizzes.question: When checking the air and electrical lines between the tractor and the trailer what need to you be checking for?
quizzes.a: The connections and lines.
quizzes.b: The connection at the tractor, the lines for breaks cracks frays, and the connection to the trailer.
quizzes.c: The connection at the tractor, the lines for breaks cracks frays, the connection to the trailer, and that none of these are leaking.
quizzes.explain: Make sure to check the connection at the tractor, the lines for breaks cracks frays, the connection to the trailer, and that none of these are leaking. Group them together at the tractor, between the vehicle, and at the trailer to make this part go quickly.

quizzes.question: To test air leakage the air valves need to be?
quizzes.a: Trailer air supply in, parking brake in, trolley released, and pressure on brake pedal.
quizzes.b: Trailer air supply out, parking brake in, trolley released, and pressure on the brake pedal.
quizzes.c: Trailer air supply in, parking brake out, trolley released, and no pressure on the brake pedal.
quizzes.d: Trailer air supply in, parking brake in, trolley applied, and pressure on the brake pedal.
quizzes.explain: To properly test the air leakage you will need trailer air supply in to supply air to the trailer, parking brake in filling the red line with air, steady pressure applied to the brake pedal filling the blue line with air, and the trolley released so no extra air is supplied to the blue line.

quizzes.question: During the CDL air brakes tests the first step is to check for air leakage?
quizzes.a: TRUE
quizzes.b: FALSE
quizzes.explain: It is best to check the air leakage rate first or you will have to rebuild pressure after draining tanks to make sure the trailer air supply and parking brake set on their own.

quizzes.question: Which of the following does not get checked in the engine compartment?
quizzes.a: Oil level
quizzes.b: Oil pressure
quizzes.c: Power steering fluid
quizzes.explain: Oil pressure is checked on the inside of the cab using the oil pressure gauge.

quizzes.question: Hand rails and steps need to be checked for?
quizzes.a: Security.
quizzes.b: Damage.
quizzes.c: Supports weight.
quizzes.explain: The handrails and step need to be secure, not damaged, and able to support the weight you are applying to them when entering the vehicle.

quizzes.question: Checking the mirrors on the outside of the vehicle you need to check for?
quizzes.a: Properly mounted.
quizzes.b: No cracks.
quizzes.c: Clean.
quizzes.explain: Don't forget you can have mirrors on the hood, and on the doors of the cab. While outside check for mounts, cracks, and cleanliness. You need to also check them again when inside the vehicle to make sure they are properly adjusted.

quizzes.question: In the engine compartment there are four major belt or gear driven components. What are they?
quizzes.a: Power steering pump, fuel pump, alternator, water pump.
quizzes.b: Power steering pump, fuel pump, alternator, air compressor.
quizzes.c: Fuel pump, alternator, air compressor, water pump.
quizzes.d: Power steering pump, alternator, air compressor, and water pump.
quizzes.explain: It is best to check all your belt and gear driven components, but the power steering, alternator, air compressor, and water pump are all that appear on the CDL pre-trip.

quizzes.question: Brake lines need to be checked for?
quizzes.a: Connections tight and secure.
quizzes.b: No frays, cracks, or damage.
quizzes.c: No signs of leaks.
quizzes.explain: As with all hoses, make sure the connections are tight and secure. That there are no frays, cracks, or damage to the lines with no leaks. With an airline leaks can be found by suspicious clean spots on the hose.

quizzes.question: Tires need to be checked for?
quizzes.a: Cuts, cracks, and bulges.
quizzes.b: Cuts, cracks, bulges, and depth.
quizzes.c: Cuts, cracks, bulges, and inflation.
quizzes.d: Cuts, cracks, bulges, depth, and inflation.
quizzes.explain: Tires need to not have any cuts, cracks, or bulges. You will need to make sure the tire pressure is up to manufacturer specifications, and that it has the proper tread depth.

quizzes.question: Brake pads need to be checked for?
quizzes.a: At least a 1/4 of an inch of life left.
quizzes.b: Not worn dangerously thin.
quizzes.c: Not cracked or broken.
quizzes.explain: All answers are true. They need to have at least a 1/4 inch of life left on the brake pad, since they can wear unevenly also check that they are not dangerously thin, and no cracks or breaks.

quizzes.question: After the engine compartment it is best to move to the driver's side of vehicle, and then head into the cab.
quizzes.a: True.
quizzes.b: False.
quizzes.explain: This is true. It is best to get to the inside cab early. If you do not make it to the inside can you can automatically fail for not doing the CDL air brakes test.

quizzes.question: At the side of the cab you need to not check.
quizzes.a: Steps into the vehicle.
quizzes.b: Fuel and air tanks.
quizzes.c: Mirrors.
quizzes.explain: All these items will all appear on your CDL pre-trip. The correct answer is none of these.

quizzes.question: The kingpin is a cylindric piece of metal protruding down from the apron, it has a base which is near the apron, shank or the narrow section of the kingpin where the locking jaws connect, and the head or the part furthest from the apron. What need to you check the kingpin for?
quizzes.a: Not bent or damaged, no cracks, and no illegal welds.
quizzes.b: Securely mounted, no cracks, and no illegal welds.
quizzes.c: Securely mounted, not bent or damaged, no cracks, and no illegal welds.
quizzes.d: Securely mounted, not bent or damaged, and no cracks.
quizzes.explain: The kingpin is part of what holds the tractor and trailer together, it needs to be straight with no damage. You need to not have any cracks in the metal, and there need to not be any welds on the visible portion of the kingpin.

quizzes.question: All rims have a spacer.
quizzes.a: True.
quizzes.b: False.
quizzes.explain: The front axle does not have a spacer because it does not have dual tires on each side. Also bud rims are made so that there is no need for a spacer. Only on Dayton setups would you have a spacer.

quizzes.question: The fuel and air tanks are checked for the same items except?
quizzes.a: The cap.
quizzes.b: No leaks.
quizzes.c: Mounting brackets and bolts.
quizzes.explain: Both the fuel and air tanks need to be checked for proper mount, no leaks, and good hoses. Only the fuel tank will have a cap so you may fill the tanks.

quizzes.question: Check your mirrors from the inside of the cab for?
quizzes.a: Mounts.
quizzes.b: Adjusted so that you can see.
quizzes.c: Clean.
quizzes.explain: If you checked them for mounts, cracks, and clean while outside of the vehicle there is no need to state those again. Adjustment can only be checked from the driver's seat, but if you forgot to mention the mirrors on the outside of the vehicle you can check them now for everything.

quizzes.question: What are a few items you want to check while between the tractor and trailer?
quizzes.a: Frame, catwalk, exhaust, and driveshaft.
quizzes.b: Frame, catwalk, exhaust, cab mounts, and driveshaft.
quizzes.c: Frame, catwalk, and exhaust.
quizzes.d: Frame, catwalk, exhaust, and cab mounts.
quizzes.explain: Frame needs checked for cracks, bends, illegal welds, that it is secure, and mounting bolts. Catwalk needs to be in good condition with all mounting bolts in place. Exhaust needs to be secure; all pipes and connections need to be secure and free of leaks. The driveshaft needs to be properly mounted, tight sand secure, u-joints in good condition and move freely, and there is no excessive play.

quizzes.question: The 5th wheel is mounted on the back of the tractor, it lifts the trailer slightly when it contacts the apron when you are coupling the vehicles, and it houses the locking jaws which wrap around the shank of the kingpin to securely attach the trailer. True or False: The 5th wheel need to be greased, no illegal welds, not damaged, and tilt with enough pressure.
quizzes.a: TRUE
quizzes.b: FALSE
quizzes.explain: This is true. The 5th wheel tilts so that the coupling can withstand unlevel surfaces, it cannot have welds or cracks, and needs to be secure.

quizzes.question: Next you need to fan the brakes down to make sure all air brake safety devices are working, but what need to you do before starting to fan the brakes?
quizzes.a: Turn on your lights.
quizzes.b: Make sure the vehicle is in neutral.
quizzes.c: Turn the key on so that the instrument warning lights come on.
quizzes.explain: You will need to have the key on to accessory or to the position right before you start the vehicle. This needs to be done so that the alarm and light for the low air warning can come on alerting of low air pressure. If the light and alarm does not come on when you are taking your test you may automatically fail.

quizzes.question: Step 1 of the CDL air brake tests makes sure the leak rate of the red and blue line is not unsafe. With the parking brake released and the brake pedal applied the leak rate need to be no more than?
quizzes.a: 3 PSI for a vehicle with no trailer, and 3 PSI for a combination vehicle in one minute.
quizzes.b: 3 PSI for a vehicle with no trailer, and 4 PSI for a combination vehicle in one minute.
quizzes.c: 2 PSI for a vehicle with no trailer, and 3 PSI for a combination vehicle in one minute.
quizzes.d: 2 PSI for a vehicle with no trailer, and 2 PSI for the tractor plus 1 PSI for each trailer in a combination vehicle in one minute.
quizzes.explain: The air leak rate need to be no more than 2 PSI for the red line, 1 PSI for the blue line. In a non- combination vehicle that is 3. For a combination vehicle you will need to add 1 PSI for the trailer bringing the total to 4.

quizzes.question: In the engine compartment there are four fluids you have to check, they are?
quizzes.a: Windshield wiper fluid, oil, coolant, and moisture or leaks.
quizzes.b: Transmission fluid, oil, coolant, and power steering fluid.
quizzes.c: Moisture or leaks, oil, coolant, power steering fluid.
quizzes.explain: It is best to check all your fluids during a pre-trip inspection, but the fluids you have to say are oil, coolant, power steering, and checking for moisture and leaks.

quizzes.question: The 5th wheel has a release arm built into the side of it, it automatically locks the jaws around the kingpin when you connect the vehicles, but it can be pulled out to release the locking jaws for uncoupling. What’s the correct position of the release arm when the vehicle is coupled?
quizzes.a: completely in with the locking mechanism secured.
quizzes.b: completely out with the locking mechanism secured.
quizzes.c: completely in with the locking mechanism released.
quizzes.d: completely out with the locking mechanism released.
quizzes.explain: The release arm needs to be pushed completely in with the locking mechanism secured. You want to make sure this is secure because if it is not the trailer might break free of the locking jaws.

quizzes.question: The engine belts need to be checked for?
quizzes.a: Excessive play.
quizzes.b: Cracks, frays, and tears.
quizzes.c: Overheating.
quizzes.explain: Check each belt individually. There can be belts for a few different components under the hood. The excessive play of more than 3/4 of an inch.

quizzes.question: To test the parking brake you need to have the trailer air supply in, trailer hand break released, and the parking brake _____?
quizzes.a: In
quizzes.b: Out
quizzes.c: Released
quizzes.explain: The parking brake will need to be out or engaged to test the parking brake.

quizzes.question: Retreaded tires can be on any axel.
quizzes.a: True.
quizzes.b: False.
quizzes.explain: The front or steer axel is not allowed to have retreaded tires.

quizzes.question: The 5th wheel platform needs to be checked for?
quizzes.a: Tight and secure, properly mounted, and there are no illegal welds.
quizzes.b: Tight and secure, all the bolts are in place and secure, and there are no illegal welds.
quizzes.c: Tight and secure, properly mounted, all the bolts are in place and secure, not excessively damaged, and there are no illegal welds.
quizzes.d: Tight and secure, properly mounted, and all the bolts are in place and secure.
quizzes.explain: The platform needs to be free of illegal welds, be tight and secure, properly mounted, not damaged, and all bolts need to be in place and secure.

quizzes.question: The hub oil seal need to be?
quizzes.a: Filled to the proper level.
quizzes.b: All bolts tight and secure.
quizzes.c: Seal is in good condition and not leaking.
quizzes.explain: Some hub oil seals will have a plastic or glass area, so you are able to tell that the oil is at the proper level. If there is not an area to view the oil it will still need to be said. It will have several bolts, and they need to be tight and secure. Also, the seal needs to be in good condition and not leaking.

quizzes.question: Before you start the vehicle you need to check?
quizzes.a: The vehicle is in neutral.
quizzes.b: Parking brake is set.
quizzes.c: Seat belt is fastened.
quizzes.explain: Making sure the vehicle is in neutral, parking brake set, and seat belt on is steps to a safe start of the vehicle. You need to also apply the clutch if equipped before starting.

quizzes.question: These are all gauges that will need checked except?
quizzes.a: Air pressure gauge.
quizzes.b: Oil pressure gauge.
quizzes.c: Voltmeter.
quizzes.explain: We do not check the water pressure gauge, instead you need to check the water temperature gauge.

quizzes.question: What need to you check the steering linkage for?
quizzes.a: All castle nuts are tight and secure.
quizzes.b: Cotter pins in place.
quizzes.c: No excessive play.
quizzes.explain: Along with the castle nuts, cotter pins, and excessive play you can check for illegal welds and cracks.

quizzes.question: What interior lights do you need to check?
quizzes.a: Instrument panel lights. High beam indicator light.
quizzes.b: Left and right turn indicator lights.
quizzes.c: Hazard indicators lights.
quizzes.explain: You will need to check and make each light indicator work in order to get credit. While you are checking lights, it might not be a bad idea to check the dome light as well.

quizzes.question: You need to check rims for dents, cracks, illegal welds, valve stem, and that they are tight and secure.
quizzes.a: True.
quizzes.b: False.
quizzes.explain: Rims need to not have dents, cracks, illegal welds. This is a great time to mention your valve stem since it comes through the rim, and the rims need to be tight and secure.

quizzes.question: The first thing you need to check or do when you sit in the driver's seat is?
quizzes.a: Start the vehicle.
quizzes.b: Turn on your lights.
quizzes.c: Buckle your seatbelt.
quizzes.explain: As soon as you sit in the driver's seat please buckle your seatbelt. If you move the vehicle at all without your seatbelt fastened it is an automatic fail.

quizzes.question: Air chambers need to be checked for?
quizzes.a: Tight and secure.
quizzes.b: Not leaking.
quizzes.c: Not damaged.
quizzes.explain: Also called brake chambers, they need to be mounted tight and secure, not excessively damaged, and not leaking.

quizzes.question: When doing the pre-trip, you need to tell the examiner each item you are checking and 2-3 things you check each item for.
quizzes.a: True.
quizzes.b: False.
quizzes.explain: Try not to overdo the item or what you are checking it for. You only get 30 minutes to check everything on the vehicle.

quizzes.question: What are the main components of the steering controls found in the engine compartment?
quizzes.a: Upper steering linkage, gearbox, tie rod ends, and tie rod.
quizzes.b: Upper steering linkage, universal joints, tie rod ends, tie rod.
quizzes.c: Upper steering linkage, universal joints, power steering pump, pitman arm, drag link, tie rod ends, tie rod.
quizzes.d: Upper steering linkage, universal joints, pitman arm, tie rod ends, tie rod.
quizzes.explain: The steering linkage consists of upper steering linkage, universal joints, power steering pump, pitman arm, drag link, tie rod ends, tie rod. They will all need checked separately.

quizzes.question: Tire tread depth depends on the axel. The depth need to be no less than ______ for the steer axel, and _____ for any other axel.
quizzes.a: 1/2-inch, 1/4 inch
quizzes.b: 4/32-inch,  2/32 inch
quizzes.c: 1/8-inch, 1/16 inch
quizzes.explain: All tread depth needs to be said in thirty-seconds. The front axle or steer axel have to have at least 4/32, and the rest of the axles can have no less than 2/32.

quizzes.question: When opening the hood, you need to check?
quizzes.a: The hinges, catches, and springs.
quizzes.b: The important stuff is under the hood, so nothing.
quizzes.c: For damage.
quizzes.explain: The hood will always need checked, mainly for damage, but don't forget the hinges, catches, and springs or you might not get credit.

quizzes.question: The air pressure in a commercial vehicle need to rise to governor cutout of?
quizzes.a: 120 PSI.
quizzes.b: 160 PSI.
quizzes.c: 100 PSI.
quizzes.explain: Air pressure need to rise to between 120-140 PSI.

quizzes.question: Lug nuts (that hold the rim to the axle) need to be checked for?
quizzes.a: Tight and secure.
quizzes.b: No worn or stripped threads.
quizzes.c: No rust marks (from the lug nuts to the outside of rim).
quizzes.explain: Lug nuts need to be tight and secure, no stripped or worn threads. The rust marks will start at the best of the lug nut and run to the outside of the rim  and indicate a loose lug nut.

quizzes.question: The slack adjuster is part of the braking system, what is the maximum play allowed with the brakes off?
quizzes.a: 1/4 of an inch.
quizzes.b: 1/2 of an inch.
quizzes.c: 3/4 of an inch.
quizzes.explain: There need to be no more than 1 inch of play in any slack adjuster on the vehicle, with the brakes off.

quizzes.question: Testing the parking brake requires you to?
quizzes.a: Move the vehicle slowly and then apply the parking brake stopping the vehicle.
quizzes.b: Pull against the engaged parking brake with no movement.
quizzes.c: Pull against the engaged parking brake with some movement.
quizzes.d: Move the vehicle quickly and then apply the parking brake stopping the vehicle.
quizzes.explain: The vehicle will need to be stopped with parking brake applied, and the trailer air supply pushed in. Put the vehicle in gear and gently pull against the parking brake with no movement.

quizzes.question: While fanning down the alarm and light indicating low air pressure need to come on at?
quizzes.a: 100 PSI
quizzes.b: 80 PSI
quizzes.c: 60 PSI
quizzes.explain: The low air pressure warning light and alarm need to come on when the air pressure is around 60 PSI.

quizzes.question: The steering wheel need to be checked for?
quizzes.a: No play.
quizzes.b: No play exceeding 2" or 10 degrees.
quizzes.c: That it turns.
quizzes.explain: Steering wheels need to not have more than 2" of play or 10 degrees in a 20" wheel.

quizzes.question: What items are part of your safety equipment?
quizzes.a: Fire extinguisher.
quizzes.b: Reflective triangles. Road flares.
quizzes.c: All of these
quizzes.explain: All these items are part of your safety equipment.

quizzes.question: Fanning the brakes down further after the alarm and buzzer come on need to result in the parking brake popping out for a single vehicle, and the parking brake and the trailer air supply popping out for a combination vehicle at?
quizzes.a: 20 PSI
quizzes.b: 40 PSI
quizzes.c: 50 PSI
quizzes.explain: The parking brake for vehicles with no trailer, and the parking brake and trailer air supply valve for combination vehicles need to set or pop out at 40 PSI.

quizzes.question: When coupled there need to be a slight gap between the 5th wheel and the apron, meaning you need to be able to see light between the two.
quizzes.a: TRUE
quizzes.b: FALSE
quizzes.explain: To have a properly connected vehicle there can be no gap between the 5th wheel and the apron. If there is a gap you need to disconnect the tractor, lower the front of trailer, and recouple the tractor. A gap could mean the locking jaws went around the head of the kingpin instead of the shank. This is dangerous because a large bump may cause the trailer to lift, and the kingpin to slide out of the locking jaws.
